Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Este Comité se formo gracias a la Sra. Maria Rumilda González que además de ser la coordinadora general del grupo, ella también es presidenta de la comisión vecinal “Villa Maravilla” del barrio donde reside.

Rumilda junto con sus vecinas se acercaron a la Fundación Paraguaya y se informaron sobre el programa comité e mujeres emprendedoras y fue así como comenzaron con su trabajo como comité. Las señoras que conforman este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades, entre ellas podemos citar: venta de bebidas gaseosas y jugos, carbón, chipa (comida típica paraguaya), shampoo y cremas, lencería (ropa interior), venta de ropas, almohadones, y kioscos.

Ellas además de mantener sus hogares, también ahorran y realizan trabajos para la mejora de su barrio, uno de sus grandes logros fue lograr que la Municipalidad de la ciudad construya un puente y un muro de contención para la canalización del agua que pasa frente a las casas de las señoras.

Solicitan el crédito para la compra de mercaderías varias para sus ventas, como carbón, leche, panificados, carne, ropas para damas, cremas, shampoo, etc.

loans.use: Purchase various supplies for their businesses to sell, such as charcoal, milk, bread, meat, women's clothing, lotions, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón has an upholstery shop where he maintains and lines vehicle interiors. His wife is a street vendor, and in this way, they manage to use their principal income to cover the college education costs of their children. They live in the 16 de Julio Zone in the city of El Alto.

The credit is necessary for the purchase of a computer for his children who are at the public university and also for the purchase of raw materials for his shop like upholstery, thread, and other materials.

This is his second credit through Kiva. His good record with the institution authorizes him to be approved for another loan. His previous credit was paid off before the final payment date.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Simón tiene su taller de tapicería en el cual realiza mantenimiento y forrado de interiores de vehículos en general; la esposa es comerciante ambulante y de esta manera logran sus ingresos principales con los que cubren la educación universitaria de sus hijos; viven en la Zona 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito es requerido para la compra de una computadora para sus hijos que están en la universidad publica y también para comprar materia prima para el taller, como ser tapices, hilos y otros materiales.

Es el segundo crédito vía Kiva, el buen antecedente con la institución le faculta aprobarle otro préstamo. El crédito anterior con Kiva ha sido cancelado antes de la fecha final de pago.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of upholstery, thread, and other items; also for the purchase of a computer for his children

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es:
Gerbacio works as a small builder of homes. This is his source of income that he uses to support his four small children of 11, 9, 7, and 4 years of age. He serves as both father and mother to his children because his wife no longer lives with them, and only their grandmother helps with caring for the children. He lives in the Villa Ingenio zone in the city of El Alto.

This credit is necessary for him to make some repairs to his home, and this will also help him have a better quality home for his children.

This is his fifth credit with Impro. His good payment record authorizes him to obtain another loan. Gerbacio is an old client of our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gerbacio trabaja como pequeño constructor de viviendas familiares (albañil), es su fuente de ingreso con los que mantiene a sus cuatro pequeños hijos de 11, 9, 7 y 4 años de edad, hace las veces de padre y madre para sus hijos pues la esposa ya no vive con ellos y solamente la abuela ayuda con el cuidado de los niños; vive en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito es requerido para refacción de su pequeña vivienda familiar, misma que le ayudara a tener mejor calidad de hábitat para sus hijos.

Es el quinto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta acceder a otro préstamo. Gervasio es cliente antiguo de nuestra Institución.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana Del Carmen Perez R. is married and has two sons attending college. Her business is a little convenience store in Chichigalpa, which she has owned for 13 years. As she told us, when she completed sixth grade she had to leave school for economic reasons and started working.

Since the opening of her store she has been an excellent businesswomen. She has successfully managed her business and produced enough income to maintain her family and put her kids through college.

Doña Anita has been working with CEPRODEL for four years, she is very happy with the loans she got, they came in times of need. The loans helped her keep her business running and keep her clients happy. She has completed 20 loans to date.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana del Carmen P. R. es casada y con 2 hijos en la universidad, el negocio de ella es una pequeña pulpería ubicada en Chichigalpa. Actualmente tiene 13 años de tener este negocio. Según cuenta, estudió hasta el sexto grado pero por las dificultades económicas no continuó con sus estudios por lo que tuvo que abandonarlos y dedicarse al trabajo.

Desde que inicio con la pulpería se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena comerciante debido a que siempre esta constante en el negocio y además ha sabido mantener su hogar y el estudio de sus dos pequeños hijos.

Doña Anita trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 20 créditos.

loans.use:
Purchase Inventory

Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: José Otilio

texts.es:
Jose Otilio Santa Maria has a carpentry business, which he has run with a lot of effort for the last 30 years, located in the city of Chinadega in Chichigalpa. At an early age he was exposed to this line of work, he worked in a woodshop for a long time and he told us that this has been the only source of income for him and his family. Furthermore with the income he receives he is putting his older daughter through college.

Jose Otilio has a well deserve recognition in the area, he manages to keep excellent customers with his good work and high quality. Jose Otilio has been with CEPRODEL for four years and his very satisfied with the loans he has received, they all have come when he needed them the most. The loans helped him get the material needed for his business and this made him able to meet the deadlines for his clients and keep funding his daughter’s college career. He has repaid eight loans to date.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el señor José Otilio S. G. es un taller de ebanistería que con mucho sacrificio ha venido desarrollando desde hace 30 años en la ciudad de Chinandega en Chichigalpa. Desde muy pequeño ha tenido experiencia en lo que respecta a este trabajo, ya que por muchísimo tiempo trabajó en un taller y nos cuenta que este negocio ha sido el único sustento para el y su familia. Además por medio del negocio beneficia a su hija que es estudiante universitaria.

Un merito muy grande que ha tenido el señor Otilio es que ha logrado captar varios clientes en su zona debido a que los trabajos de ebanistería los realiza muy finamente y con alta profesionalidad. Don José Otilio trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues se los han brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del taller de ebanistería y de esta manera poder satisfacer los pedidos de los clientes y seguir manteniendo los estudios universitarios de su hija. Actualmente tiene un record de 8 créditos.

loans.use:
Compra de madera y herramientas

Purchase wood and tools

loans.name: Mazbut

texts.en:
Mazbut D. is 60 years old. He and his wife have raised six children.

Mazbut has a small vendor kiosk, which he has operated for 10 years. Mazbut sells a very wide range of goods, including cookies, chewing gum, candies, and household articles such as detergents, washing liquids, toothpaste, and brushes. Because of this, his kiosk is very popular in his neighborhood and brings in a stable income.

Mazbut requests 1,300 somoni (about $375.00 in US dollars) in order to increase the range of goods he sells, to include items such as foodstuffs and household goods. This is Mazbut's first loan; however, he promises to pay the loan in a timely manner, in 12 months.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Upon the onset of her mother’s spinal related illness seven years ago, Margarita decided to start a business in her home that would allow her to care for her mother and still help her husband with family finances. This is how she came to open a small store.

At first she sold only jello, fruit-flavored ice-cream, popcorn, soft drinks, and beer; however, thanks to the financing provided through EDAPROSPO, she was able to expand her business two years ago. She is steadily buying more products.

If she is given the opportunity, Margarita would like to convert the first floor of her house into a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Al enfermar su madre de la columna, hace 7 años, Margarita pensó poner en su casa un negocio que le permitiera cuidarla y además ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar; fue así como abrió una pequeña tienda. Al comienzo solo vendía gelatinas, helados de fruta, palomitas de maíz, gaseosas y cerveza; pero gracias al financiamiento de EDAPROSPO hace dos años pudo ampliar su negocio, comprando cada vez más productos. De tener la oportunidad, a Margarita le gustaría convertir el primer piso de su casa en un mini mercado.

loans.use: To convert the first floor of her house into a mini-market

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Seven years ago, Flor de María started selling food to the workers of a furniture factory near her home. Although this business was going well for her, she decided to put in three internet workstations in her home because she was tired of cooking.

Unfortunately, a little while ago, somebody stole the memory of the three computers. She has had to borrow some other memory to keep working because she didn't have enough money to replace them.

This inconvenience hasn't stopped Flor de María; what's more, she plans to expand her business by offering photocopying and phone booth services.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 7 años, Flor de María vende comida a los trabajadores de una fábrica de muebles cercana a su vivienda. Aunque le va bien en este negocio, decidió poner hace 3 meses cabinas de Internet en su casa pues ya estaba cansada de cocinar.

Lamentablemente, hace poco tiempo, le robaron la memoria de tres computadoras; por lo que ahora ha tenido que prestarse algunas para poder continuar trabajando ya que no tiene dinero suficiente para reponerlas.

Este inconveniente no ha detenido a Flor de María, es más piensa ampliar su negocio brindando servicios de fotocopiado y poniendo locutorios.

loans.use: To expand her business by offering photocopying and phone booth services

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
When Giovanna gave birth to her first child, she left behind her work as an accountant at a beauty products company in order to take care of him.

That is how she started 10 years ago a business selling gas door-to-door. She started the business together with a family friend because there was a lack of gas offer. The business allowed Giovanna to financially help her husband, who is a sailor, to sustain their 2 sons.

Giovanna sells the gas door to door, pushing a little car around the area of San Juan de Lurigancho, where she lives.

Even though the business is doing well, she and her husband would like to set-up an Accounting’s Office in the 3rd floor of their house. In order to reach this objective, she would need 2000 soles (700 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando Giovanna tuvo su primer hijo dejó su trabajo como contable en una empresa de productos de belleza para cuidarlo; pero esto no significó que ella dejara de trabajar. Es así como hace 10 años puso, con la ayuda de un amigo de la familia, un negocio de venta de gas a domicilio al ver que no había uno similar cerca de su casa. De esta manera Giovanna ayuda económicamente a su esposo marino a mantener a sus 2 hijos menores.

Jalando un pequeño carrito, Giovanna reparte gas en los alrededores de su casa en San Juan de Lurigancho. A pesar que le va bien, junto a su esposo quisieran poner un estudio contable en el tercer piso de su casa. Para poder lograr este sueño necesitarían de 2 mil soles.

loans.use: Giovanna had worked as an accountant before and would like to set up an Accounting's Office

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lê Thị M., 46, has been raising cows for the last 7 years. She raises cow for beef and also for breeding. This is a stable business because beef price is always on the rise, thus it provides her family a steady income. But it requires a lot of capital to buy cows. She has 2 children who are attending school, the school fees/expenses are high. In order to raise capital for her business, Mrs M. joined TYM fund branch 4  Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Her husband is a farmer,  he is very supportive of her about this. Her family income is about 200 USD a month. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy a few cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị M., 46 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi được 7 năm nay. Chị chuyên chăn nuôi bò sinh sản và bò thịt phục vụ cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Đây là một nghề mang lại lợi nhuận tương đối ổn định vì giá bò luôn có xu hướng tăng. Tuy nhiên để mua bò cần một số vốn tương đối lớn. Hai con chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học, chi phí cao nên nhu cầu vốn càng cao. Để có nguồn vốn hỗ trợ chị đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương tại chi nhánh 4 Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chồng chị, một người nông dân hiền lành chất phác rất ủng hộ ý định này của vợ. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình là 200USD. Vòng vốn này chị M. rất muốn vay 1200USD từ Quỹ để mua thêm vài con bò và bán ra khi được giá.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L., 54 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Kim Động, Hưng Yên province. Her main activity is poultry farming. She has been in this activity for 5 years. It is hard work but brings stable monthly income of 220USD. Her flock is more than 100 now. She is applying a L. of 1200USD to expand her business, buy feed and young stock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 54 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và ba con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Công việc chủ yếu hiện nay của chị là chăn nuôi gà, vịt, ngan. Chị L. làm nghề này được 5 năm nay. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng mang lại thu nhập khá ổn định. Số lượng gia cầm của chị L. đã lên đến hơn 100 con. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của chị là 220USD. Chị đang xin vay 1200USD từ Quỹ để mua thức ăn gia cầm và con giống.

loans.use: Buy ducks and food for them

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thắm, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên province. She tends a general store at home. She’s been doing this for 10 years now. Store has a lot of customers due to her pleasant personality and she keeps expanding it. Her first loan was 125USD. The limit now increases to 8-900USD. This time she applies for a loan of 950USD to ready her store for the up coming Tết. Her monthly income is 200USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Thắm, 36 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên. Công việc của chị là bán hàng tạp hóa. Luôn nhiệt tình phục vụ khách hàng nên cửa hàng của chị Thắm thu hút được rất đông khách. Sau 10 năm quy mô cửa hàng đã thay đổi nhiều so với trước, mức vốn vay từ Quỹ đầu tư cho việc mua hàng tăng từ 125USD lên 800-900USD. Vòng vốn này chị Thắm xin vay 950USD để mua thêm nhiều hàng phục vụ cho người dân trong dịp Tết. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Thắm là 200USD/tháng

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thêu, 55 years old, has been with the TYM Fund for 10 years. Her husband passed away long time ago. She raises three children by herself. She confides to her friends that having all children grown up and become good people is everything to do with the Fund. She brews rice liquor and tends pigs. Byproduct from the brewer is used to feed pigs. Money from liquor sales is used to pay loan installments and money from pigs sales is used for big spending items. She is applying for a loan of 1200USD to by more piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Thêu, 55 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương đã được trên 10 năm. Chồng chị mất từ lâu, một mình chị lam lũ, vất vả nuôi 3 con trưởng thành. Chị tâm sự để có được như ngày hôm nay là nhờ rất nhiều vào Quỹ Tình thương. Từ những món vay lớn trả dần giúp chị thuận lợi trong việc phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Công việc chính của chị Thêu là nấu rượu và chăn nuôi lợn. Bã rượu được chị tận dụng làm thức ăn chăn nuôi nên tiết kiệm được một phần chi phí thức ăn gia súc. Tiền bán rượu giúp chị trả tiền tuần. Thu nhập từ bán lợn giúp chị có một khoản tiền chi cho những dự định lớn. Vòng vốn tới chị tiếp tục xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm lợn con và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and foods for them

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Hải is 51 years old. She lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband and their 30 years old son. Her main occupation is raising calves and piglets. Usually she buys calves and piglets, stocks them then resells after a couple of months. Each year, she sells about 4 batches. and makes a profit of 500 USD each round. Her husband and son help her out with everything. She wishes to obtain a loan of 950 USD this time to expand her animal husbandry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Hải, 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai năm nay 30 tuổi. Gia đình chị sống tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Công việc chính của chị là chăn nuôi lợn, bò. Thường chị Hải đi mua lợn con và bê về nuôi, sau đó vài tháng bán lại khi được giá. Một năm trung bình chị bán ra 4 lứa, mỗi lần thu về khoảng 500USD. Chồng và con trai chị luôn giúp đỡ chị đắc lực trong mọi công việc gia đình. Chị mong muốn tiếp tục được vay 950USD để mua bò và lợn con nhằm mở rộng dự án chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy calves and pigs

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi N., 35 years old, is living in Luong Bang town, Hung Yen with her husband and 2 children. Before, like many other local residents, she did business on breeding animals. Her family income back then was only enough for living cost. In recent years, along with the local development, local residents’ needs increased and as a result, Mrs. N. decided to open a grocery store. This activity brings her a decent income and is very convenient for her to repay weekly. After 2 years of doing business, her average income is 150 USD/month. She is borrowing 950 USD to buy more merchandises and expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Nhạn, 35 tuổi, sống tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Hưng Yên cùng chồng và 2 con. Trước đây như phần lớn người dân trong vùng, công việc chủ yếu của chị là chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập cũng đủ cho những chi tiêu trong gia đình nhưng kinh tế chưa có nhiều thay đổi. Những năm gần đây cùng với sự phát triển của thị trấn, nhu cầu hàng hóa của người dân tăng lên Chị Nhạn quyết định mở một cửa hàng bách hóa. Công việc này mang lại thu nhập khá và cũng thuận lợi với việc trả tiền tuần. Sau 2 năm bán hàng mức thu nhập bình quân của chị Nhạn là 150USD/tháng. Chị đang làm hồ sơ xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng, mở rộng hoạt động kinh doanh của mình.

loans.use: Buy goods for general store

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi D., 47 years old, is one among the very first members of the TYM Fund. In 1992, she borrowed 20 USD to buy pigs. By doing business on pigs, her family life became better. Then, she used other borrowed money to invest in breeding poultries. In 2000, unfortunately, her husband passed away. Since then, her life became very difficult. Yet, being hard-working, she overcame the difficulties to raise her children to maturity. In 2004, her oldest son got married and is living separately. Since joining the TYM Fund, she is very reliable and is promoted to become the Local Manager by other women. Her current activity is selling groceries like fruits, candies, dried food. She wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more merchandises. Her current income is 180 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Đào, 47 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên tham gia đầu tiên của Quỹ Tình Thương. Năm 1992, chị xin vay vòng 1 với mức vay 20USD mua lợn giống. Từ việc chăn nuôi lợn, kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển hơn, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi gà, vịt đẻ trứng. Năm 2000, chồng chị không may qua đời. Từ đó, những khó khăn chồng chất đè nặng lên vai chị, nhưng với phẩm chất chịu thương chịu khó vượt lên tất cả để nuôi con trưởng thành. Năm 2004 chị đã xây dựng gia đình cho con trai lớn và làm cho cháu ngôi nhà ra ở riêng. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay chị luôn đựoc chị em tín nhiệm bầu vào các chức dạnh Quản lý cụm. Hoạt động kinh doanh hiện tại của chị Đào là bán hoa quả, bánh kẹo, hàng khô. Chị đang làm đơn xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng bán. Mức thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị: 180USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy fruits, and more merchandises

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi C., 49 years old, is living with her husband and 5 children in Quang Tien, Soc Son. She joined the Fund in 2001 and borrowed 30 USD to do business in clothes. Since the Noi Bai industrial park developed, the workers started to rent houses in the area. Realizing their increasing needs for information and entertainment, in 2004, Mrs. C. talked to her husband to run an Internet Café. Using her saving money and money borrowed from the Fund, she bought 10 computers for her business. Her family income increases significantly. The income is 400 USD/month. After 3 years of business, her desktops are old. So, Mrs. C. wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more computers and upgrade her Internet Café.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Chính, 49 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại xã Quang Tiến, Sóc Sơn. Chị tham gia Quỹ năm 2001 và vay 30USD đầu tư vào dự án buôn bán quần áo. Từ khi khu công nghiệp Nội Bài phát triển, công nhân của khu công nghiệp tập trung nhiều thuê nhà ở trong thôn. Nhận thấy nhu cầu giải trí và tìm kiếm thông tin trên mạng ngày càng nhiều, nên năm 2004, chị Chính đã bàn với chồng mở cửa hàng kinh doanh dịch vụ Internet. Từ những đồng vốn vay của Quỹ cộng với số tiền tích lũy được chị mua 10 dàn máy vi tính phục vụ người có nhu cầu. Thu nhập của gia đình tăng lên đáng kể, bình quân một tháng là 400USD. Sau 3 năm hoạt động dàn máy tính đã cũ nên chị Chính xin vay 1200USD mua thêm máy và một số thiết bị để nâng cấp cửa hàng.

loans.use: Buy computers

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla has her own small manufacturing and sales business. She makes bedding material and other things and then sells them in her kiosk at one of the busy markets in Kharkiv, eastern Ukraine. Alla has been doing this for about five years and her business has become quite successful. Her recent profit in a typical month has been around $1700. Alla is married and has one son.

Alla has requested a loan of $1000 to increase her business capital. She has benefited in the past with several loans from Nadiya Ukraine and has proven to be a reliable loan client. We are happy for another opportunity to assist her in further developing her business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
When the TYM Fund became active in Bac Ha village in 1995, although there were many women joining, Mrs. Ngo Thi T. was still undecided and pondered on how to use the borrowed money effectively and how to repay weekly. After a while, she believed she could do it. She talked to her husband and joined the Fund in 1996. The first time, she borrowed only 30 USD to buy 3 pigs. Then, her family earned a decent amount of money from selling pigs. Being confident, she continued to improve her pig-breeding plan and as a result, her family started to have a better life. In 2000, she expanded her pig-breeding plan into breeding poultries, pigs, hens, and her income increased day by day. In 2005, she and her husband decided to send their oldest child to a vocational school and he/she now is working abroad. In her breeding farm, there are always 6 pigs, 700 hens and 1000 chickens. This is a great source of food for local residents to prepare for the upcoming Tet holiday. Her family current income is 420 USD/ month. She is borrowing 1200 USD from the Fund this time to buy more chicken and pig-feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Khi Quỹ Tình Thương triển khai hoạt động tại thôn Bắc Hạ năm 1995 đã có rất nhiều chị em tham gia vay vốn, nhưng chị Ngô Thị Tấc còn đắn đo suy nghĩ vay vốn làm sao để phát huy được hiệu quả đồng vốn và hàng tuần hoàn trả cho tốt. Sau một thời gian chị thấy nhiều chị em tham gia được thì mình cũng làm được. Chị bàn bạc với chồng và năm 1996 chị xin vào Quỹ. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 30USD mua 3 con lợn. Sau một thời gian số tiền bán lợn mang lại cho gia đình một khoản thu nhập kha khá. Vững tin vào bản thân chị tiếp tục phát triển mô hình chăn nuôi, kinh tế gia đình ngày một đầy đủ hơn. Năm 2000 chị mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi với qui mô lớn hơn với các loại gà thịt, gà đẻ trứng, lợn thịt, thu nhập từ chăn nuôi ngày càng cao. Năm 2005 anh chị đã cho người con đầu đi học nghề và cháu hiện đang làm việc tại nước ngoài. Trong chuồng nhà chị Tấc luôn có 6 con lợn, 700 con gà đẻ trứng và 1000 con gà thịt. Đây là một nguồn thực phẩm lớn cung cấp cho người dân trong vùng trong dịp Tết này. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình hiện nay là 420USD/tháng. Chị đang xin vay 1200USD từ Quỹ để mua thức ăn cho đàn gà, lợn của mình

loans.use: Buy foods for pigs, chickens

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena S. is divorced and lives in Ivano-Frankivsk with her 12-year-old son. She owns a small business selling women’s lingerie at the central city mall called “Prikarpattya”. Olena offers a huge assortment of inventory and the range of prices is quite diverse too. A loan she received from Nadiya Ukraine promoted the growth of her business. Olena has been in the trade for 10 years. Currently, she has about $8000 in inventory. Her monthly income is about $1400.

Olena’s business is the only source of income for her family. After the birth of her son, Olena worked as a market vendor and then started her small venture in the central city mall. Today she would like to get a loan of $600 to buy a variety of lingerie wholesale for further retail sale. One of her dreams is to give her son the chance to get good college education which is why she is ready to work long hours to generate more profits and be able to afford it.

loans.use: To purchase inventory wholesale

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi R. is single. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Valeryi works as a taxi driver. He has always loved cars and wanted to work with vehicles. His elder brother is a taxi driver too and Valeryi has followed in his footsteps. Flexibility and customer friendly service are some of the reasons Valeryi’s business has been so popular in the community. Valeryi has received and promptly repaid all of his loans from Nadiya Ukraine with no defaults. He has been in this business for 1.5 years. His current daily profit is about $40-50.

Valeryi would like to receive a loan of $400 to repair his vehicle and install new technology that will help his car run on methane gas. A reliable car that consumes little fuel will enable him to serve more clients, handle tough competition and expand his business. Profits generated will not only promote continued growth for Valeryi’s business but will also provide him with a good and stable income.

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has a successful business making uniforms and selling them at her market kiosk. Simple uniforms are widely used for many different occupations in Ukraine. From medical personnel, retail employees, and market vendors to school children, gas station attendants and cleaning staff, uniforms are used by many people and are part or the identity of many workers. Victoria has been making uniforms for much of her life. Her skill and experience has allowed her to develop a profitable business and lead her competition. Victoria hopes one day to expand her business to the point where she can work with large buyers.

Victoria  has requested a loan of $1000 that she will be able to use as working capital to invest in her business and increase her inventory. We are grateful for the opportunity to help this hard-working entrepreneur make a better future for herself and her family.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a teenage son. She lives in Dneprorudnyi with her family. Yelena owns a small business in the market selling lamp stands, bulbs, chandeliers, etc. She has a big assortment of inventory in her kiosk. Yelena has been in the trade for about 3 years. Currently, her monthly profit is about $1000. 

Yelena decided to start this business to make her investment in the family budget. Her husband works as a coal miner and has a good salary, however, Yelena wanted to learn how to do business and be financially independent as an entrepreneur. She is very energetic and willingly invests all of her energy in her business, working long hours every day. We believe this current loan to increase her business capital will help Yelena reach the kind of success she is seeking to achieve.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Shuhrat K., 56, is married and has 5 children. Shuhrat owns a taxi in Dushanbe. He plans to use this loan to purchase and install natural gas-based fuel system on his car. With gas prices rapidly rising, having natural gas-based engine would help Shuhrat save money on fuel and pass on the savings to his customers. Shuhrat plans to repay this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кенджаев Хушвахт, возраст – 56 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Хушвахт имеет атомашину на которй работает по найму и в свободной от работы время подрабатывает, оказывакя услуги такси населению города Душанбе. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение газового оборудования и установку его на свой автомобиль. Так как цены на бензин растут очень быстро, также и цена за проезд растёт. Данный кредит поможет ему установить газовое оборудование и снизить цену на проезд в такси всем жителям Душанбе, которые захотят воспользоваться услугами такси. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase and install natural gas-based fuel system

loans.name: Jaloliddin

texts.ru:
Jaloliddin M., 44, is married and has 6 children. For 10 years, Jaloliddin has been buying, raising, and selling cattle. Since finding another job has been hard, cattle farming has been Jaloliddin’s main source of income. Jaloliddin plans to use this loan to purchase a few young animals, raise and then resell them. Jaloliddin plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Меликов Джалолиддин, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Джалолиддин занимается разведением и продажей мелкого и крупного роагтого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Так как в настоящее время трудно найти работу, это является его источником получения дохода для содержание семьи. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести несколько голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота для откорма и продажи. На вырученные деньги он будет приобретать молодой скот, а полученную прибыль будет использовать на погашение кредита и содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina belongs to the Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay community bank and she sells groceries both wholesale and retail. Her business is located on the fairgrounds of the Yungay district and province in the Ancash department.

With her previous loan valued at 2,000 sols, she improved both her business and her income. Currently she has two different stands, one in Yungay and another in Tarica. With the 3,000 sol loan, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will purchase more wholesale goods (10 sacks of sugar, 10 sacks of rice, 20 boxes of oil and 5 boxes of condensed milk).

Alejandrina is 48 years old, a widow and a mother of four. With her income, she supports her children, who also contribute to the business. Her goal is to keep expanding her and her children’s businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por mayor y menor. El negocio está ubicado en el campo ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 2,000 incrementó tanto el negocio como sus ingresos. Actualmente cuenta con dos puestos de venta, uno en el distrito de Yungay y el otro en el distrito de Tarica. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes al por mayor (10 sacos de azúcar, 10 sacos de arroz, 10 cajas de aceite y 5 cajas de leche gloria).

Alejandrina tiene 48 años, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos. Con los ingresos que tiene apoya a sus hijos, quienes también tiene este negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo con su negocio y la de sus hijos.

loans.use:
To purchase groceries (sugar, rice, oil and milk)

Compra de abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, aceite y leche)

loans.name: Eneyda

texts.es:
10 years ago Eneyda started her business selling typical food (from the Peruvian jungle) at her house’s doorstep. Indeed, she is a very hard working woman and the economical need pushed her to start this business.

Before having the food business, she would wash clothes for others and she would help her husband at his carpenter's workshop. Nevertheless, when her husband hurt his back, Eneyda started to sell food and as sole infrastructure, she had a grill, a table and a batan (a kitchen utensil from Peru made in stone). Still, she has a good eye for business and that is why she would like to open a store at her house or to put a roof on the 2nd floor in order to rent rooms. Indeed, there is a high demand of housing in the area as a University will open soon right in front of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Las necesidades económicas hicieron que Eneyda, hace 10 años, pusiera un pequeño puesto de platillos típicos de la selva peruana en la puerta de su casa. Y es que ella siempre fue una mujer trabajadora. Antes de este negocio, lavaba ropa y ayudaba a su esposo en su carpintería. Pero cuando su esposo se lesionó la columna, Eneyda comenzó a vender sus productos solo una parrilla chica, una mesa y un batán. La visión de Eneyda para los negocios no tiene límites. Por eso, le gustaría poner un bazar en su casa o, en caso contrario, techar el segundo piso de su vivienda para poder alquilar cuartos ante la inmensa demanda que hay por la zona y la próxima inauguración de una universidad frente a su casa.

loans.use: She would like to open a store at her house or to put a roof on the 2nd floor in order to rent rooms

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor is a member of the Las Mercedes community bank and the owner of an animal hospital located in the Carhuaz district and province in the department of Ancash.

With the loan valued at 2,000 sols, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase 5 boxes of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamins and D.-worming agents to prevent anthrax.

Flor is 54 years old, the mother of 3, and her husband also contributes to the business. Their income allows them to pay for their children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Flor pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes, tiene una veterinaria que está ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 5 cajas D. vacunas, antibióticos, vitaminas y desparasitantes para prevenir el ántrax.

Flor tiene 54 años D. edad, tiene 3 hijos, es casada y su esposo la apoya en este negocio. Sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use:
Purchase of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamins, etc.

Compra de vacunas, antibióticos, vitaminas, etc

loans.name: Sulaymon

texts.ru:
Sulaymon D., 47, is married and has 4 children. He owns a small food store. Sulaymon has been in business for 8 years. He plans to use this loan to increase the assortment of goods sold in his store. Sulaymon plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Дустов Сулаймон, возраст – 47 лет, образование среднее, по специальности – товровед, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Сулаймон имеет небольшой магазин по продаже продуктов питания. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 8 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Получив кредит, Сулаймон увеличит ассортимент продаваемого товара и местные жители будут иметь возможность приобретать у него необходимые продукты питания. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods sold

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne is a member of the local bank Las Mercedes. She works selling shoes, sneakers, and jewelry that she buys wholesale in Lima. She runs her business out of her home, in the district and province of Carhuaz, in the Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 2,000 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy 2 dozen shoes, a dozen boots, and a variety of jewelry. Ivonne is 45 years old, married to a police officer, and mother of 3. She and her husband both work to provide their children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

L. señora Ivonne pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes. Se dedica a L. venta de zapatos, zapatillas y joyas que compra al por mayor en L. ciudad de Lima. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará 2 docenas de zapatos y una docena de botas, además de una variedad de joyas. Ivonne tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es policía. Ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy shoes, boots, and jewelry

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
When Dionisia Moved to San Juan de Lurigancho, she realized that in her new neighborhood they were no stores. That’s why for the last ten years she has a store in which she doesn’t only sells drinks, candies and snacks, she also sells bread, fruits and vegetables.

It wasn’t easy at the beginning, Dionisia had a small house and her business was a little kiosk right next to her house and she sold her bread door to door. Thanks to the support of EDAPROSPO she managed to expand her store and with the income of her business she helped her husband build a new house.

If she obtains the loan she wants to expand her store or build a bookstore / bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando Dionisia se mudó a San Juan de Lurigancho, se dio cuenta que no había una tienda por su barrio. Es por eso, que desde hace 10 años tiene una tienda en la que no solo vende abarrotes, gaseosas y golosinas; sino también, panes, frutas y verduras.

No fue fácil al inicio. Dionisia tenía una casa precaria por lo que su tienda era un pequeño kiosco al lado y el pan lo vendía de puerta en puerta. Gracias al apoyo de EDAPROSPO pudo implementar su tienda y con los ingresos que ésta le ha dado ha ayudado a su esposo a construir su casa.

De tener un financiamiento, a Dionisia le gustaría ampliar su tienda o poner una librería- bazar.

loans.use:
Open a bookstore/bazaar

Poner una librería/bazar

loans.name: Judy

texts.es:
Judy belongs to the local bank Las Mercedes. She works making recycled cardboard tubes that are used to make fireworks. Her business is located in the district and province of Carhuaz, in the Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 1,500 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a master roll and a bag of powder to make fireworks. Judy is 48 years old, married, and works with her husband. They have 3 children, and both Judy and her husband work to provide them an education.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judy pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes. Se dedica a la producción de tubos de cartón reciclado para ser utilizados en la pirotecnia (producción de juegos artificiales). El negocio está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagará en 6 meses, comprará un rollo de guía y una bolsa de pólvora para la producción de juegos artificiales. Judy tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo. Tienen 3 hijos y tanto Judy como su esposo trabajan para educarlos.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is a member of the local bank Las Mercedes. She works selling food at the weekly markets that are held in the district and province of Carhuaz, in the Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 1,500 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy cooking oil, 2 bags of rice, 3 bags of potatoes, and 4 packages of a variety of noodles. Maria is 44 years old. She lives with her husband who has temporary jobs. They have one son. The income that she earns allows them to pay household expenses and for the education of their only child.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes. Se dedica a la venta D. comidas en la feria semanal que se desarrolla en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará un balD. D. aceite, 2 sacos D. arroz, 3 sacos D. papa y 4 paquetes D. fideos surtido. Maria tiene 44 años D. edad, es conviviente y su esposo trabaja eventualmente, y tienen un hijo, los ingresos que genera les permite solventar los gasto D. su hogar y la educación D. su único hijo.

loans.use: To buy cooking supplies (cooking oil, rice, potatoes, and noodles)

loans.name: Aleksey

texts.ru:
Aleksey K., 24, is married and has 1 child. Aleksey sells spare parts. For that he rents a small store in Kurgan-Tyube. Aleksey has been in business for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to increase inventory of spare parts in his store. Aleksey plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кононюк Алексей, возраст – 24 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 1-го ребёнка. Алексей занимается торговлей запчастей. Для этого он арендует небольшой магазин в городе Курган-Тюбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение запчастей для автомобиля. Этот кредит поможет ему увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара, а местные владельцы транспортных средств будут иметь возможность приобрести необхдимые запчасти для своих автомобилей. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase assortment of the goods sold

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the local bank Sagrado Corazon D. Jesus. She works selling vegetables wholesale and retail to the central market in the district of Caraz, Huaylas province, Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 1,000 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy batches of corn from a farmer in Yungay. She is 53 years old and has 5 children, 2 of whom are still in school. She's married, and her husband has temporary jobs and supports his wife in her business. Both work in order to proviD. their children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria pertenece al banco comunal Sagrado Corazón D. Jesús. Se dedica a la venta D. verduras al por mayor y menor en el mercado central del distrito D. Caraz, provincia D. Huaylas, departamento D. Ancash. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagará en 6 meses, comprará choclos por lote D. una agricultor D. Yungay. Ella tiene 53 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales dos están estudiando, es casada y su esposo tiene trabajos eventuales y apoya a su esposa en el negocio. Ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.ru:
Davlatbek K. is 50 years old, has finished high school, is married and has 8 children. Mr. K. is a private rancher. He has been raising and selling cattle for the last 10 years. He is planning to use the loan to purchase a few calves for fattening and sale. Every 40-45 days he is planning to sell the fattened bulls and purchase new calves. He will use the money earned from sales to buy additional animals and feed for them as well as use the surplus money to support his own family. Mr. K. is planning to pay back his loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Киёмов Давлатбек, возраст – 50 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 8-х детей. Давлатбек частный фермер. Он занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 10 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести несколько молодых бычков для покупки и продажи. Через каждые 40-45 дней он будет продавать бычков и покупать новых. Вырученные деньги он будет использовать на приобретение молодых бычков и корма для них, а полученную прибыль будет направлять на содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of cattle

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalia belongs to the local bank Las Mercedes. She works selling typical food at the weekly markets that occur on Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday in the district and province of Carhuaz, in the Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 1,000 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy cooking oil, 1 bag of potatoes, 1 bag of salt, and smaller quantities of other ingredients. She will also buy 10 table benches and a dozen avocado trees. Rosalia is 38 years old, a widow, and mother of 3. She started this business when her husband died in order to provide her children an education and give them a good start in life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosalía pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes. Se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas en la feria semanal que se dan los días miércoles, viernes y domingos en el distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un balde de aceite, 1 saco de papa, 1 saco de sal y otros ingredientes en poca cantidad , también comprará 10 bancas para mesa y 1 docena de paltos. Rosalía tiene 38 años de edad, es viuda y tienen 3 hijos. Inició este negocio cuando murió su esposo con la finalidad de educar y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy cooking supplies and other items (benches)

loans.name: Yenny Magaly

texts.es:
Ms. Yenny belongs to the communal bank Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay and is the daughter of member Alejandrina M.. She earns a living selling groceries. Her business is located at the campo Ferial del distrito y Provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

With this loan, which she will pay in 4 months, she will buy 35 bags of sugar.

Yenny is 25 years old, is married and has a 8 year old daughter. Her husband helps her at the market and is now thinking about opening another stand that sells door to door.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yenny pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay y es hija de la socia Alejandrina M.. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y su negocio está ubicado en el campo Ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 35 bolsas de azúcar.

Yenny tienen 25 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija de 8 años y su esposo la apoya los días de feria y además está pensando aperturar otro puesto de venta en forma ambulatoria.

loans.use: To purchase groceries (sugar)

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru:
Mukim O. is 40 years old, has finished college with a degree in accounting, is married and has 4 children. Mukim has been running a small cafe for the last 10 years. He is planning to use the loan to fix the building in which his cafe is located and purchase a heater for the space. This loan will allow him to improve the appearance of his cafe and the people who use it will be able to dine in a warm and clean atmosphere. Even now his cafe is a busy spot since it is located on the roadside between Rudaki and Dushanbe, capital of Tajikistan. Mukim is planning to pay back his loan in the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Одинаев Муким, возраст – 40 лет, образование – высшее, по специальности бухгалтер, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Муким имеет небольшую столовую. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 10 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать для проведения текущего ремонта своей столовой и приобретение печки для обогрева. Данный кредит поможет ему улучшить условия своей столовой, а люди приодящие сюда чтобы пообедать, смогут это сделать в тепле и чистоте. В его столовой бывают много посетителей, так как она находится на обочине дороги Душанбе-Рудаки. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 18 месяцев.

loans.use: fixing the space and purchase of a heater

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru:
Shamigul M. is 52 years old, has finished high school, is married and has 5 children. Shamigul has been embroidering and selling Tajik folk costumes for the last 8 years. She is planning to use the loan to purchase necessary embroidery supplies for her business. This loan will provide the locals with a source of hand-made folk costumes, since it is increasingly difficult to find high quality work like this. Locally, national Tajik costumes are in high demand, since they are used in weddings and other traditional ceremonies. Mrs. M. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Мачнунова Шаъмигул, возраст – 52 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Шаъмигул занимается вышивкой национальных изделий и их продажей. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение необходимого материала для этого вида деятельности. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 8 лет. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям района приобретать у неё нациоанальные изделия ручной работы, так как не всегда в продаже имеются такие изделия. Они пользуются спросом у местного населения, так как их используют при проведение свадебных и других национальных обрядов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of embroidery supplies

loans.name: Brisas Del Lago Panajachel Group

texts.es:
The group “Brisas del lago Panajachel” (which in Spanish means “the Breeze from the Panajachel Lake”) is integrated by eighteen women. All the women in this group show an incredible willpower, they are cheerful and extroverted. They all work in the town of Panajachel where they bring happiness to the community whilst they work in their different activities.

The women in the group are very happy because they will receive the first loan in their lives. With it, they hope to see their businesses flourish and consequently improve their standard of living. Even though this is their first loan, all of them have ventured to ask the highest amount that can be given as an initial loan (263USD per person). They are proud of themselves because it is the first time that someone, in this case Friendship Bridge and Kiva, are betting on them and believe in their capabilities.

Most of them will use the loan to buy and then sell clothing (both new and used) at the market or in the streets. Some will use it to buy ingredients in order to prepare food that they will sell during lunch and diner time. Others will use it to buy and sell jewelry and cosmetics. Finally, one of them is a midwife and she will use the money to buy medicines.

The midwife is the town's doctor and she takes care of the deliveries, mostly those of indigenous women. Moreover, she also assists with other sicknesses.

Many of them dream of having their own shops so they don’t have to be street vendors. Others want to pay their first loan in order to show themselves that they are capable of having a good business.

They all dream of having sound businesses that will allow them to count on a steady income and of course, they all dream about the general wellbeing of their families and community.

The women of the group “Brisas del lago Panajachel” only need an initial support so they can move forward, please help them with this credit and they will not let you down. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo de diez y ocho señoras reflejan una fuerza de voluntad increíble, además de ser muy alegres y extrovertidas. Todas ellas trabajan en el pueblo de Panajachel alegrando a la comunidad mientras laboran en sus respectivas empresas.

Las señoras que conforman el grupo están felices porque van a recibir el primer préstamo en sus vidas, ellas tienen la esperanza de que su negocio vaya a florecer y así incrementar sus estándares de vida. A pesar de que este es su primer préstamo, todas las integrantes se van a aventurar a pedir la cantidad más alta que se puede otorgar en un crédito inicial: US$263. Ellas están orgullosas de si mismas ya que por primera vez alguien, Friendship Bridge y Kiva, está apostando por ellas y creen en sus capacidades.

La mayoría van a pedir préstamos para la compra y venta de ropa nueva y usada en el mercado o de manera ambulante. Otras van a pedir para comprar insumos para la venta de almuerzos y comidas. También, hay clientas que venden joyería y cosméticos. Finalmente, en el grupo hay una comadrona que va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar medicinas. La comadrona es la doctora del pueblo que se encarga de los partos de las mujeres indígenas en este caso. Además de asistir con otro tipo de enfermedades.

Muchas de ellas sueñan con tener un local propio ya que venden sus productos como ambulantes. Otras quieren pagar su primer préstamo para poder demostrarse a si mismas que son capaces de tener un buen negocio. También sueñan con tener un negocio estable a lo largo del tiempo para que puedan contar con un ingreso estable. Por supuesto sueñan con tener un bienestar general para su familia y su comunidad.

Las brisas del lago de Panajachel solo necesitan un apoyo inicial para poder salir adelante, apóyenlas con esté crédito y ellas no les fallaran. Gracias

loans.use: The loans will be used in different ways: to buy ingredients to cook and sell food for lunch and dinner, to buy and sell jewelry and cosmetics, to buy and sell used clothing at the market or in the streets and to buy medicine

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique worked as an aviation mechanic in the commercial aviation company, Aero Continente. The owners of this company got involved in some legal problems and Enrique was fired without pay. After a year without a job and facing the pressure to pay his creditors, he decided to establish a wine bottling business with his brother.

He has owned this business for four years, with his brand “Vinos L. B. – L. B. Wines”, he sells premium wine in various areas of the capital city. Enrique is very dedicated to his business, he has refurbished the first floor of his house as a manufacturing facility.

Enrique’s dream is to produce his own wine and improve the manufacturing system by purchasing new equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Enrique trabajaba como mecánico aeronáutico en una empresa D. aviación comercial, Aero Continente; sin embargo, por problemas legales D. los dueños D. L. empresa, fue despedido sin remuneración alguna. Pasó un año sin trabajo y ante L. presión que tenía por las deudas, decidió poner junto a su hermano un negocio D. embotellamiento D. vino.

Ya lleva cuatro años en los que con su marca “Vinos L. B.” ofrece vinos D. óptima calidad en distintos puntos D. L. capital. Y es que Enrique se preocupa mucho por mejorar cada vez más su trabajo; por esto, ha acondicionado el primer piso D. su vivienda para poder trabajar.

El sueño D. Enrique es poder producir su propio vino además D. mejorar el sistema D. manufacturación D. sus productos con L. compra D. maquinaria.

loans.use:
Purchase equipment for his business

Comprar maquinaria para su negocio

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en: Jestina is 35 years old and is married with 3 children.  She started her small grocery business 2 years ago in the market of Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  Before the loans, she was selling the goods by the roadside of the town.  This helped Jestina to acquire a space in the market where she does the selling, and her business increased and diversified.  Jestina is requesting additional capital in the amount of $350 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Jestina has been able to nurture her business to success, and now she needs a loan to make it more sustainable.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
A year ago Maria purchased a “cuy” (Guinea Pig) for dinner. Fortunately for the animal, Maria has a friend dedicated to the raise these animals and she advised Maria to the same. With a lot effort she managed to purchase two more and start the business of selling “cuyes”.

With the support of EDAPROSPO, Maria purchased a good cage in which she raises her 40 “cuyes”. With this new cage the quality of the animals she raises has improved greatly. She has a great clientele in different zones of Lima.

Maria wants to expand her business by purchasing more “cuyes” and more cages.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace un año, María había comprado un cuy (roedor típico D. los andes peruanos) para su consumo. Para suerte del animal, una amiga que se dedica a L. crianza D. esta especie le aconsejó que incursionara en dicho trabajo. Con mucho esfuerzo, María compró otros dos he inició, así, su negocio D. venta D. cuyes.

Con el apoyo D. EDAPROSPO, María pudo comprar una buena jauL. en donD. cría a sus 40 cuyes. D. esta manera, L. calidad D. L. crianza D. sus animales ha mejorado prueba D. ello es L. gran clienteL. que María está comenzando a tener en distintas zonas D. Lima.

María quisiera poder ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más cuyes y jaulas.

loans.use:
Expand her business

Ampliar su negocio

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.ru:
Fathullo Halimov is 22 years old, has finished high school, single. Fathullo owns a truck and works as a driver for hire in his town. He is planning to use the loan to purchase additional spare parts for the truck and it's repair. This loan will allow Fathullo to fix his truck, which is a source of income for him and will allow the locals to rent the car when needed for the purpose of transportation of heavy goods. Mr. Halimov is planning to pay back the loan in the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Халимов Фатхулло, возраст – 22 года, образование – среднее, неженат, детей не имеет. Фатхулло имеет свой собственный грузовой автомобиль, на которм оказывает услуги местным жителям. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение отдельных автозапчастей для автомобиля, а также для его ремонта. Данный кредит даст возможность Дильшоду починить свой автомобиль, который является средством для получения дохода и даст возможность местным жителям в необходимый момент заказать машину для перевозки каких-либо сыпучих грузов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: transportation services

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is married with a child.  At 38 years of age, she started her business 5 years ago after acquiring training from one of the NGO’s training centres.  With her previous loans, she increased her production and customer base. There is high demand for the product and Mariatu is requesting a loan to purchase cotton materials, dye,  and hiring labour.  Mariatu’s business is creating beautiful tye-dye textiles.

loans.use: Mariatu is a talented entrepreneur who has the opportunity to take her skills and apply them to a craft that will actually provide for her and her family.  She needs an additional loan to take this business to the next level.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Dilshod Abdurahmanov is 31 years old, has finished college with a degree in agronomy. He is married and has 2 children. For the last year Mr. Abdurahmanov made his living by raising and selling cattle. He buys calves and sells them after fattening every 40-45 days. He uses the money he makes from the sales to purchase additional calves and will use the surplus for paying back his loan and feeding his family. The current loan will allow Dilshod to have the necessary money for this sort of work, so that he can have a source of income. Dilshod is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Абдурахмонов Дильшод, возраст – 31 год, образование – высшее, по специальности агроном, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Клиент занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 1 года. Он приобретает и продаёт скот после откорма через каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги он будет приобретать молодой скот, а полученную прибыль испоьзовать на погашение кредита и содержание своей семьи. Данный кредит даст возможность Дильшоду иметь необходимый капитал для этого вида деятельности, для того чтобы он имел источник дохода. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: raising and sale of cattle

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu K. K. is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  She has been running her restaurant business for 6 years and the income is a supplement to the family expenses.  With the previous loans, Isatu was able to purchase the ingredients on wholesale, thus she realized better profits.  Her plan is to expand the business and construct a small shelter for her customers. She is therefore requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: She would like to expand her restaurant to serve more customers and increase her profits.

loans.name: Tuychi

texts.ru:
Tuychi S. is 33 years old, he has secondary education an is an accountant by profession. He is married and has 4 children. Tuychi has a small grocery store in the village of Chorbog in the Varzobskiy region. He sells mostly groceries and wants to use the loan to increase his inventory. Because this kishlak (village) is located several kilometers away from the city of Dushanbe and it's difficult to travel there during the winter, the loan will provide an opportunity for the residents to buy the necessary groceries locally even in the winter time.

Tuychi plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сангонов Туйчи, возраст – 33 года, образование – высшее, по специальности бухгалтер, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Туйчи имеет небольшой магазин в кишлаке Чорбог Варзобского района. Основной товар, которым он торгует это продуктами питание. На полученный кредит он хочет увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара. Так как этот кишлак находится в нескольких километрах от города Душанбе и зимой туда трудно добраться, данный кредит даст возможность жителям кишлака приобретать необходимые им продукты питания даже в зимнее время.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja J. is married with 4 children.  She sells peanuts and Beny on a very small scale.  With several small loans, SMT has proved Haja to be a creditworthy client, and would like to increase her loan size to enable her to expand and diversify the business for better income.  Haja does her business in the home because it is too small to be taken to the market center.  With the increase in business and income, Haja will be able to improve her family status.  She is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Haja wants to move her business out of her home and into the market and needs the help of a Kiva loan to do so.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru:
Mansur E. is 28 years old, he has secondary education, married and has 1 child. Mansur sells groceries and owns a small store in the kishlak (village) of Garav in the Tursun-zodevskiy region. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. Mansur wants to use the loan to increase the assortment of his inventory. Because the kishlak is located several kilometers away from the town of Tursun-zoda, the loan will provide an opportunity for the residents of Garav and the nearby kishlaks to shop for the necessary groceries at Mansur's store.

Mansur plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Эргашев Мансур, возраст – 28 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 1 – го ребёнка. Мансур занимается продажей продуктов питания. У него есть небольшой магазин, который расположен в кишлаке Гарав, Турсунзадевского района. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2-х лет. На полученный кредит он хочет закупить новый ассортимент товара. Так как кишлак находится в нескольких километрах от города Турсунзаде, полученный кредит даст возможность приобрести новый ассортимент товра и жители этого и других кишлаков получат возможность приобретать необходимые продукты питания у Мансура в магазине.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu K. sells rice and peanuts in Mbikolo village on the outskirts of Makeni town.  She is 45 years old and married with two children.  She is grateful for the previous loans, as they helped increased her business and income.  She is now able to meet her children’s school requirements and also supplement other family expenses.  She is requesting another loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Mariatu is ambitious and hard working.  With the help of the Kiva loan she wants to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata is 26 years old and started her business 6 years ago.  Single with no child, she supports her sisters and brothers when the need arises.  Aminata owns a small  shop in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  With her previous loans, she was able to diversify her business.  She plans to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $700.

loans.use: Aminata wants to help continue supporting her siblings and would like to expand her business in an effort to do so.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: At the age of 29, Daniel is married with 2 children.  He owns a small bakery in Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  Daniel increased his current production with previous loans accessed from SMT, but the demand for bread is high and production could not meet the demand.  Daniel is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of wheat flour, buy more baking pans, and hire two more people to assist with the work.

loans.use: Daniel is experiencing great success with his business and needs additional capital to meet the growing demand.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu K. is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  Her business of selling refreshments used to be on a very small scale, and then after several small loans, she purchased a second-hand freezer for cooling soft drinks, and it has attracted many customers, especially during summer.  Mariatu would like to expand her business as summer is approaching, and would like a loan of $1,025 to help.

loans.use: Mariatu is trying to meet the anticipated demand for cold beverages, and needs additional capital to accomplish this.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
ClotilD. belongs to a communal bank in El Breo. She lives in the region of San Martin, in the providence of Mariscal Caceres and the district of Juanjui. She dedicates herself to the selling of products and other groceries. She is situated in Jr. Manco Capac. With the initiative and support from her husband she has succeeded. Now she has more clients than ever before thanks to her good service and competitive prices.

With the loan of 3000 Soles, which she will have to pay back in 6 months, she will buy groceries such as: containers, soap, rice, sugar, milk, paper, oil, and other goodies.

She is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and her 4 children. Her family strongly supports her.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora ClotilD. pertenece al banco comunal El Breo, vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres y distrito D. Juanjui. Se dedica al comercio a la venta D. abarrotes y el negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Manco Cápac Nº 417. Con la iniciativa y apoyo D. su esposo ha salido adelante, logrando incrementar su negocio, ya que antes era pequeño y ahora tiene más clientela por su buen trato al cliente y sus precios competitivos.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000 el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas D. jabón, lava vajillas, lejía D. diferentes marcas (marsella, bolivar, jumbo), etc., sacos D. 50 kilogramos D. azúcar y arroz, leche gloria en cajas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas D. pescado, aceite por litros, fideos en paquetes.

La señora ClotilD. tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos quienes diariamente la apoyan demostrando que cuando la familia está unida no hay límites y se pueden cumplir metas con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Buy grocery goods (sugar, rice, milk, oil, etc)

loans.name: Hokim

texts.ru:
Hokim K. is 45 years old, has specialized secondary education and is an accountant by profession. He is married and has 4 children. Hokim has a small grocery store which is located in the fifth microregion of the town of Tursun-zoda. He sells mostly groceries and has been in this business for the past 3 years. He wants to use the loan to increase the assortment of his inventory. The loan will also give an opportunity for the residents of Tursun-zoda to buy the necessary groceries close to where they live.

Hokim plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодиров Хоким, возраст – 45 лет, образование – средне-специальное, по специальности – бухгалтер, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Хоким имеет небольшой магазин, который расположен на 5 микрорайоне в городе Турсунзаде. Основный товар, которым он торгует это продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. Полученный кредит он хочеи использовать на приобретение нового ассортимента продаваемого товара. Получив данный кредит он увеличит ассортимент предлагаемого товара, а жители города Турсунзаде получат возможность приобретать необходимые им продукты питания прям рядом со своими домами.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Janne

texts.es:
Mrs. Janne belongs to the Mariscal Cáceres communal bank. She lives in the region San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjui. She works selling food items, such as, eggs, breads and vegetables. Her business is located in the lower part of Jr. Huallaga N. 1620- Juanjuicillo.

With a loan of 3,000 Peruvian Soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will be able to buy groceries, like sugar and rice in large quantities, milk in boxes, detergent in packets, oil and noodles in packets, powdered milk in boxes and toothpaste.

Mrs. Janne is 44 years of age; she lives with her husband and three children who are very supportive of her work. Sacrificing other activities together to be able to grow economically and now little by little they are starting to see results of their hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Janne pertenece al banco comunal Mariscal Cáceres. Vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres y distrito D. Juanjui. Se dedica al comercio D. venta D. abarrotes, huevos panes y verduras y el negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Huallaga Nº 1620-Juanjuicillo, parte baja.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará abarrotes como azúcar y arroz en sacos, leche Gloria en cajas, jabón Bolívar en cajas, detergente Patito en paquetes, aceite y fideos en paquetes, leche Pura Vida en cajas y pasta dental Colgate y Dento en cajas.

La señora Janne tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que la apoyan diariamente, sacrificando otras actividades para poder crecer y es ahora donD. están viendo los resultados.

loans.use: Buy grocery goods (sugar, rice, milk, oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
I've been selling prepared food for over 8 years. My daughter and I work the business together and it is my family's only source of income. We are in need of some furniture and utensils to be able to prepare the food faster. I am asking for a $1,000.00 loan to purchase furnishings and cooking utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de ocho años que me dedico a vender platillos preparados. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el negocio trabajamos una de mis hijas y yo. Pero en el negocio nos esta haciendo falta algo de inmobiliario y artículos para preparar mas rápido los alimentos. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para la compra de inmobiliario y artículos para cocinar.

loans.use: To purchase furnishings and cooking utensils

loans.name: Leslie Aime

texts.es:
The young lady Leslie Aime belongs to a communal bank called El Breo. She lives in the region called San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres and in district of Juanjui. She devotes herself to the sale of watches and gifts, and the business is located in Jr. Huallaga, number 689.

She needs the loan of 3,000 Peruvian Soles, which she will pay off in six months; she will buy gifts and watches in bulk in order to increase her inventory and sales.

Leslie is 27 years old. She lives with her husband who is supportive of her and knows how to fix the watches. Another reason why people go to their business is because her husband knows how to repair watches. Together they are getting ahead because the business currently has two locations. That goes to show that Leslie Amie’s goals have no limits, and that with hard work and dedication she can achieve all of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Leslie Aime pertenece al banco comunal El Breo. Vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica al comercio de venta de relojes y regalos y el negocio está ubicado en Jr. Huallaga No. 689.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará regalos y relojes en cantidad para aumentar su producto.

La señora Leslie tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo quien la apoya, ya que él sabe arreglar relojes, es por eso también que los clientes van a su negocio. Juntos están saliendo adelante porque actualmente tiene dos establecimientos del negocio, demostrando de esa manera, que para cumplir metas no hay límites y que se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Buy gifts and watches

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Mr. Gilberto is 44 years old and married. He has two children of 8 and 11 years of age, attending elementary school, and a 19 month old baby. Mr. Gilberto runs a small grocery store located at his home. When opportunities arise, he also does photography jobs, in order to obtain a higher income and greater benefits for his family. His wife works at home and when he is not present, helps running the store.

The roof of Mr. Gilberto’s house is in very bad shape, so he is requesting the loan in order to buy zinc sheets to replace it. He also needs to build the left wall of his house, currently made out of wood pieces. Mr. Gilberto, as every family head, wishes the best for his family, and to be able to give them a dignified life and a comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Gilberto tiene 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, de 8, 11 y un bebé de 19 meses de nacido. Los dos hijos mayores se encuentran cursando la escuela primaria. Don Gilberto posee una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, y en las oportunidades que salen, se dedica también a la fotografía, todo en busca de mejores ingresos y beneficios para su familia. Su esposa es ama de casa y en los tiempos que no está Don Gilberto, ella le ayuda con la administración de la pulpería.

El techo de la vivienda de don Gilberto se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, por lo que requiere el préstamo para comprar láminas de zinc y cambiar el techo de su casa. También necesita construir la pared izquierda de su casa, que actualmente está hecha con pedazos de madera. Don Gilberto, como todo padre de familia, desea lo mejor para su familia y darles una vida digna y una casa cómoda.

loans.use: Roof repair and building of a wall at his home.

payments.comment: Este cliente pagó adelantado su crédito

loans.name: Libi Vanessa

texts.es:
The young lady Libi Vanessa belongs to a communal bank called Mariscal Cáceres. She lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres and district of Juanjui. She is devoted to the sales of utensils and kitchenware. Her business is located in Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza, number 555.

She needs a loan of 2,000 Soles. She would pay it off in 6 months. With the loan she would be able to buy kitchen pots and pans, utensils, trays, hampers for clothes, and ceramic plates.

The young lady Libi Vanessa is 20 years old and she still lives with her parents who are very supportive of her. They are a very united family and are getting ahead and achieving goals. Currently she is very young, but she feels like a successful woman. Her self-esteem is very high because she also studies at the university.
