Their dreams are to own land, put a roof on their house, continue working, and provide a better life for their children.

loans.use: Genoveva, Karina, and Rosalinda need loans of 400, 2000, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in fruits, a juicer, a larger variety of auto parts, plates, cups, and food for the restaurant.

loans.name: Zonia Ninza's Group

texts.en:
Claudia, Zonia, and Yolanda have been members of the community bank “Amaqella” for two, ten, and six years respectively. In that time they have learned how to manage money, save, be punctual and responsible, and to work in solidarity with other associates.

Claudia is 24 years old. Claudia’s family owns a leather-processing business. Her part of the business is to buy raw leather and then subsequently transport the finished product to Lima. Claudia makes the 10-hour bus journey to the capital once every 15 days. At the same time, she is studying medicine at the university in Ayacucho.

Zonia is 48 years old and has three teenage daughters. She sells “salchipollo”, which is a snack made from french-fries topped by chicken and egg. She started this business ten years ago with her first loan from the community bank. Before that she lived in the city of Huancayo where she grew vegetables and baked bread.

Yolanda is 40 years old and also has three children. For the past 15 years she has had a business selling “cuchinillo”, which are small insects used to make red dye. She travels to the rural areas to buy them, and then sells them in the city of Ayacucho.

Claudia, Zonia, and Yolanda need loans of 400, 1400, and 1,000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying leather, plates, cups, potatoes, chicken, and a car to use as a taxi.

Claudia dreams of becoming a doctor. Sonya’s dream is that all of her children will be professionals, the oldest already is. Yolanda hopes to continue working and saving and seeing her business grow.

loans.use: Claudia, Zonia, and Yolanda need loans of 400, 1400, and 1,000 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying leather, plates, cups, potatoes, chicken, and a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 48 years old. She has six children, the youngest of whom still lives with her. She was a founding member of the community bank “Amaqella”, and has remained an associate for 13 years. During those years, she has learned to be punctual, save, and help others. With the help of the community bank she has been able to buy a house, a car and see four of her children become professionals.

Juana’s business is selling construction materials such as bricks, wood, and glass. This business was started by her parents and she has been a part of it her entire life. In addition, Juana has a field in the country where she grows corn and vegetables to sell in the market.

Juana needs a loan of 3,000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in preparing for the rainy season by buying roofing supplies and bricks.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Juana is saving to buy a second car that her husband would use as a taxi. Her dream is to have a nice house and see her youngest daughter become a professional.

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 3,000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in preparing for the rainy season by buying roofing supplies and bricks.

loans.name: Amanda Aida's Group

texts.en:
Amanda and Yeni have been members of the community bank “Amaqella” for five years and eight months respectively. In that time they have learned how to be punctual, productive, and to save. In addition, they have learned about respect and how to respect themselves as well as others.

Amanda is 50 years old and has five children. She sells a variety of different foods from a cart in Ayacucho. She has been running this business for 17 years. In addition, she travels to markets around the region to buy food staples such as grains and cheeses, which she sells in Ayacucho. Before that she was a city official in the town of Huamanga. She was unable to continue in Ayacucho, because she does not speak Quehua, the indigenous language of the area.

Yeni is 28 and has two children. She is a nurse, but is currently concentrating on raising her children. She and her husband have a business selling CDs and DVDs. Her husband also works in the country part of the time growing vegetables.

Amanda and Yeni need loans of 800 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying bread, cheese, vegetables, and CDs. The community bank emphasizes he importance saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Amanda and Yeni are saving to buy land and improve their homes. Their dreams are to give their children a better life.

loans.use: Amanda and Yeni need loans of 800 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying bread, cheese, vegetables, and CDs.

loans.name: Catalina's Group

texts.en:
Sonia, Catalina, and Visitacion are members of the community bank “Universo”. Sonia joined 8 months ago. Catalina and Visitacion have been members for 14, and 6 years respectively. In that time they have learned to save, and manage their money effectively. In addition they have learned that they have value as women and can move up in the world through their own power.

Sonia is 28 and has one child. She has owned an internet café for one year. She started with five computers and now has eight, but hopes to continue expanding. She also has a small grocery store, which she has owned for several years, but focuses on the internet café.

Catalina is 42 and has two children. She sells snacks and prepared food from a stand in the central market. She is also a weaver. She has been weaving for 10 years and sends her finished products to Lima.

Visitacion is 56 and has three adult children. She travels to Lima or the city of Huancayo to buy clothing that she then sells in the city of Aycucho. She has been doing this for eight years.

Sonia, Catalina, and Visitacion need loans of 800, 400, and 400 soles (soles = $1), which they will invest in buying a printer, buying flour in bulk to avoid a prospective rise in prices, and traveling to different areas to buy products. Sonia, Catalina, and Visitacion dream of owning homes and that their children will finish school and have a better life.

loans.use: Sonia, Catalina, and Visitacion need loans of 800, 400, and 400 soles (soles = $1), which they will invest in buying a printer, buying flour in bulk to avoid a prospective rise in prices, and traveling to different areas to buy products.

loans.name: Gladis Daysi

texts.es:
Mrs. Gladis got married at the very young age of fifteen. Since that time she has worked to earn her living alongside her husband. They have three children: a 15-year-old boy and two girls, aged 17 and 14.

They began by selling vegetables out of a horse trailer, and with a lot of hard work and dedication have managed to move ahead. Today they count on two trucks that they use to distribute their product; in addition to vegetables they now also sell bread and cases of soda.

With this business they have been able to build a home in the Villa neighborhood, an area where the crime rate is very high. They need this loan to put a roof over the porch of their home, as their line of work requires them to be out all day and they fear for the safety of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Gladis se casó desde muy jovencita a la edad de 15 años. Desde esa edad empezó a trabajar para ganarse la vida junto a su marido. Tienen 3 hijos un varón de 15 años y dos mujeres de 17 y 14 años.

Empezaron vendiendo verduras en un carreton de caballos, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado salir adelante y hoy en día cuentan con dos camionetas en la que se encargan de distribuir el producto, ahora además de verduras venden pan y refrescos empacados.

Con este negocio han podido construir su casa, habitan en el barrio Villa reconciliación donde los índices de delincuencia son muy altos, por eso necesitan el préstamo, para ponerle techo al porche de su vivenda, ya que por su tipo de trabajo ellos están fuera todo el día y temen por la seguridad de sus hijos.

loans.use: Put a roof over the porch of their home.

loans.name: Soledad's Group

texts.en:
Priscela, Soledad, and Susana are members of the community bank “Imperio”. Soledad and Susana have been members for ten years, and Priscela joined eight months ago. In that time they have learned to be responsible, work efficiently and to save. They have also learned to work in solidarity with the other women in the bank and feel that the bank has been a great support for them.

Priscela is 26 years old, and has three children. She buys whole grains in bulk, and then sells them at a profit. She has had this business for one year.

Soledad is 37 and has five children. She sells a variety of things including snacks, soft drinks, and cheese from a store in her house. She has had this business for 15 years.

Susana is 41 and has three children ranging in age from 24 years to 7 months. She has a small store in her home where she also sells food. She has been running this business for eight years. Before that she frequently traveled 10 hours by bus to sell tuna, a typical fruit that comes from a cactus, in Lima. She decided to switch businesses in order to not travel as much.

Priscela, Soledad, and Susana each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying whole grains, improving their store, and adding more products. Priscela, Soledad, and Susana dream of owning a home, being able to pay for all of their children’s needs, and seeing their children have a better life.

loans.use: Priscela, Soledad, and Susana each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying whole grains, improving their store, and adding more products.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla V. lives on the outskirts of the city of Managua in a community called Los Cuarezma. She was born on March 25, 1972 to a humble family. With a lot of sacrifice, she managed to earn her teaching certificate. She is currently working as a teacher and has 15 years of experience in the profession.

Karla is 35, married, and has two children - a 13-year-old daughter and a 10-month-old baby. Her husband is a sales executive at a business that sells staple grains. This couple supports each other in their subsistence, and has managed to get ahead. Her goal now is to invest in her home to make it more comfortable for her children. She needs the loans to rebuild the kitchen and laundry area that are in poor condition.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Karla V. habita en las afueras de la ciudad de Managua, en una comunidad llamada Los Cuarezma. Nació un 25 de marzo de 1972, proviene de una familia muy humilde y con mucho sacrifició logró forjarse como Licenciada de Pedagogía y actualmente se desempeña como docente, teniendo 15 años de experiencia en esta profesión.

Karla tiene 35 años, es casada, con 2 hijos, una niña de 13 años y un bebé de 10 meses. Su esposo es Ejecutivo de ventas en una empresa que comercializa Granos Básicos. Esta pareja se apoya mutuamente para lograr subsistir y han logrado salir adelante. Su meta ahora es invertir en su vivienda para hacerla más cómoda para sus dos pequeños, requeiren el préstamos para reconstruir el area de cocina y de la lavandería, que no se encuentra en muy buen estado.

loans.use: Rebuild her home's kitchen and laundry area

loans.name: Rofina's Group

texts.en:
Teodora, Rofina, and Epifania have been members of the community bank “Imperio” for eleven, six, and eight years respectively. In that time they have learned to save, be punctual, and to be responsible. They have also learned that they can manage money effectively and do not need to give total control to their husbands.

Teodora is 45 and has four children. In the past she sold a variety of candies. Three years ago she was able to open a small grocery store. She has also been able to help her children finish school and now they all have steady jobs.

Rofina is 43 and also has four children. She has a booth selling fabric in the local market. She has been running this business for several years.

Likewise, Epifania is 42 and has four children. She has a business selling prepared food. She started this business many years ago when her children started school.

Teodora, Rofina, and Epifania need loans of 400, 1000, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in putting a floor in their business, buying a display case, and buying ingredients such as flour, sugar, and oil. Teodora, Rofina, and Epifania dream that all of their children will finish their education and become professionals.

loans.use: Teodora, Rofina, and Epifania need loans of 400, 1000, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in putting a floor in their business, buying a display case, and buying ingredients such as flour, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Francisca and Benjamina have both been members of the community bank “Universo” for two years. In that time they have learned how to run their businesses more efficiently, and to be punctual. They have also learned how to care for their health and avoid sickness. They say that they enjoy the community bank and look forward to meetings every week.

Francisca is 25 and has two young children. Four years ago Francisca moved to Ayacucho from Lima and opened a juice stand. Since then her business has continued to grow.

Benjamina is 47 and has two adult children. She has bees selling emolliente, a traditional beverage maD. from herbs and served warm, for 27 years.

Francisca and Benjamina each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying fruit, sugar, and herbs.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Francisca and Benjamina are saving to buy a piece of land in Lima and to invest more in their business. Their dreams are to own a house in Lima and that their children will have a better life and steady jobs.

loans.use: Francisca and Benjamina each need loans of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying fruit, sugar, and herbs.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana, Silvia, and Elma have been members of the community bank “Universo” for a little over one year. In that time they have learned how to improve their health, use their money more effectively, and the importance of saving.

Diana is twenty years old. She buys spices in Ayacucho and then travels around the region and sells them at various local markets. In addition, she is studying economics at the local university.

Silvia is 28 and has two children. She also buys spices in Ayacucho and sells them at various regional markets. She was able to start this business one year ago with her first loan from the community bank. Before that she sold candies, but is able to make a larger profit with her new business.

Elma is 36 and has two teenage children. She buys plastic wares in Ayacucho and then sells them in other markets around the region. She has been running this business for 18 months. In addition, she owns a kiosk where she sells things like magazines and candy.

Diana, Silvia, and Elma need loans of 400, 200, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying spices, and more supplies for their kiosk.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Diana, Silvia, and Elma are saving to buy a house, pay for school, and stocking their kiosk. They dream of being an economist, owning a home, developing their business, and seeing their children be successful.

loans.use: Diana, Silvia, and Elma need loans of 400, 200, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying spices, and more supplies for their kiosk.

loans.name: Sabina's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Hilda, and Sabina have been members of the community bank “Musuq Wasi” for a little over two years. In that time they have learned about punctuality, responsibility, saving and respect. They feel like a family and say that they are always trying to help each other.

Maria is 28 and has one child. She has owned a grocery stO. for the past 18 months. BefO. that she sold fruits and vegetables but, thanks to a loan from her community bank, she was able to start her new business.

Hilda is 22 years old. She grows vegetables and raises guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy here. She was able to start raising guinea pigs one year ago with a loan from her community bank.

Sabina is 36 years old and has three children. She grows fruits and vegetables and sells them at the market in Ayacucho. Previously, she also sold guinea pigs and hopes to start again with this new loan. Maria, Hilda, and Sabina need loans of 300, 900, and 300 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying sugar, flour, oil, guinea pigs, a cow, lettuce, cilantro, and vegetable seeds. Their dreams are that their children will have a better life and not have to work as hard or deal with the insecurity that their parents had to.

loans.use: Maria, Hilda, and Sabina need loans of 300, 900, and 300 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying sugar, flour, oil, guinea pigs, a cow, lettuce, cilantro, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: 7 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
The "Seventh of March" Organization is a seven-year-old association within the Focal Center of Villa Adela, one of the most responsible and punctual groups with respect to paying bills and the prosperity of their businesses.

It is comprised in large part of older women, who definitely collaborate in aspects of responsibility and punctuality with the younger women who make up the Organization.

This association is characterized by the sales of merchandise, typically highly needed items, such as household supplies, and in some cases, the women are owners of grocery stores, or simply sell provisions on credit. The majority do not run their own businesses, but this does not impede their ability to work at fairs or markets.

Currently, the Seventh of March Organization needs cash to strengthen their business, preparing themselves for the Carnaval and Alasitas parties that are coming up.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Asociación 7 de Marzo, es una asociación con una antigüedad de más de 7 años dentro del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, una de las más responsables y puntuales en referencia al pago de cuotas y a la prosperidad de sus negocios.

Esta conformada en gran parte por mujeres de edad, quienes definitivamente colaboran en aspectos de responsabilidad y puntualidad principalmente a aquellas socias jóvenes que integran la Asociación.

Esta asociación se caracteriza por el comercio de mercadería, principalmente artículos de primera necesidad, como ser víveres y en algunos casos las señoras son dueñas de tiendas de abarrotes, o simplemente venta de víveres al crédito. La mayoría no cuenta con puestos de venta propio, pero eso no impide que realicen su trabajo en ferias y mercados.

Actualmente la asociación 7 de Marzo precisa de capital para fortalecer sus negocios, preparándolos para las fiestas de carnaval y alasitas que ya se aproxima.

loans.use: Strengthen businesses in preparation for upcoming holidays

loans.name: Abejitas Group

texts.es:
The name of this association comes from the characteristics of the bee. The bee is extremely beneficial to the environment, but its best quality is it that it works without rest. This is why, the members tell us, they identify with the bee for its hard work and perseverence.

This association is made up of 19 hardworking members who work preparing and selling food, some from their own restaurants, some from a small stand, and some from the roadside. The loan will be used to boost their businesses, primarily the food stands, where they make the traditional dishes during carnaval.

El nombre de la Asociación Comunal Las Abejitas tiene su origen en las características de este insecto. La Abeja es un insecto sumamente beneficioso para la naturaleza, pero su mayor cualidad es el trabajo sin descanso. Tal como nos cuentan las socias, ellas se ven muy identificadas con este insecto por esa cualidad, el trabajo y la perseverancia. Esta Asociación esta conformada por 19 socias muy trabajadoras que se dedican principalmente al comercio y en algunos casos la preparación de comida, algunas cuentan con su propio restaurante, y en ocasiones al carecer de un puesto de venta de comida, se dedican a la venta en plena vía pública. Ellas precisan de capital para poder reactivar sus negocios, principalmente aquellos puestos de comida, que se alistan para aquellas entradas folklóricas que se llevan a cabo en la época de carnaval.

loans.use: THE MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION WILL USE THE MONEY TO BOOST THEIR BUSINESSES OF PREPARING AND SELLING FOOD

loans.name: Daysi Yadira

texts.es:
Daysi is 45 years old and the single mother of 3 children. Her ten year old son is at home with her, and the others live on their own. Daysi raised her children by herself without the help of the children's father. They live in the neighborhood called Villa Isarel. With a lot of sacrifice, she has been able to provide for all of her children, and now her priority is the care and education of her young son.

Without the help of a husband, Daysi decided to start a small business which would allow her to cover her household costs. So, she set up a small food stand in front of her house and has been running it for 5 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to improve her small eatery so she can attract more customers.

Daysi tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales solo uno depende económicamente de ella, el niño tiene 10 años y está estudiando en primaria, el resto de los hijos viven de manera independiente. esta madre ha criado a todos sus hijos sola y sin el payo del padre de los hijos, ella habita en el barrio Villa Isarel. Doña Daysi con mucho sacrificio ha sacado adelante a todos sus hijos, en estos momentos su prioridad es lla de cuidar y educar al único hijo que está a su cargo .Al verse sin el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, esta madre decide emprender un pequeño negocio que le ayude a solventar todos los gastos familiares que enfrentaba, es así como decide montar en el frente de su vivienda una pequeña comidería, la cual ya tiene 5 años de tenerla y es con la podido salir adelante, el préstamo lo requiere para seguir inviertiendo en su negocio y poder a un plazo corto mejorar la infraestructura del lugar para que le permita atraer más clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MEAT AND VEGETABLES FOR HER SMALL EATERY, WHICH SHE RUNS FROM A STAND IN FRONT OF HER HOME.  THE INCOME FROM THIS BUSINESS PAYS FOR THE CARE AND EDUCATION OF HER TEN YEAR OLD SON.

loans.name: Belleza Duradera Group

texts.es:
Lasting beauty is the name of the association comprised of a group of enterprising young women that are dedicated chiefly to marketing of all kinds of merchandise; from clothes, articles for the home, plastics, and merchandise that in some cases they make themselves.

Toward this end, many of them have sales locations in strategic market centers that very are busy, as much in the city of La Paz as in the city of El Alto.

They need capital to be able to increase their profits and increase the quantity of merchandise. Only in this way will they be able to achieve the purchase, enlargement or restructuring of their homes, since a great percentage of these associates lack a home of their own or adequate conditions for the number of children and relatives that live with them.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Belleza Duradera, es el nombre de la Asociación integrada por un grupo de mujeres jóvenes y emprendedoras que se dedican principalmente al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería, desde ropa, artículos para el hogar, plásticos, y mercadería que en algunos casos ellas mismas confeccionan.

Para este fin muchas de ellas cuentan con puestos de venta en estratégicos centros de venta que son muy concurridos, tanto en la ciudad de La Paz, como en la ciudad de El Alto.

Ellas precisan de capital para poder incrementar sus ganancias, variando la cantidad de mercadería, solo de esta manera podrán en algunos casos acceder a la compra, ampliación, remodelación de sus viviendas, ya que un gran porcentaje de estas socias, carecen de una vivienda propia o en condiciones adecuadas para el número de hijos y familiares con los que viven.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resales such as clothes, articles for the home, and plastics.

loans.name: Urania Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Urania is 58 years old. She lives alone; her three children live on their own. She lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, a neighborhood located in the most conflict-ridden zones of the city. Her children help Ms. Urania economically but this help is not sufficient to cover her expenses and that is why she decided to begin selling cosmetics and perfumes door-to-door.

Despite her age, Urania is a very entrepreneurial woman. Her short-term goal is to put a small store in her house that will permit her to be able to generate more necessary income without her having to go out of the house. Due to her advanced age and the neighborhood in which she lives, this is difficult for her. With this money she will buy more cosmetics and perfumes to be able to continue investing in her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. La Sra Urania tiene 58 años de edad, es una mujer que vive sola, sus tres hijos viven de manera independientes. Habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela un barrio ubicado en las zonas más conflictivas de la ciudad. Sus hijos ayudan economicamente a Doña Urania, pero esta ayuda es insuficiente para solventar sus gastos, es por eso que decidió empezar la venta ambulante de cosmeticos y perfumes. A pesar de su edad Urania es una mujer muy emprendedora, sus metas a corto plazo es poner poner una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación que le permita poder generar los ingresos necsarios sin necesidad de salir de su casa, ya que por su avanzada edad y por el barrio donde habita muchas veces se le hace difícil. Con este dinero comprará más cosméticos y perfumes para seguir inviertiendo en sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Socorro Del Rosario

texts.es:
Socorro lives in the neighborhood called Laureles Sur, a place where it's difficult to live due to the lack of drinkable water and electricity. Socorro is 32 years old and the single mother of 4 children. Her oldest daughter is now studying at university, and helps her mother with the care and maintenance of the household.

Socorro has a business selling small quantities of condiments and various plants which the Nicaraguan families use for medicinal purposes. This business has enabled her to provide an income for her family. The loan will be used to purchase more plants so she can continue running her business.

Socorro habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, lugar donde la subsistencia de las familias se hace muy dificil debido a la falta de agua potable y luz electrica. Tiene 32 años de edad y 4 hijos, es madre soltera. Su hija mayor quien se encuentra estudiando en la universidad es quien le ayuda con el cuido del hogar y los oficios de la casa. Doña Socorro tiene un negocio de ventas en pequeñas cantidades de condimentos y algunas plantas buscadas entre las familias nicaraguenses ya sea para hacer té o para medicamentos, como los son canela, achote, mostaza, y éstos los obtiene de pequeños siembros que tiene en su casa de habitación. Este negocio le ha servido para generar los ingresos de su familia, es por eso que desea obtener más arboles pra sembrarlos y poder seguir vendiendo estas plantas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE PLANTS FOR HER BUSINESS.  AS A SINGLE MOTHER, SHE PROVIDES THE ONLY INCOME FOR THE FAMILY.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa lives in the San Sebastian neighborhood in Managua. She was born in the city of León on October 11, 1963, but came to Managua to look for a better life. She's 44 years old and has a 15 year old daughter in school.

She works selling general merchandise, but specializes in selling silver and gold jewelry. She began her business 20 years ago and it's been successful, so much so that now the business depends on having much more merchandise.

She has salespeople that deliver the merchandise and for this they earn commission. She thinks that she has aquired a lot of experience in this business, she likes what she does and feels very proud to have grown this business. She needs money to buy more jewelry and continue investing in more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Luisa habita en el barrio San Sebastian. Nació en la ciudad de león el 11 de Octubre de 1963, pero emigró a Managua en busca de una mejor vida. Tiene 44 años de edad y una hija de 15 años quien se encuentra estudiando. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, en especial a la venta de prendas de oro y plata. Empezó su negocio hace 20 años y ha ido prosperando, tanto que ahora cuenta con mucha más existencia de su mercadería. Tiene vendedores a quienes les entrega la mercadería y éstos ganan por comisión. Ella piensa que ha adquirido mucha experiencia en este negocio por que le gusta lo que hace y se siente muy orgullosa de haber hecho crecer este negocio. Necesita el dinero para comprar más prendas y seguir colocando su mercadería .

loans.use: Purchase of  jewelry for her business

loans.name: Laura Inés

texts.es:
Laura Inés’ husband works as a driver in an Abastos market. Nevertheless, what he earns is not enough to pay for the expenses of their three children. As a result, Laura began, on the recommendation of her mother-in-law, a business selling toys and cosmetics, among other things, in a market so that they could earn more income. It was 15 years ago that Laura started this business and, little by little, her shop has been growing thanks to her knack for selling what her customers seek. Currently, she sells clothing, caps and many other things.

Nevertheless, Laura believes it is necessary to resupply her shop. As a result, she is soliciting a credit of US $250 which she will repay in 4 months. With this money, Laura will be able to buy caps for the summer, as well as Frisbees and T-shirts so that she can have more stock for her shop. With your help, Laura will be able to realize her dream of establishing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Laura Inés trabaja como chofer en un mercado de Abastos. Sin embargo con lo que gana no les alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus tres hijos es por eso que Laura comenzó, por recomendación de su suegra, un negocio de venta de juguetes, cosméticos y variedad en un mercado para poder obtener mayores ingresos. Hace 15 años que Laura comenzó con este negocio. Y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su local. Gracias a su capacidad de vender lo que sus clientes buscan. Actualmente ya vende ropa, gorras y muchas otras cosas.

Sin embargo Laura considera que es necesario resurtir su local. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Laura podrá comprar gorras para la temporada, así como discos y playeras para así poder tener mayor surtido en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá hacer su sueño de establecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Two years ago, a group of 18 women joined Pro Mujer in Centro Focal de Villa Adela under the name of “Sembrando Esperanza” (sowing hope), a name that contains a profound significance for them since their objective is to improve their quality of life, and more specifically, that of their children.

Two years ago, these women knew nothing of business, commerce and other necessary skills for their subsistence. Today, each one of them possesses a business, related to the production of clothing, artisan textiles or simply commerce related to clothing in general.

At this time, the trend is inclined towards the production of traditional dresses, dancing costumes, masks and other items related to Carnival. This is a propitious season for these women to generate and increase their resources so that they can face the needs that arise all year, until the next Carnival season or next religious, folk or civic festivities when they can take advantage of increasing sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Hace dos años, un grupo de 18 mujeres ingresaron a Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Villa Adela, bajo el denominativo de “ Sembrando Esperanza”, nombre que contiene un profundo significado para ellas, puesto que su objetivo es mejorar su calidad de vida y principalmente la de sus hijos. Hace dos años, estas mujeres no contaban con conocimiento alguno sobre negocios, comercio y otras destrezas necesarias para la subsistencia. Hoy en día, cada una de ellas posee un negocio, relacionado con la producción de prendas de vestir, artesanías textiles o simplemente el comercio con prendas de vestir en toda su generalidad. En esta época la tendencia esta inclinada a la producción, y confección de vestidos típicos, trajes de baile, máscaras y otros que se relacionan de manera directa para las fiestas de carnaval, temporada propicia para que ellas puedan generar e incrementar mayores recursos para hacer frente a las necesidades que se presentan durante todo el año, hasta la próxima temporada de fiesta, o festividades ya sean religiosas, folklóricas o cívicas donde se aprovecha para una mejor venta.

loans.use: Production of traditional, native clothing.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Approximately two years ago an acquaintance asked Elvira to sell him a great quantity of the tortillas that she makes. Due to this, the flavor of the tortillas that she makes is very recognized in her neighborhood. This was how her business began and little by little the clients keep asking for more.

This is why Elvira is asking for a credit of $325 USD that she will be able to pay within a deadline of 5 months. With this money Elvira will be able to buy more material to make the tortillas that the clients are asking her for and with the money that she makes from these sales she will be able to help her husband with the expenses of their 4 children. With your help Elvira will be able to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Hace aproximadamente hace 2 años que a Elvira un conocido le pidió que le vendiera una gran cantidad de tortillas de haría de las que ella hace. Puesto que el sabor que ella tiene en las tortillas la hizo muy reconocida en su colonia. Fue así como comenzó este negocio y poco a poco los clientes se están haciendo más. Y lo que le piden también.

Es por eso que Elvira está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Elvira podrá comprar más material para elaborar las tortillas que le están solicitando. Y con el dinero que gane de estas ventas podrá ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de sus 4 hijos. Con tu ayuda Elvira podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To buy primary material

loans.name: Sandra Leticia

texts.es:
Sandra Leticia began selling used shoes to her neighbors and friend since her husband’s income as a furniture salesman was not sufficient to pay for the expenses of her three children, who are 14, 8 and 5 years of age. One year ago, she added the sale of new shoes from catalogs to her repertoire. Currently, the majority of her customers know Sandra’s products. As a result, Sandra needs to buy new products to sell.

Sandra is soliciting a credit of US $325 which she will repay within 5 months. With this money, Sandra will be able to buy more merchandise in order to offer her customers more variety. With your help, Sandra can move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra Leticia comenzó a vender zapatos usados entre sus vecinos y amigos, puesto que con lo que su esposo gana como vendedor de muebles. No es suficiente para pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 5 años. Hace 1 año que agregó la venta de calzado nuevo por catálogo entre su repertorio, actualmente la mayoría de sus clientes conocen los productos que vende Sandra, es por eso que Sandra necesita comprar nuevos productos para venderlos.

Sandra está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Sandra podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerle variedad a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Sandra podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Norma Verónica

texts.es:
When Norma learned that she was going to become a mother, she began to worry about how she would support her child since her husband’s income was only enough for the two of them. It was because of this that she decided to sell catalog cosmetics. Little by little, she became known in her area, which also helped her sell floral arrangements of artificial flowers. Currently, she has a long list of clients who seek her out in order to buy her products and/or to request her services of making flower arrangements for parties and other events.

Nevertheless, Norma currently has various orders to fill but she does not have enough money to buy the merchandise and products. As a result, she is soliciting a credit of US $375 which she will repay 6 months. With this money, Norma can buy the merchandise she needs. With your help, Norma can get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando a Norma le dieron la noticia de que sería madre, comenzó a preocuparse en cómo le haría para poder mantener a su hijo. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo sólo les alcanzaba para ellos dos. Fue por eso que se decidió a vender cosméticos por catálogo poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida en su colonia, lo cual le ayudó a vender también arreglos florales de flores artificiales. Actualmente ya cuenta con un gran número de clientes quienes la buscan para poder comprarle los productos y le elaboren floreros y/o arreglos para fiestas y otros eventos.

Sin embargo Norma actualmente tiene varios pedidos que surtir y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente como para comprar la mercancía y los productos es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Norma podrá comprar la mercancía para así poder elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda Norma podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) is the name of a women´s association in the Centro Focal of Villa Adela. 16 women have teamed up to meet their economic objectives. When the 16 members joined this association they were looking for a way to find new hope for their families as most were not generating any income or had failed to generate money in previous ventures.

Currently most of them sell various products in town and travel to various trade fairs (Oruro, Desaguadero) to purchase their goods .

To coincide with the upcoming Carnaval festivities the partners wish to purchase merchandise that is appropiate for these dates. To celebrate the ch´alla they will sell party favors, beer, spirits, balloons, water guns, masks, costumes and other typical Carnaval products.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase goods to sell during Carnaval

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro started his used auto parts shop when a family member that owns a mechanic shop suggested that there was good money to be made in this line of business. Ramiro travels to Reynosa Tamaulipas (3 hours away from Linares), to purchase used auto parts to sell at home. Slowly he has been increasing his client base and is making enough money to support his family.

He is low on stock and needs a micro loan of US $200 to be paid back in 4 months. With more used parts, Ramiro will be able to grow his business and make more money to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase used auto parts

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel comes from a family of carpenters. Ever since he was young, he helped his father with carpentry. Little by little, he learned the fundamentals of making furniture. 25 years ago, after he married, he went out on his own. At first, it was difficult but, little by little, through his good work, Israel began to gain recognition from his customers, who recommended him to others.

Currently, Israel makes ironing boards and practical furniture to sell to furniture shops thereby earning him income faster. Nevertheless, right now, Israel does not have sufficient material to make his products. As a result, he is soliciting a credit of US $575 which he will repay within 6 months. With this money, Israel can begin to buy what he needs to make his products. With your help, Israel can get his family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Israel viene de una familia de carpinteros, desde que comenzó a crecer le ayudó a su papá en la carpintería. Poco a poco fue aprendiendo todo lo necesario para poder fabricar un mueble. Hace 25 años, después de que se casó, se independizó al inicio fue muy difícil pero poco a poco Israel con su buen trabajo como carta de presentación, fue haciéndose reconocido entre sus clientes quienes poco a poco lo recomendaban a otras personas.

Actualmente Israel fabrica muebles para planchar, y cómodas para venderla a mueblerías y así obtener ganancias más rápido. Sin embargo en este momento Israel no cuenta con material suficiente para elaborar sus productos. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Israel podrá comprar mercancía para así poder elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda Israel podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase materials.

loans.name: Yadira Coral

texts.es:
Yadira is a young woman that does not want to be an economic burden for her parents. To help out her family, she started her own business. She is single, has no children and decided to travel outside of Mexico to bring back clothing to sell. Yadira is a smart salesperson, and the clothes she brought back sold out quickly. She began expanding the product range and now she is selling evening gowns.

However Yadira feels the business is not growing enough and she is asking for a US $475 micro loan to pay back in 6 months. With this influx of cash she will purchase more clothing and will be able to offer her clients a greater variety of apparel.

With your help, Yadira will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase clothing stocks

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
"I have a house which only needs the final exterior touches to be completed. The build out had to be interrupted due to a lack of funds. My husband and I have worked very hard to make our house bigger as it is the patrimony that we will leave our children."

"I am asking for a $1200 US micro loan to finish building our home."

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Finalize construction of my home

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
"I´ve been selling tacos from this stand next to my house for a year and a half now. Sales are good, but I think that if I invest a bit more in my business I will sell more tacos and make more money. My husband has a small mechanics´ workshop and thanks to both our businesses we are able to provide for our family.

I am requesting $300 US to invest in my taco stand.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase food to sell

loans.name: Victor Javier

texts.es:
My wife and I have run a taco and tortas (Mexican sandwich) shop for the past year. Thanks to God things have gone very well for us, but now we would like to invest some money in the purchase of more merchandise since we need certain things our customers have requested. In this way we will have more sales and thereby more income. We would also like to fix-up the space that we use for our shop. This would include painting and making some repairs. I am asking for $300 dollars to invest in the purchase of merchandise and in making repairs for my business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi marido y yo tenemos un venta de tacos y tortas en mi casa desde hace 1 año gracias a dios nos ha ido muy bien pero ahora nos gustaría invertir un poco en la compra de más mercancía ya que necesitamos tener algunas cosas que nuestros clientes nos solicitan y así tendremos más ventas y por la tanto más ganancias también nos gustaria arreglar un poco el espacio que tenemos destinado para el negocio como pintar y hacer algunas reparaciones”. Solicito $ 300.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de mercancía para mi negocio y hacerle algunas reparaciones.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of merchandise for my business

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
For seven years, in the city of León in the Central market, Maria Q. has worked selling clothing of all sizes and for all ages. In the market, she now has her own section, which was a big investment. She has also been able to supply her business with a larger amount of clothing. Having her own section and more clothing to sell, allow her to better support her two small children.

She started the business 7 years ago, selling clothes by walking around the market, exposing herself to the sun and wearing down her body because of walking so much. Little by little she began to save money until she eventually was able to purchase an inside spot in the market.

Since she was able to obtain this section in the market three years ago, she has had 12 loans with Ceprodel which have had a big impact for her - she has bought larger quantities of clothing to sell in addition to being able to sustain the nucleus of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 7 años en la ciudad de León en el mercado Central, la señora Maria Q. se dedica a la venta de ropa de todos tamaños y para todas las edades. Posee un tramo propio el cual le ha costado mucha inversión y por ser madre de dos hijos pequeños a que mantener ha logrado surtir de mayores cantidades de ropa su negocio.

El negocio lo comienza hace 7 años vendiendo ambulante en todo el mercado, exponiéndose al sol y al desgaste físico de producidos por el caminar mucho. Poco a poco comenzó a invertir para pagar un local interno en el mercado hasta que lo obtuvo.

Desde que logro obtener el tramo en el mercado hace tres años, ha realizado 12 créditos en Ceprodel que le han impactado grandemente por el hecho de que ha comprado mayores volúmenes de ropa para ofrecer y además ha podido sostener el núcleo de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Elena Aurora

texts.es:
Elena C. is a strong woman with a great determination for self-improvement. 20 years ago, she started her own business making and selling tortillas in the Estación market in the department of León.

She began with $2000 cordobas which she invested to buy a wooden table that she still has in her possesion to this day. In addition, she aquired the ingredients to make these delicious tortillas. It should be noted that Mrs. C. is a mother of three children who feels that the core of her responsibilities is to provide her children the opportunity to go to school, and the income that she obtains from the sale of tortillas doesn't cover these expenses.

Upon realizing the difficulty in supporting her children and to improve the conditions of her business, Mrs. C. has had 10 loans with Ceprodel. According to her, these loans have benefitted her greatly as she has aquired larger quantities of ingredients to make her tortillas and in addition, she has been able to support her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Elena C. es una dama muy esforzada y con un gran espíritu de superación personal. Desde hace 20 años inició su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas en el mercado la Estación del departamento de León .

Inició con un monto de C$ 2000 que los invirtió de manera personal para la compra de una mesa de madera que hasta hoy en día posee, además adquirió los ingredientes para la elaboración de estas sabrosas tortillas. Es necesario destacar que la señora C. es madre de tres hijos que tiene bajo su responsabilidad de brindarle los estudios de primaria y con el ingreso que obtiene de la venta de tortillas no le cubre para estos gastos.

Al darse cuenta de la dificultad de mantener a sus hijos y además mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, la señora C. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (10 créditos) y según cuenta, le han sido de mucho beneficio por el hecho de que ha adquirido mayores cantidades de materia prima y además ha podido apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase of tortillas.

loans.name: Constantina Nubia

texts.es:
Constantina has worked selling basic grains in the Estación market in the city of León with much strength and sacrifice since she was 12 years old. According to Constantina, her business has grown little by little throughout the year, improving the standard of living of her humble family.

6 months ago, Mrs. M. decided to invest in her business so she turned to Ceprodel, who granted her loans to purchase basic grains such as rice, beans and corn. Nowadays, thanks to Ceprodel, she has been successful in improving her business of selling grains and in addition, has been able to support her household, giving her family a better life. She has had four loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de granos básicos es el negocio al que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio se dedica la señora Constantina desde hace 12 años en el mercado la Estación de la ciudad de León. Según comenta su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco a medida que han pasado los años y por tal razón ha mejorado el nivel de vida de su humilde familia

Desde hace 6 meses la señora M. se decidió invertir en el negocio y para esto recurrió a Ceprodel quien le brindo créditos para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles y maíz. Hoy en día, gracias a Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su negocio de venta de granos y además ha logrado mantener su hogar dándole un mejor nivel de vida a los suyos. Su record crediticio es de 4 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains.

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Luis is married and has a 19 year old daughter in his care. Luis is a tailor and his wife is a dressmaker. They have a small tailor shop located in their home in the 14 de Septiembre area in Managua. Luis and his wife do work for their neighbors and also they visit businesses to offer their services for contractual work.

Luis has been in this business for many years and thanks to his good service and fine tailoring, he has earned many clients. The loan will help him aquire an electric sewing machine to be able to offer more and better products to his clients. Thanks to this business, Luis can continue to get ahead and support his family with everything that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Don Luis es casado, y tiene una hija a su cargo de 19 años. Don Luis es sastre y su esposa es modista, y los dos tienen un pequeño taller de costura ubicado en su casa de habitación en la 14 de Septiembre. Trabajan para los vecinos cercanos a la zona donde habitan, y tambien ellos mismas visitan algunas empresas para ofertar sus servicios y hacer contratos. Desde varios años atrás tiene este negocio y gracias a su servicio y costura fina ha ganado muchos clientes. El préstamo le ayudará para adquirir una máquina de coser eléctrica para poder ofrecer más y mejores productos a sus clientes. Gracias a este negocio don Luis puede salir adelante y apoyar a su familia en todo lo que necesiten.

loans.use: Purchase electric sewing machine

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.es:
Leopoldina was born in the city of El Rama, but she came to Managua and now works as a maid. She's a single mother with 4 children who help her with the household expenses and housework. Leopoldina wants to fix the back part of her house by building a concrete wall. At present, it's made of scrap metals and wood. Thanks to Leopoldina's efforts, her home has been flourishing. Little by little she is changing her home to concrete so that it's safer and more comfortable for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Leopoldina nació en la ciudad de El Rama, pero se vino a Managua y trabaja como empleda doméstica. Es madre soltera de 4 hijos, los cuales le ayudan con los gastos y oficios de la casa. Doña Leopoldina quiere componer la parte trasera de su casa, haciendo un muro de concreto, la divisi{on actualmente es de desperdicios metálicos y madera. Gracias al esfuerzo de Leopoldina su casa ha ido prosperando. Poco a poco la está cambiando a concreto para poder darle seguridad y comodida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngô Thị Tiến, 50 years old, a member of the TYM Fund sine 1995, started a tea and breakfast stand with 29USD. Because of her stand situates on Route 131 and in the middle of a populated area, the business is well adapted and prosperous. In 1996, she discussed with her husband about taking out loans to expand the business and put more dishes on the menu. Beside her husband, her son also helps her in the kitchen. The monthly income is 300USD. She is applying for a loan of 950USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Ngô Thị Tiến, 50 tuổi, là thành viên Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 1995. Với số vốn khởi đầu là 20USD để mở quán nước chè và bán hàng ăn sáng. Với vị trí nhà ở ngay mặt đường 131 trên khu đông dân cư, việc kinh doanh của chị Tiến khá thuận lợi và phát triển. Năm 1998, chị bàn với chồng và quyết định vay vốn từ nhiều nguồn để nâng cấp, mở cửa hàng ăn tại nhà với các món ăn dân tộc và hấp dẫn như: bún riêu cua, miến ngan, cháo lươn ... Hiện tại, chồng và con trai chị đều tham gia trực tiếp chế biến món ăn. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình là 300USD/tháng. Chị Tiến đang có nhu cầu vay 950 USD để tăng cường mua thực phẩm làm các món ăn, nhằm làm phong phú thêm thực đơn của nhà hàng và thích hợp với nhiều thực khách.

loans.use: Buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Đình, 55 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1995. She lives with her husband and 5 children in Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn. Her husband and the oldest son practice veterinary medicine in the area. She is an active women with a good sense of business. She invested her first loan of 20USD into a flock of egg laying hens and ducks. The year after she had more loan and invested in raising pigs and cows. Since 2000 she has a banquet furniture renting business and a waste, scrap materials business on the side. She has 3 three employees with salary of 80USD a month each. Her monthly income is 350USD. She would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to expand her businesses.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Đình, 55 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ năm 1995. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn. Chị là một người phụ nữ năng động và sử dụng vốn rất linh hoạt. Vòng 1 chị vay 20USD nuôi gà, vịt đẻ trứng. Sang năm thứ 2 chị vay vốn mua bò, lợn giống. Từ năm 2000 gia đình chị chuyển sang làm dịch vụ cho thuê phông bạt bàn ghế, bát đĩa phục vụ đám hiếu, hỷ trong thôn ngoài xã, ngoài ra chị còn mở thêm cửa hàng thu mua phế liệu. Chồng chị và con trai lớn làm dich vụ thú y với địa bàn khá rộng. Hiện tai chị thuê 3 cộng nhân phục vụ các công việc kinh doanh của gia đình, mức lương cho 1 công nhân là 80USD/tháng. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị Đình là 350USD/tháng. Chị đang dự định xin vay tiếp 1200USD để mua thêm bàn ghế, bát đĩa phục vụ nhu cầu ngày càng nhiều của người dân.

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs, chopsticks, bowl for rent

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
“Sister! Give me a loaf of bread.” “Sis! Get me an order of sticky rice.” Those are familiar sound in early morning at the breakfast stand of Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Vân, who is a 50 years old, little plump but quick, pleasant woman. That is why her stand is always crowded. She joins the TYM Fund in 1995 with a small loan to help her open the stand. Things go smoothly and she keeps taking out loan after loan at the maximum limit to expand her breakfast stand. She likes the weekly repayment plan. It’s quick, convenient and small enough. In 2000, her husband opens a steel door shop. Their monthly income is 380USD. She is applying a loan of 1200USD to replenish both her breakfast stand and his shop ready for the upcoming Tết .

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


“Chị ơi! Cho em cái bánh mì”,“Chị ơi! Cho em gói xôi”,“Chị ơi!...” Đó là những âm thanh vô cùng quen thuộc tại quán ăn sáng của gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Vân. 50 tuổi, dáng người to béo, “đậm đà” nhưng nhanh nhẹn, đôi bàn tay khéo léo làm hàng một cách điêu luyện, và đăc biệt là nụ cười lúc nào cũng thường trực trên mội. Chẳng thế mà lúc nào quán của chị cũng đông khách tấp nập ra vào. Chị Vân tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 1995, mới đầu chỉ chỉ vay để bán hàng ăn sáng. Sau thấy việc bán hàng ăn có hiệu quả, chị liên tục vay tối đa các vòng vốn tiếp theo để đầu tư cho cửa hàng rộng rãi hơn, sạch sẽ và khang trang hơn. Chị rất thích cơ chế trả hàng tuần, vừa gọn nhẹ, lại có thể tiết kiệm. Năm 2000, anh Đạm, chồng chị, bàn với chị mở cửa hàng cơ khí để phát triển thêm về kinh tế, vừa là để đỡ bỏ phí nghề sẵn có trong tay. Chị đồng ý và mở cửa hàng cơ khí chuyên cửa hoa, cửa xếp, tường rào ... Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình hiện nay là 380USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị dự định vay 1200USD để mua thêm thực phẩm bán hàng, đồng thời mua thêm sắt và tôn để kịp hàng Tết khách đã đặt trước.

loans.use: Buy food for her restaurant, buy iron, corrugated iron

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị V., 37 years old, lives in Khoái Châu, Hưng Yên and marries to a cadre in Tiên Dược. They have 3 children, two are in school age. Their house situates in center of the village, that’s ideal for business. Last few years she always takes out loans at the maximum limits to invest in her store and her animal husbandry business. The daily income is hefty at 12USD. She would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to expand her businesses. She’s been with the TYM Fund for 7 years.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị V., 37 tuổi, quê ở Khoái Châu, Hưng Yên lấy chồng là bộ đội ở Tiên Dược. Hai anh chị có 3 cháu trong đó 2 cháu đang trong độ tuổi đi học, một cháu còn nhỏ. Nhà chị ở trung tâm thôn có cửa hàng rộng rãi rất thuận lợi cho việc buôn bán. Năm 1996 chị xin vào Quỹ vay vốn làm ăn. Những năm vừa qua, chị luôn vay các mức vốn cao đầu tư buôn bán thức ăn chăn nuôi, hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập mỗi ngày từ cửa hàng là 12USD. Chị V. là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương. Hiện tại chị muốn vay 1200USD nữa để mở rộng cửa hàng, mua hàng phục vụ nhu cầu của nhân dân

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị C., 38 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1995. She took out her first loan of 20USD to buy rice to resell, also to buy material for making candy then selling them in Sóc Sơn. The family’s economy is improving. Her house is right on the Route 131 near by the headquarter of the 371st Army Division. In 2002 she starts a bar selling draft beer to soldiers of the division. Next to the bar she starts grocery store for soldiers’ family. The monthly income is 300USD. She is applying a loan of 1200USD to get her bar and store ready for the Tết. She lives with her husband and 3 children in Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn.

From Wikipedia: Tết Nguyên Đán, more commonly known by its shortened name Tết, is the most important and popular holiday and festival in Vietnam. It is the Vietnamese New Year which is based on the Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar. The name Tết Nguyên Đán is Sino-Vietnamese for Feast of the First Morning, derived from the Hán nôm characters 節元旦. In modern Chinese, the characters for Nguyên Ðán (元旦) have evolved to refer to New Year in the Gregorian calendar, that is, January 1.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị C., 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 1995. Năm thứ nhất chị vay 20USD buôn bán gạo và bánh kẹo nhỏ lẻ tại huyện Sóc Sơn. Kinh tế gia đình cũng có một số thay đổi sau khi kinh doanh mặt hàng này. Với lợi thế nhà ngay mặt đường 131 cạnh sư đoàn 371 nên năm 2002 với số tiền tích lũy được và vay thêm của anh em trong gia đình, chị C. đã cải tạo lại nhà và mở cửa hàng bán bia hơi. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa tại gia đình với nhiều mặt hàng phong phú phục vụ tiêu dùng của người dân và các cơ quan đơn vị quân đội. Thu nhập bình quân từ cửa hàng là 300USD/tháng. Chị đề nghị được vay 1200USD trong vòng vốn này. Chị tâm sự rất cần vốn để mua hàng phục vụ Tết nguyên đán khi nhu cầu mua sắm của người dân tăng cao. Hiện chị C. đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en: Abdulla lives with his family in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He was in the army for about 8 years. When he left he started a new retail shop. He has decided enlarge his business so he is requesting an individual loan to buy extra materials like baskets, boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, twin-picks and triple-picks to complete his stock and make a good income to help his family. He is happy that he can further this business.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets

loans.name: Bimal

texts.en:
Bimal Dongol lives in a single family with her husband and a son in Khogana, Lalitpur. Khogana village is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband, Mr. Raju Dongol, is a carpenter in his own furniture shop. Due to economic problems, her son went to Malaysia to earn money.

Mrs. Dongol is a farmer in Thecho Village. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her own land. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and in the evening.

Now she is requesting her fifth loan of Rs 30000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 28 years old. He is married and has two children who are studying in school. His mother and his brother live with him in a rented house. His brother is disabled from birth.

He have a small carpentry shop and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase new wood and some raw material and expand his project by renovating the shop to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new wood and some raw materials

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 44 years old. He has 4 children. Two of them are studying in university and the other two are studying in primary and secondary schools. He has an old, small shop for electric supplies and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase new electric supplies, renovate and paint the shop, and do some advertising to increase his income and develop himself.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new electric  supplies

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old. She has three children studying in school. Her husband is unemployed and they live in a rented house. She has a small sewing shop in her house and she has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and new fabric and paint the shop to improve herself and increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering her name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru:
Safar S. is 51 years old, has secondary education, married and has 4 children. Safar is in breeding and sales of cattle and he has been doing it for the past 20 years. He plans to use the loan to buy a milk cow. By buying a milk cow he expects to get milk for resale and for personal use. Part of the milk will be sold to the locals so he can pay back the loan, and the other part he will keep for himself.

Safar plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шерханов Сафар, возраст – 51 год, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Сафар занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 20 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести дойную корову. Приобретя дойную корову он планирует получать молоко от коровы для продажи и личного пользования. Часть молока он будет продавать местным жителям для выплаты кредита, а другую часть молока будет использовать в личных целях.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Jonikul

texts.ru:
Jonikul A. is 49 years old, has secondary education, married and has 4 children. Jonikul has been in animal husbandry for the past 12 years. He wants to use the loan to increase the number of heads of his cattle. He plans to sell each one after 40-45 days. He will use the profits to buy younger cattle and the rest of the money he will use to support his family.

Jonikul plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Артикулов Джоникул , возраст – 49 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Джоникул занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 12 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота. Он планирует продавать скот через каждые 40-45 дней. Полученную прибыль он будет использовать на приобретение нового молодого скота, а оставшиеся средства на содержание своей семьи.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying and selling of cattle

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru:
Tursunoy Altiboeva is 34 years old, has secondary education, married and has 6 children. Tursunoy is in the animal husbandry business and has been doing it for the past 10 years. She plans to use the loan to buy two calves. Because she is a housewife and does not work anywhere, she will feed the calves and then resell them after 40-45 days. By doing this she will contribute to the welfare of her family. Her husband is also helping her with the business.

Tursunoy plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Алтибоева Турсуной, возраст – 34 года, образование – среднее, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Турсиной занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 10 лет. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести 2-х молодых бычков. Так как она негде не работает и сидит дома, она будет откармливать бычков и через каждые 40-45 дней продавать их. Таким образом она вносит свой вклад в содержание своей семьи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает муж.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying and selling of cattle

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Manzura S. is 24 years old, she has secondary education, divorced with no children. Manzura has a small plot of land attached to the house. Because the sowing season has almost arrived, Manzura plans to use the loan to buy seeds of wheat for a lower price than they will cost in a few weeks. The loan will give her an opportunity to buy the seeds, sow her crop area, cultivate it and harvest it and keep it for her family as she uses the wheat to make flour for bread for personal use. She has been doing it for the past 5 years.

Manzura plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоева Манзура, возраст – 24 года, образование – среднее, разведенная, детей не имеет. Манзура имеет небольшой приусадебный участок. Так как наступает посевной сезон, Манзура на полученный кредит планирует приобрести семена пшеницы по менее дорогой цене, чем она будет через несколько недель. Кредит даст ей возможность приобрести семена пшеницы, засеять свой участок и собрать урожай, который она оставит для своей семьи, так как они использует пшеницу для перемола в муку и выпечку хлеба для личного потребления. Она уже в течение 5 лет занимается этим видом деятельности.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru:
Isroil G. is 36 years old, has secondary education and is a doctor by profession. He is married and has 3 children. Isroil works as a doctor in the local psychiatric clinic for children. He also has a plot of land next to his house where he plants wheat every year. He has 10 years of experience in this field. He plans to use the loan to buy wheat seeds for sowing of his land. After the harvest he will keep a part of it for to make flour and bread and the rest he will sell to the locals at the below market price. Therefore, the local residents will have an option to buy wheat to make own flour.

Isroil plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гурезов Исроил, возраст – 36 лет, образование – высшее, по специальности врач, женат, имеет 3 детей. Исроил работает врачом в местной клинике для психически больных людей. Также он имеет участок земли рядом со своим домом, на которм каждый год сеет пшеницу, его опыт в этом виде деятельности 10 лет. На поолученный кредит он планирует приобрести семена пшеницы для засева земельного участка. После получения урожая, часть его он оставит для производства муки и выпечки хлеба, а другую часть реализует местным жителям по цене ниже рыночной. Местные жители будут иметь возможность приобрести пшеницу для производства муки.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Melik

texts.ru:
Melik S. is 46 years old, has college education with a degree in chemistry and biology. He is married and has 5 children. Melik works in the regional sanitary and epidemic control center. He also has a plot of land, which has been allocated to him by the collective farm (kolkhoz), where he plants wheat every year. He has 7 years of experience in this field. He plans to use the loan to buy wheat seeds for sowing of his land. After the harvest he will keep a part of it to make flour and bread and the rest of it will sell to the locals at the below market price. Therefore, the local residents will have an option of buying wheat to make own flour.

Melik plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипов Мелик, возраст – 46 лет, образование – высшее, по специальности химик - биолог, женат, имеет 5 детей. Мелик работает в Районом центре по санитарно-эпидемическому контролю. Также он имеет участок земли выделенный ему колхозом, на которм каждый год сеет пшеницу, его опыт в этом виде деятельности 7 лет. На поолученный кредит он планирует приобрести семена пшеницы для засева земельного участка. После получения урожая, часть его он оставит для производства муки и выпечки хлеба, а другую часть реализует местным жителям по цене ниже рыночной. Местные жители будут иметь возможность приобрести пшеницу для производства муки.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru:
Saidmurod U. is 38 years old, has a professional degree in accounting, is married and has 4 children. Mr. U. works in the regional center for disease control. He also has a plot of land alloted to him by the farmers co-op (kolchoz) on which he plants wheat every year. He has 15 years experience with growing wheat. He is planning to use this loan to purchase wheat seeds to plant his land. After the harvest he will keep some of the grain for milling into flour and baking bread, while he will sell the rest to the local residents at a price below the market value. Local residents will be able to purchase wheat for making flour. Mr. U. is planning to pay back his loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Умаров Саидмурод, возраст – 38 лет, образование – средне-специальное, по специальности бухгалтер, женат, имеет 4 детей. Саидмурод работает в Районом центре по санитарно-эпидемическому контролю. Также он имеет участок земли выделенный ему колхозом, на которм каждый год сеет пшеницу, его опыт в этом виде деятельности 15 лет. На поолученный кредит он планирует приобрести семена пшеницы для засева земельного участка. После получения урожая, часть его он оставит для производства муки и выпечки хлеба, а другую часть реализует местным жителям по цене ниже рыночной. Местные жители будут иметь возможность приобрести пшеницу для производства муки. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of wheat seeds

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru:
Murodali S. is 41 years old, has a high school diploma, is married and has 5 children. He is a professional construction worker but has been raising and selling cattle for the last 16 years. He is planning to use this loan to purchase two calves. After he has fattened them, he will sell the animals every 40-45 days. Murodali will use the money he makes from sales to purchase additional animals. He will use the profits from his business to support his family, since this is his main source of income. Murodali is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Сайдалиев Муродали, возраст – 41 год, образование – среднее, по специальности строитель, женат, имеет 5 детей. Сайдалиев Муродали занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота уже в течение 16 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести двух молодых бычков. После их откормки он будет продавать их через каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги он будет приобретать новый скот, а полученную прибыль он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи, так как это является его основным источником дохода Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hait

texts.ru:
Hait M. is 69 years old, has a high school diploma and works as a security guard in the Varzob's school. He is married and has 2 children. Mr. M. supplements his salary by raising and selling cattle. He is planning to use this loan to purchase a calf for fattening and sale. He will be selling the calves after 40-45 days of feeding and use the money to purchase new animals. Mr. M. will use the profits made from his business to support his family, since the salary of a security guard is very small and is not sufficient for basic human needs. With this loan he will have a second source of income. Mr. M. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Мухидинов Хаит, возраст – 69 лет, образование – среднее, работает сторожем в средней школе Варзобского района, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Хаит занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести 1 молодого бычка для откормки и продажи. Он планирует продавать бычков после 40-45 дней откорма, на вырученные деньги приобретать новых, а полученную прибыль использовать на содержание семьи, так как получаемая заработная плата очень маленькая и не хватает на удовлетворение своих нужд. Получив данный кредит он получит дополнительный источник дохода. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Muzayam

texts.ru:
Muzayam N. is 41 years old, has a high school diploma, is married and has 6 children. Muzayam has been raising and selling cattle for the last 16 years. She is planning to use this loan to purchase a calf which she will fatten and sell in the next 40-45 days. Every time she makes a sale she will purchase more animals and use the profits from animal sales to support her family. She is planning to pay back her loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Норова Музаям, возраст – 41 год, образование – среднее, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Музаям занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 16 лет. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение одного молодого бычка, которого она планирует откармливать в течение 40-45 дней после чего продаст. Каждый раз после продажи она будет приобретать молодняк, а полученную прибыль использовать на оказание помощи в содержание семьи Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Shuhrat S. is 28 years old, has finished high school, is married and has no children. Shuhrat has been raising and selling cattle for the last 3 years. He is planning to use the loan to purchase a milk cow for the purpose of selling it's milk.
