His neighbors as well as residents of neighboring kishlaks (Tajik word for "village") will be able to purchase milk for him for personal consumption as well as for sale to the city of Tursun-zoda. Shuhrat is planning to pay back his loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Сохибов Шухрат, возраст – 28 лет, образование – среднее, женат, детей не имеет. Шухрат занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит Шухрат планирует приобрести дойную корову для получения и продажи молока. Данный кредит даст возможность Шухрату получать ежедневные удои молока, которые он будет использовать для продажи. Соседи, а также жители соседних кишлаков будут иметь возможность приобретать молока для личного потребления, а также для дальнейшей продажи жителям города Турсунзаде. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of a milk cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba M. is 21 years old, has a high school degree, is not married and has no children. Matluba makes and sells pirozhki (meat, cabbage or mushroom stuffed hand pies) and other baked goods on the market of the city of Tursun-zoda. She has been running her business for the last one and half years. She is planning to use her loan to purchase a large batch of flour for her business. This loan will allow Matluba to increase the amount of baked goods she can sell, and the local merchants will be able to buy fresh pirozhki from her for their lunch. Matluba is planning to pay back her loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Махмудова Матлюба, возраст – 21 год, образование – среднее, не замужем, детей не имеет. Матлюба занимается выпечкой пирожков и других мучных изделий на рынке в городе Турсунзаде.Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 1,5 лет. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести муку для производства своих изделий. Данный кредит даст возможность Матлюба увеличит количество своих продаж, а местные торговцы всегда смогут приобрести у нее свежие пирожки, для того чтобы пообедать. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of flour

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.ru:
Abduvahob A. is 53 years old. He has a higher education. He is married and has 9 children. Currently, Abduvahob works as a school teacher. He also raises and sells livestock. He has been raising and selling livestock for the past three years. With the proceeds from his loan, Abduvahob intends to purchase more livestock to resell in the future. Since the schoolteacher’s salary is very small, Abduvahov spends his weekends buying and selling livestock. This loan will give him a chance to increase his profits from his sales. Abduvahov plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Алимардонов Абдувахоб, возраст – 53 года, образование – высшее, по специальности педагог, женат, имеет 9-х детей. В настоящее время он работает в школе преподователем. Абдувахоб также занимается разведением и продажей мелкого рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота для дальнейшей продажи. Так как в школе он получает маленькую зарплату он по воскресеньям и субботам дополнительно занимается продажей скота. Данный кредит даст ему возможность получать дополнительный доход от торговли. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Breading and selling livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Mamhmadali H. is 49 years old. He has a secondary education. He is married and has six children. Mahmadali has a small plot of land where he wants to plant wheat. Mahmadali intends to use the proceeds of his loan to purchase wheat seeds as well as purchase livestock. When the wheat is ready to be harvested, he will use the wheat to make flour for bread for his family during the winter. The profits he receives from reselling livestock will cover his loan payments. Mahmadali plans to repay his loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Хомидов Махмадали, возраст – 49 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Махмадали имеет небольшой участок земли, на которм он хочет посеять пшеницу. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение семян пшеницы, а также на приобретение и продажу мелкого рогатого скота. Полученный урожай он планирует отсавить себе, так как в течение всей следующей зимы он будет пользоваться ею для производства муки и выпечки хлеба. За счет прибыли, которую он планирует получать от продажи мелкого рогатого скота, будет погашать текущие платежи по кредиту. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase wheat seeds  and breading and selling livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hòa, 50 years old, graduated from an agricultural university, veterinary medicine major. In 1994, due to a family reason she resigned from a government position then opened a pharmacy and started practicing veterinary medicine. In 1999, she joins the TYM Fund, took out her first loan. Her business is so prosperous that enables her to build a 2-storey house for the couple and 2 small children. She is naturally good with kids so she offers to baby-sit 7 more children besides hers. The monthly income for all those activities is 350USD. She would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to purchase more medicine and equipment. She is planning to open a kindergarten in near future.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Hòa, 50 tuổi, tốt nghiệp đại học nông nghiệp chuyên nghành chăn nuôi thú y. Năm 1994 vì lý do gia đình nên chị xin nghỉ công việc nhà nước về mở cửa hàng bán thuốc và dịch vụ thú y. Năm 1999 chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn phụ thêm vào công việc kinh doanh. Với kinh nghiệm lâu năm và uy tín nên việc kinh doanh làm ăn rất thuận lợi. Chị xây được ngôi nhà 2 tầng khang trang sạch sẽ thoáng mát cho gia đình gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con. Tính cách nhân hậu yêu thương con trẻ nên chị còn nhận trông 7 cháu cho các đôi vợ chồng trẻ để họ yên tâm công tác. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị 350USD/tháng. Chị mong muốn được vay thêm 1200USD để mua thuốc và thiết bị thú y. Trong tương lai chị mong muốn sẽ có đủ điều kiện để thành lập một trường mầm non tư thục.

loans.use: Buy veterinary medicine, equipment

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.ru:
Jamilya A. is 55 years old. She is divorced and has four children. She sells bulk cotton. She has been in this business for 3 years. With the proceeds of her loan Jamilya wants to purchase cotton wholesale. She will then resell the cotton to local residents. Cotton is a very popular material in Tajikistan as it is used to make traditional mattresses and blankets. Jamilya will be able to grow her business and will be able to provide for her four children. She is planning to repay her loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Ахмедова Джамиля, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, разведенная, имеет 4-х детей. Джамиля занимается продажей ватой. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести большое количество ваты. Приобретая оптом вату она ее продает местным жителям. Жители получат возможность приобретать им необходимое количество ваты, так как это она пользуется большим спросом. Ее использует для пошива местных национальных матрасов. Джамиля будет иметь возможность продолжать свой бизнес и содержать свою семью, так как она мать одиночка и воспитывает 4 детей. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cotton wholesale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
In 1994, when a TYM Fund branch was opened in Tiên Dược, Mrs. Phạm Thị O., 45 years old now, was among the first to join the fund. She borrowed her first loan of 20USD to raise few pigs. Her pigs raising business prospered, next rounds of loan she applied to the maximum limits. She always maintains 7 or 8 pigs ready for slaughtered in her inventory. In 2000, she sent the oldest son to a mechanical school. Upon his graduation she invested 2000USD to open a shop for him. Her youngest daughter is still in school. The family’s economy is adequate. Besides raising pigs and farming the family’s rice paddy, she sells scrap material. Subsequently she built a scrap material processing plant. The plant is prosperous and employs 15 workers with monthly salary of 50USD per employee. The net profit is 380USD a month. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to finance her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Năm 1994, khi Quỹ Tình thương về đến xã Tiên Dược, chị Phạm Thị O., 45 tuổi, là một trong những người đầu tiên tham gia với Quỹ. Đầu tiên chị vay mức vốn 20USD để chăn nuôi lợn. Được cái duyên mát tay, chị chăn nuôi rất phát triển. Các vòng vốn sau, chị vay tối đa tập trung cho chăn nuôi, lúc nào chị cũng có 7,8 con lợn thịt trong chuồng. Năm 2000, chị O. cho người con lớn đi học sửa chữa xe máy và mở cửa hàng với số vốn 2000USD. Con út của chị O. vẫn đang đi học. Cuộc sống của gia đình khá đầy đủ. Ngoài việc chăn nuôi và đồng ruộng, chị O. còn đi chợ phế liệu, thu mua bao tải cũ. Công việc thuận lợi, chị bàn với chồng vay vốn của Quỹ cộng thêm số tiền tích lũy được mở cơ sở sơ chế bao bì, phế liệu. Hiện nay, cơ sở của chị khá lớn mạnh với 15 công nhân, chị trả lương 50USD/tháng/người. Mức thu nhập bình quân sau khi trừ chi phí của gia đình là 380USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị O. xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm bao tải, phế liệu phục vụ cho hoạt động kinh dO. của mình.

loans.use: Buy garbage, sacks to preliminary treatment

loans.name: Usmonali

texts.ru:
Usmonali M. is 31 years old and has a secondary education. He is married and has three children. Usmonali raises livestock. He has been raising livestock for 2 years. He also has a small plot of land that he wants to plant wheat on. He will use a portion of the loan to purchase fuel for his tractor so he can plow the fields before he plants wheat. He wants to use the other portion of the loan to purchase food for his livestock as they cannot graze during the winter. He is planning to sell the wheat to local residents who would have a chance to purchase wheat at lower prices to make flour for bread. Usmonali plans to repay his loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Мирзоев Усмонали, возраст – 31 год, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Усмонали занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Также он имеет небольшой участок земли, который он хочет засеять пшеницой. Часть полученного кредита он хочет использовать на покупку горюче-смазочных материалов для того чтобы на тракторе обработать землю для посева, а на другую часть планирует приобрести корм для животных. Данный кредит даст возможность Усмонали засеять свой участок, а также приобрести необходимое питание для своих животных, так как зимой им требуется усиленное питание. Полученный урожай он планирует продать местным жителям, тем самым давая им возможность приобрести пшеницу по приемлемым ценам для переработки в муку и выпечку хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fuel for tractor and food for cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.ru:
Akbarali M. is 26 years old. He has a secondary education and is single. Akbarali raises livestock. He has been in this business for 1.5 years. He wants to use a portion of his loan to purchase cattle to fatten and then resell. He wants to use another portion of the loan to purchase fuel for his tractor so that he can till his land. He plans to sell his harvest in the local market. Residents of Khuroson region would then have a chance to purchase grain at a lower price so that they can make flour and bake bread for their own consumption. Akbarali plans to repay his loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Мирзоев Акбарали, возраст – 26 лет, образование – среднее, холостой. Акбарали занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 1,5 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение крупного рогатого скота для откорма и продажи. Также часть кредита он хочет использовать на приобретение горюче-смазочного материала для трактора, который необходим для обработки земли под посев пшеницы.Полученный урожай он планирует продать на местным рынке. Жители района Хуросон будут иметь возможность приобрести зерно для дальнейшей переработки его в муку и выпечки хлеба для личного потребления. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: raising and reselling livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Jonikul

texts.ru:
Jonikul S., 36, is married and has 6 children. He owns a piece of land where he plans to grow wheat. Jonikul has been growing wheat for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase wheat and tractor oil and fuel. Jonikul’s customers would then be able to purchase wheat at lower-than-market prices and make flour and bread. Jonikul plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сохибназаров Чоникул, возраст – 36 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Джоникул имеет участок земли на котором планирует посеять пшеницу. Клиент уже в течение 2 лет занимается посевом пшеницы. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести семена пшеницы и горюче-смазочные материалы для трактора, который будет вспахивать его землю. Кредит даст возможность клиенту купить все необходимое для засева участка, а также после сбора урожая метсные жители смогут приобрести у него пшеницу по ценам ниже рыночных и использовать ее на переработку в муку и выпечку хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase wheat and tractor oil and fuel

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru:
Gulmurod S., 53, is married and has 8 children. He owns a piece of land where he plans to grow wheat. Gulmurod has been growing wheat for 6 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase wheat and tractor oil and fuel. Gulmurod’s customers would then be able to purchase wheat at lower-than-market prices and make flour and bread. Gulmurod S. plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сохибназаров Гулмурод, возраст – 53 года, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 8-х детей. Гулмурод имеет участок земли на котором планирует посеять пшеницу. Клиент уже в течение 6 лет занимается посевом пшеницы. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести семена пшеницы и горюче-смазочные материалы для трактора, который будет вспахивать его землю. Кредит даст возможность клиенту купить все необходимое для засева участка, а также после сбора урожая метсные жители смогут приобрести у него пшеницу по ценам ниже рыночных и использовать ее на переработку в муку и выпечку хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase wheat and tractor oil and fuel

loans.name: Kurbonazar

texts.ru:
Kurbonazar S., 31, is married and has 1 child. Kurbonazar owns a piece of land where he plans to grow wheat. Kurbonazar has been growing wheat for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase wheat and tractor oil and fuel. Kurbonazar’s customers would then be able to purchase wheat at lower-than-market prices and make flour and bread. Kurbonazar plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шоназарво Курбоназар, возраст – 31 год, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 1-х детей. Курбонмурод имеет участок земли на котором планирует посеять пшеницу. Клиент уже в течение 2 лет занимается посевом пшеницы. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести семена пшеницы и горюче-смазочные материалы для трактора, который будет вспахивать его землю. Кредит даст возможность клиенту купить все необходимое для засева участка, а также после сбора урожая метсные жители смогут приобрести у него пшеницу по ценам ниже рыночных и использовать ее на переработку в муку и выпечку хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase wheat and tractor oil and fuel

loans.name: Kurbonmurod

texts.ru:
Kurbonmurod B., 31, a teacher by training, is married and has 3 children. For 3 years, Kurbonmurod raises cattle. He plans to use this loan to purchase a milk cow. Kurbonmurod wants to make extra profit by selling milk from the cow. He plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоев Курбонмурод, возраст – 31 год, образование – высшее, по специальности педагог, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Он занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Он в настоящий момент имеет несколько бычков. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести корову, которая будет давать молоко. Получаемое молоко он планирует продавать местным жителям. Данный кредит поможет ему приобрести корову, получить удои молока, обеспечивать свою семью свежем молоком, а также давать возможность местным жителям приобретать у него молоко. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru:
Ahmad N., 27, is married and has 2 children. For 2 years, Ahmad has been engaged in cattle farming. This loan he plans to use to purchase a pair of young bulls. Ahmad will raise the animals and then re-sell them with a profit. Ahmad’s wife helps him to tend the farm. Ahmad N. plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Набиев Ахмад, возраст – 27 лет, образование – среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Он занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение нескольких молодых бычков, которых после откормки он собирается продать. На вырученные деньги он планирует приобретать новых бычков, откармливать и продавать. Данный кредит поможет ему вести этот вид деятельности, так как в этом ему помогает жена. Таким образом они вместе зарабатывают на жизнь, жена ухаживает за бычками, а он продаёт. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Ashurbi

texts.ru:
Ashurbi H., 48, is married and has 3 children. Ashurbi takes care of the household and tends to a cattle farm. Ashurbi has been farming for 5 years. She plans to use this loan to purchase young bulls. Every 40-45 days, Ashurbi resells the animals earning a living for her family. Ashurbi plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Халимова Ашурби, возраст – 48 лет, образование – среднее, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Ашурби домохозяйка и занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на приобретение нескольких молодых бычков. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 5 лет. Она откармливает и через каждые 40-45 дней продаёт бычков, таким образом она зарабатывает на содержание семьи и чувствует себя независимой, приобретая в дом необходимые вещи как для себя так и для своего мужа и детей. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Larysa

texts.en:
Larysa owns a small grocery sales business which she operates at the busy Central Market in Nicopol, Ukraine. She is an experienced, hard-working entrepreneur with a jolly nature and many loyal customers. Larysa has been in business for about seven years and has learned much about market grocery sales. Most cities in Ukraine have at least one outdoor market, similar to a flea market, where you can purchase all kinds of products from fish, meat and vegetables, to clothes, cleaning supplies, bathtubs and tools. The markets are made up of many individual vendors, each competing against other vendors who may be selling similar products. Entrepreneurs like Larysa who are successful have learned how to best compete and make a living.

Larysa has requested a loan to use as business capital and purchase more grocery items to sell in her store. She has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine and has demonstrated stability in her business and the ability to repay loans. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting her with her business and livelihood.

loans.use: Purchase new grocery inventory

loans.name: Vladelina

texts.en:
Vladelina is a hard-working entrepreneur from Nicopol, Ukraine. She owns a clothing sales business where she sells quality clothing at the large Central Market in Nicopol. Vladelina started her business about four years ago and has developed a reputation for hard work, honesty and for being one who recognizes and acts on good opportunities. Her business has done well, providing a stable income for her family. She makes about $800 in a typical month.

Vladelina has requested a loan to add to her working business capital. Her goal is to invest in the further growth and development of her business so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is a young mother of a three-year-old daughter and an unborn son. She lives Casabe, a community of Santo Domingo, where she operates a small hardware store along with her husband.  Tita has been managing this business for more than three years. She has therefore gained a lot of experience, and she knows the rules of the market place. The entrepreneur buys the materials wholesale from some importers, which she then resells in her store. Currently, many customers visit Tita's shop every day and purchase a wide range of goods. Tita wants her business to keep growing in order to offer better services to the customers and increase her income. With her loan, she will buy an assortment of products to restock her store.

loans.use: to purchase a wide range of products to stock up a hardware store.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.en:
Escolastica is in her early thirties, and owns and operates a small restaurant in Hortaliza, a community of Santo Domingo.  The entrepreneur started her business two years ago, and she is running it in a rented shop.  Escolastica’s husband is a technician that repairs inverters.  The couple has two sons aged of five and twelve.
Her freshly and well prepared traditional Dominican dishes ensure that people visit her restaurant time and again.  Escolastica is an energetic, determined woman.  She works in the restaurant all day long and she never gets tired. The entrepreneur explains that someday she would like to have her own shop and not have to rent one. She says she will keep working hard to achieve that goal.  She intends to use her loan to purchase more ingredients in order to expand production.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to use in preparing food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en: Cruz is forty-three years old and sells an assortment of beauty and hair products to women of Hortaliza, a community of Santo Domingo.  She has six children, four of them boys, all of whom attend school.  Cruz says that she doesn’t have a fixed inventory, and instead she takes a flexible approach, purchasing items according to the demand of her customers.  After one year of operation, the entrepreneur is still running business from her home.  She plans on using her loan to rent a small shop in the community so that customers can get the products at ease in a comfortable atmosphere.  Cruz hopes to become the most well known and visited supplier of cosmetics in her neighbourhood.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Daisy Miguelina

texts.en: Daisy is a kind woman who is passionate about abstract art. She is dedicated to painting pictures and decorative ceramic plates which she sells to the people of Hortaliza, a community of Santo Domingo.  Daisy is thirty years old, and she has two school-going sons aged seven and eight. Daisy explains that she didn’t go to a professional school of art, but she is talented and gets her inspiration from nature. The artist would now like to diversify her business. With her loan, she will buy an assortment of wooden collars and bracelets which she will paint and hopefully sell to a new segment of the market. The new products of the artist will be sold in Bávaro, one of the most touristy places of the country.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a large quantity of goods to expand a business of painting pictures and ceramic plates.

loans.name: Yoselin

texts.en: Yoselin, a woman of humble conditions and a mother of two children, makes a living selling jewels and beauty products by catalogue to women of Hortaliza, a community of Santo Domingo.  She has been running her business for two years, and it has grown rapidly as more women have tried her products and become loyal customers.  She has asked for this loan in order to purchase a range of jewellery items for her expanding business so that she can more effectively meet customer demand. Yoselin is ambitious, and dreams of having  a small premises so that she can store products and reduce the amount of trips she must make to the supplier.

loans.use: to purchase a wide range of jewelry items for a small business.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en: Rosa María is a twenty-three year old mother of three children, who sells men’s and women’s clothing in Altagracia, a community of Santo Domingo.  She runs the business in a rented house.  Rosa María buys the garments in the capital or in Elías Piña, a frontier city with Haiti.  Many of Rosa María's friends and neighbors visit her house day after day to purchase her clothing.  She hopes her business’ success will help her to support her family financially. With her loan, she will buy clothing in bulk to restock the inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk to stock up her store

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Germania Fermina

texts.en: Germania is the owner and operator of a newly started restaurant in Altagracia, community of Santo Domingo.  She rents a local building from whcih to run her business. Every day, from early in the morning to late night, Germania works in the restaurant, preparing and serving delicious traditional Dominican meals and juices. Her business struggled when it first opened, but she gradually built up her client base as people were impressed with her food and came back with their friends. The entrepreneur hopes her business’ success will help her support her children studies and improve her family's living conditions. With her loan, Germania will buy raw materials and other goods for her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and other products for her newly started restaurant.

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is in her early thirties and she has three children who attend school.  Dominga has been running a small grocery store for seven years in the Café, community of Santo Domingo.  Every day, people visit her store to purchase miscellaneous products such as bread, milk, chocolate, spaghetti, tomato paste, butter, rice, beans and other basic foodstuffs. The grocery store is the principal source of income of the family. Dominga would like to expand her business and add new products to the store, which is why she has asked for this loan.  With the loan, Dominga expects to be a condition to continue expanding her business and maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to replenish the entrepreneur's grocery store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, a thirty-five year old single mother, sells men’s and women’s clothing in the Hortaliza community of Yamasá.  Cecilia says that she is very careful in selecting the clothes for her inventory; she adds the items of clothing to her stock in accordance with customer demand and according to the season.  Cecilia will use her loan to buy suitable garments to refill her stock. The entrepreneur has three school-age children and her small business supports the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.en: María Teresa, a 44 year old mother, lives in Hortaliza community of Santo Domingo and is working hard to lift her seven children out of poverty.  Her husband is a police officer and his income is not sufficient to bear all the expenses of the family.  María Teresa is very positive and believes she can do something to improve her family's living conditions. She plans on starting a small cafeteria which she will run in her house.  She will produce fried vegetables, spaghetti, spicy pork sausage and natural juices.  María Teresa has visited a lot of friends and people in the surroundings to promote her forthcoming cafeteria. María Teresa hopes that she will receive the loan in a short time so that she can purchase food stocks to start her business, and that her cafeteria's success will help her improve her family’s daily life.

loans.use: to purchase food stocks so that she can start a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a proactive, hard-working and creative woman who lives in the Hortaliza community of Santo Domingo. Maribel is married with three children (two girls and one boy) who both attend school. Maribel produces homemade traditional Dominican meals that she sells to people in the area surrounding her home.  She has been running this business for two years and has a well established and growing client base. Santo Domingo is a fast growing city and many new buildings are built every year. So, copious numbers of men work in the construction sites all day long and don’t have sufficient time to go to a restaurant to get a meal. These men make up a large proportion of Maribel’s market.

Unfortunately Maribel has been in a car accident and she has temporarily lost the use of her legs. She therefore must stay at home all day to receive medical care. However, Maribel is not discouraged; one of her daughters prepares the food and her husband delivers it to the customers. Maribel hopes that she will make a full recovery so she can continue to expand her business. She has requested this load from FSMA (it will be her second loan from FSMA) so that she can buy products to keep producing delicious food to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice crops from the growers to resell.

loans.name: Thi Hanh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hanh, 36 years old, has a son who is stil in school. She tries to do a lot of jobs at a time to increase her family income, such as farming, breeding pigs, lending stuff for wedding or funeral (including bowls, plates, canvas, tables, chairs, sound equipment, etc). In order to buy those stuff to lend, her family used to borrow money from their relatives, and they almost paid back all the loan. This time she would like to borrow $150 from Binhminhcdc (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) to have more fund to buy equipment for rent.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hạnh, 36 tuổi, có một con trai còn đang đi học. Chị Hạnh làm rất nhiều việc để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình như làm ruộng, chăn nuôi lợn, cho thuê đồ phục vụ đám hiếu, hỉ: bát, đĩa, phông bạt, bàn ghế, loa đài... Để mua đồ cho thuê, gia đình chị cũng đã từng phải vay họ hàng nhưng đã trả gần hết. Nay, chị tham gia vay vốn 2006000đ của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc để bổ sung vốn mua đồ cho thuê.

loans.use: to lend canvas

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun D. D., age 29, works with her husband purchasing poultry from the breeder and reselling them for a profit, making about $3 each day. She has one child who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more ducks and chickens to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and chickens to expand her business.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich S., age 45, works selling fish at a busy market, making on average around $3.30 each day in revenue. Her husband is employed as a trailer driver (a motorcycle attached to a trailer to transport passengers). They have one child who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to build separate rooms and rent them to people in her area to make additional profit for her family.

loans.use: To build rooms to rent for extra income.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich S., age 48, is a widow and lives with her grandmother and three nephews in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. Her son is pictured as she was not available at the time. She works selling gasoline, rice, and fertilizer, making on average around $10 each day of income. She has one son. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more fertilizer and gasoline to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer and gasoline to expand her business.

loans.name: Thi Vien

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vien, 37 years old, has 4 daughters who are all in school. Besides farming, Vien and her husband raise thousands of chicken and open a sundry shop to increase their family income. With the new loan of 150USD, Mrs. Vien would be able to buy more stuff to sell. She really likes to borrow from Binhminhcdc (Kiva's partner in Vietnam) because its procedure is simple, and comfortable. Furthermore, the microcredit officers go to each village to lend people the money and get their repayment, so Mrs. Vien does not need to go far to borrow money.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Viễn, 37 tuổi, có 4 con gái đều còn đang đi học. Ngoài công việc đồng án, vợ chồng chị Viễn còn chăn nuôi hàng nghìn con gà đẻ trứng và bán hàng tạp hoá để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với số tiền vay được (2006000đ) gia đình chị sẽ mua thêm hàng để bán. Chị rất thích vay vốn của Chương trình tài chính vi mô vì thủ tục đơn giản, thuận tiện; cán bộ lại xuống tận nơi để thu và phát vốn, chị không phải đi lại xa và vất vả.

loans.use: Bán tạp hoá

loans.name: Nghoung

texts.en: Mrs. Nghoung B., age 36, works purchasing fish at an open-air market earning around $5 each day of profit. Her husband is a construction foreman making around $5 each day. Her husband is pictured as she was not available at the time. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorbike to use for her business’s transportation. The remainder of the money is to reinvest in her business by buying more fish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and more fish for her business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Mrs. Hang T., age 26, is a mother of one young child and is currently employed by a garment factory earning around $4 each day. She is too shy to be photographed, so her house is shown instead. Her husband is a construction foreman making on average around $3 each day in revenue. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to repair her house, which frequently leaks during the rainy season. This will improve the quality of life for her family and allow them to work better.

loans.use: To fix the leaks in her home.

loans.name: Thi Chien

texts.vi:
Mrs Chiến is 30 years old. She has 2 children who are attending school. Her main occupation is farming and pig raising. She also collects and sells waste metal to gain extra money. Her husband works in construction so he is often away from home. She never had a loan before. She joined Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) because she likes the weekly repayment condition. She applies for a loan of 150 USD to invest into her business to raise the production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chiến, 30 tuổi, có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Nghề chính là làm ruộng và nuôi lợn, nhưng bên cạnh đó, chị đi chợ đồng nát để tăng thu nhập. Chồng chị là thợ xây nên thường đi xa để làm. Gia đình chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Chị tham gia vay vốn của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị thích được tiết kiệm để trả góp hàng tuần. Số tiền 2006000đ vay được từ Chương trình chị dùng để tăng gia sản xuất.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi lợn

loans.name: Phov

texts.en: Mrs. Phov C., 29, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling various kinds of vegetables at a busy market, where she can typically make on average around $8 each day in revenue. Her husband works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in his area, making on average about $4 each day of income. One of her children is enrolled in school and the rest are too young to attend school. Mrs. Phov C. has humbly requested a loan to expand her inventory, to enable her to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory, to enable her to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S., 42, works with her husband on their rice paddy growing rice and various kinds of vegetables, making collectively about $5 each day from selling their output. One of her children is employed by a nearby garment factory and one is a student. Mrs. Chea S. and her husband would like to request a loan to purchase a large quantity of peppers from the growers and resell them for a profit, and the leftover of the money is to buy more seeds and fertilizer for their crop expansion.

loans.use: To purchase large quantity of pepper from the growers and resell them for a profit, and the leftover of the money is to buy more seeds and fertilizer for their crop expansion.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok R., age 69, works making Khmer traditional cakes and selling them to the people in her area, making on average around $4 each day in revenue. (She is too shy to be photographed, so her house is shown instead.) Her husband works as a carpenter and generally earns about $3 per day. They have four children who are married and live elsewhere. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to repair her house. This will improve the quality of life for her family and allow them to work better.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Pop

texts.en: Mrs. Pop O. is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. To supplement her household, she cooks various kinds of Khmer food and sells them to the people in her area, making on average around $2.50 each day of profit. Her husband therefore works as a construction foreman making typically around $5 each day of profit. One of her children works with her selling rice and food; another one works with her husband as a construction foreman; and the rest are enrolled in school. Furthermore, Mrs. Pop O. hopes to use this loan to expand her store, and the remainder of the money is to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her store and to reinvest her business.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek P., 41, is married with two school-age children, and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her area, making on average around $20 each day of income while her husband is employed by a nearby local NGO, making typically around $5 each day. Mrs. Sek P. has humbly requested a loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
R. Nasim is 39 years old. He is married with 5 children.

Nasim has got 3 hectares of irrigated land. In order to support his large family he is producing onions and wheat. All the family is involved in this business. This is the only one source of income and all the hard-working family hopes that in future they shall be able to improve their living conditions by the profits they are able to generate. 

Nasim requests a loan of 2000 Somoni (about 600 US Dollars) to purchase seeds. This will be his first loan but he is determined that he shall pay the loan back in 12 months and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds.

loans.name: Nor Agha

texts.en: Nor Agha lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an educated married man who has a small business selling wood. He has a good number of clients and he needs to expand his business because in winter people need wood in Kabul. He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income for his family. He is happy that, with this loan, he can help people and support his family.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Abduholik

texts.en:
C. Abduholik is 50 years old. He is married with 4 children, two of which are already married and two who are living with their parents and helping their father in his business.  He is pictured here with his wife leaving for the market.

Abduholik rears cattle for a living. He now has four cows and has created a stable family business which provides the major income for the family. 

Abduholik has previously taken out serveral loans with IMON and has proved himself to be a reliable borrower with a positive credit history. Today he requests a loan of 350.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months as he is planning to increase his cattle stock by purchasing one cow. Abduholik thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of 1 cow.

loans.name: Thi Bich Thuy

texts.vi:
Mrs Thuỷ is 31. She is a teacher at a primary school in Trung Nghĩa village. Her husband, Vinh, owns a shop that fabricates wooden furniture. They applied to Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) for a loan because of the possibility to pay back in installments. This loan, 150 USD, will be used to buy woodworking tools. They will be able to pay back the loan with the income from this business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thuỷ, 31 tuổi, là giáo viên cấp 1 tại 1 trường thuộc xã Trung Nghĩa. Anh Vinh, chồng chị là chủ xưởng sản xuất đồ thủ công mỹ nghê. Số tiền 2006000đ vay được dùng để mua dụng cụ làm nghề cho anh Vinh. Gia đình chị rất thích vay vốn ở Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc vì được trả góp hàng tuần. Với số tiền lãi thu được từ việc bán sản phẩm, anh chị có thể dễ dàng trả nợ.

loans.use: To buy woodworking tools.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mrs. Chim S., age 37, works selling fish, making on average around $5.30 each day in revenue. Her husband (pictured,  as she was not available at the time) works as a fisherman making around $3.30 per day from selling his fish to the people in his community. They have two children who are too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to expand her inventory of fish to meet her growing customer demands, and the leftover of the money will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of fish.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
T. Jamshed is 31 years old. He is married with two children of school age. His wife is the house keeper and helps Jamshed in his business.

Jamshed has got 2.7 hectares of land which he has worked for the past 10 years. He is producing onions, wheat and maize. At the same time Jamshed is breeding the cattle. The business is stable and the only source of income for the family. Jamshed wants to be able to generate sufficient funds to pay for the higher education of his children. 

Today Jamshed requests 2000.00 Somoni (about 600.00 US Dollars) for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer. This is his second loan, and Jamshed is confident that he will pay the loan back in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
D. Orifjon is 40 years old. He is married with three children. His wife looks after the house and the kids.

Orifjon supports his family by breeding cattle which he sells for meat. He has been in this business for the past 2 years and currently has two cows. Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for the family and generates the income needed to allowing Orifjon to support his family and improve their living conditions. 

Now Orifjon is planning to buy one more cow. He also needs to purchase the fodder. Orifjon is requesting a loan of 1000.00 US Dollars over a term of 9 months.

loans.use: Increasing of stock purchasing of 1 сow and the fodder

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.en:
M. Abduvali is 52 years old. He is married with 4 children.

Abduvali is running his own café where he sells kebabs. He has been in this business already for 5 years. Abduvali always tries to use the best ingredients for his cafe, which is why he started breeding his own cattle. Part of the meat he now sells for meat and part he is utilizing in his café. The elder son helps the father in the café and in tim will inherit the business. The café and the cattle breeding are the main sources of income for the family.

Today Abduvali requests a loan of 500.00 US Dollars over a term of 9 months. He is planning to purchase 2 cows and coal for his café. He has a positive credit history and is confident that he will be able to pay back this loan in the given time.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and coal for his café

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.en:
T. Faizullo is 60 years old. He and his wife have raised 6 children. Four of them left for Russia to look for work. 

Faizullo runs a farm on which he produces wheat, onions and barley. There is also a vineyard and nutwood as well as the plantation of dog rose. Two of his children help their father in his farm. In addition, Faizullo also has livestock including a horse and twenty sheep in his farm.

Today Faizullo requests 3 000.00 Somoni (875.00 US Dollars) to purchase the fodder to breed cattle. This is the second loan he is applying for, the first of which was paid on time. Faizullo promises to pay the loan in 12 months and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase fodder for breeding cattle

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
"I have lived all my life in a small town called Arifwala in Pakistan. I am the mother of four: three boys and one girl. Two of my sons operate their business in the food market and transport various items on order from different traders, while the younger two study at a local school.

I am borrowing for the second time from Asasah, a microfinance institution. This time we require a loan for our wheat business which my husband operates in the grain market. I raise cows at home and sell milk.

I have four other women in my loan group who are also in need of loans. Zainab B. wants to pay off the remaining money owed for their cow. Khalida B. will use the loan to expand their snacks stall. Shahnaz B. wants a loan to repair their family's rickshaw. Shamim B. requires loan for her son’s embroidery business."

loans.use: Expand their wheat business

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
M. Muhabbat is 47 years old. She and her husband have raised three children.

For 15 years already Muhabbat is working in the largest local market of the city. She is selling the green gram. This legume is very popular in Tajikistan and is very nourishing, healthy and tasty. The business is very stable and generates the main income for the family as the husband of Muhabbat is currently unemployed. 

Muhabbat has been working with IMON for several years already, and had proved herself as a reliable client. Today she requests a loan of 3450.00 Somoni (1000.00 US Dollars) over a term of 9 months. The loan shall be used to purchase additional green gram stock for selling. Muhabbat thanks your for your support and promises to pay the loan back in time.

loans.use: To increase stock for resale

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Shamim A.. I am married and the mother of three: two sons and one daughter. I live with my family in a small town, Arifwala, Pakistan. My husband wants to start a new business selling fruit on his cart and for this purpose he needs a loan. Currently, he works somewhere for very meager pay.

I would like to have a group loan and my group members are: Sakina B. who requires a loan for her son who runs a tea stall; Sabra B. whose husband runs a lumberyard; Sakina M. who wants a loan to buy her brother a donkey cart; and Shamim A. who needs a loan for their dairy store."

loans.use: Start a new business selling fruit from a cart

loans.name: Rukkiah's Group

texts.en:
"I am Rukkiah M. from Arifwala, Pakistan. I am the mother of two: one boy and one girl. My daughter attends a stitching school and my son attends a local school. My husband is a public transport driver and now, he wants to become a partner in one of the wagons. This way our profits will rise sharply. For this reason, we require a loan.

My group members are: Nazira B. who will invest her loan in her son’s mobile phone store; Hajra B. who requires a loan to start a shoe manufacturing business; Zulakhan B. who plans to buy her son a rickshaw; and Shazia B. whose brother wants to buy a partnership in a cycle store. I completely trust all of these women and hence, request you to lend to all of us."

loans.use: To become a partner in one of the local transport wagons

loans.name: Ameera's Group

texts.en:
"I am Ameera N. from Arifwala, a small town in Pakistan. I have been living in this town for the last thirty years. I am the mother of four girls and three boys. All of my sons are currently working. I am borrowing for the second time from Asasah, a microfinance institution. One of my sons sells snacks such as chips on his cart and he needs to buy snacks in bulk. I plan to save up a dowry for my daughters with his increased profits.

My group members are: Nazia B. who wants a loan for her brother who manufactures wooden doors and needs to buy wood, and Shahnaz B. whose husband sells vegetables. We are borrowing in a group and will invest our loans in our respective businesses."

loans.use: Buy snacks in bulk for resale

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
"I am Shazia K. from a small town: Arifwala, Pakistan. My husband is a tailor and I sell milk from my house. I want a loan to buy an additional cow to increase our milk production and earn more. We have already two cows for this purpose. I wish someday I can have my own house.

I am the group leader of few other women in my neighborhood. Bakhtnisha B. requires a loan to buy a donkey cart. Sharifa B. wants a loan to buy a rickshaw. Munnawer B. needs a loan to start a grocery store. Tasmeena B. will use her share of the loan to buy a donkey cart to transport bricks."

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Kibrie

texts.en:
M. Kibrie is 26-year olds and the loving mother of four children of school age. 

Kibrie raises sheep which she sells for meat. She has been in this business for 8 years. Currently she has four sheep in her farm. This brave woman is running her business independently and quite successfully which allows her to contribute a considerable income to the family. 

Kibrie is planning to expand her farm and to purchase a further three sheep. At the same time she needs to buy fodder and is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 US Dollars over 12 months. Kibrie promises to pay the loan in time and tanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: To purcahse three sheep and fodder

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.en:
Davlatali is young business man, who has traded bijouterie for over 5 years. His business stall is located in the big central market of KORVON, in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is not married and lives with his parents. From childhood he loved his mother's bijouterie, he played with them and his hobby was to collect such things. He asked his aunts and other relatives to present him their old bijouterie. His mother said that he is very creative boy and often at home he made bijouterie from many little things, which he collect from all relatives.

So today he chooses this kind of business and he gets enjoyment from his activity. He buys his goods from Bishkek himself and now his beautiful assortment attracts many clients of all ages. In the future he wishes to open a workshop where he could create his fantasy for bijouterie.

loans.use: Buying the next batch of bijouterie.

loans.name: Khamid

texts.en:
R. Khamid is 44 years old. He and his wife have three children.

In order to support his family, Khamid purchases cattle for breeding which he sells for meat. He has been in this business for the past 16 years. His elder son is grown up enough to help his father in his business, which is the main source of income for the family. 

Khamid is requesting a loan of USD1000 in order to purchase one more bull and the necessary fodder. The loan will be paid back over the next 9 months. This is the second loan of Khamid.  The first was paid back on time.

loans.use: To purchase one bull and fodder

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en: "I am a widow and I have lived all my life in Arifwala, Pakistan. I have six kids: three boys and three girls. Currently, two of my children attend school. I make and sell traditional hair ornaments known as Paranda. I want to increase my income by expanding my business. I am also requesting loans for my group members. Hameeda B. needs to buy cloth to sell. Amna B. wants to buy sheep for their livestock trading business.

loans.use: Expand my current business making hair ornaments

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
"I am Zakia F., wife of Muhammad Majeed. I am borrowing for the first time for our business. My husband has been working at a restaurant for little pay and now, he plans to start his own restaurant. I help my husband and stitch clothes at my home for my neighborhood clients. I am the mother of two: one boy and one girl. My daughter is in grade two and my son is still small.

My group members are: Asiah B. who requires a loan for her brother who sells objects made of clay; Rukhsana B. who stitches clothes for the women that reside in her neighborhood and now she wants to start a stitching training centre for these women; and Lala B. who needs a loan for her son who is a barber. I am the guarantor of these women and I am confident that they will repay your loan on time."

loans.use: Start up our own restaurant

loans.name: Kirinyabigo Ii(A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Imelda is 38 years old and married with eight children. She has a poultry business. With the extra business profits, she wants to start another business. Roda and Molly sell raw foods in the market and want to use the loan to expand business. Florence runs a restaurant business and wants to use the loan to buy food warmers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en: Sojida is 46, married, and has 4 children. She graduated secondary school and worked in sewing workshops during the times of the USSR. After its collapse, she has engaged in the business of selling socks for over 10 years. Her business located in the Korvon bazzar district in Dushanbe,Tajikistan. Today, she buys her goods from the local sock's factory "Nafisa" and she also buys goods from wholesale market, as she wants to be more competetive.She trys to have a wide assortment to attract more clients. From the KIVA program, she wants to receive a loan for future expansion.

loans.use: Buying warm socks from wholesale market.

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en:
"I am Parween A. from the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. I have been married for six months. I need a loan for my husband’s tea stall. He has been in this business since his teens. We want to expand our business so that we can improve our living standard before our child comes into this world. I stitch clothes at my house.

I would like to borrow in a group with three other members who are: Shamim B. and Khursheed B. who both need loans for their husbands who are butchers, and Salma Y. who wants to expand their jewelry store."

loans.use: Expand our tea stall

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
S. Umeda is 26 years old and the mother of one daughter whom she is raising alone.

Together with her partner Umeda runs a jewelry store, a business which she has been in for the past 12 years. As a teenager, Umeda always wanted to become a jeweller and today, she is is producing earrings, rings of silver and gold. As a rule Umeda purchases the input materials from the population. 

Umeda is requested a loan of USD1000 to purchase material for making jewellery, such as fragments, precious and semi-precious stones, and reagents. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months. Umeda is a repeat client of IMON with a positive credit history, and she is confident that she will be able to pay back this loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of input materials such as fragments, precious and semi-precious stones and reagents required for producing jewellery.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
"I have been married for five years and live with my family in the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. I have three children: two girls and one boy. None of my kids is of school-going age yet. I am borrowing for the first time in my loan group. I stitch clothes for my neighborhood clients. My husband trades used items and his brother is a butcher. I need this loan for my husband’s brother; he needs to buy some animals for his shop. He will give me a reasonable share of the profit out of his business.

I am the leader of a few other women from my neighborhood. Naseem B. will invest her share of the loan in their family’s grocery store and auto workshop. Kalsoom B.‘s husband drives a horse cart and now they need to buy a new horse for their cart. Sughran B. needs a loan to buy a rickshaw for her husband. Saeeda B. requires this loan to buy construction supplies for their business. There is no one here who could lend to us."

loans.use: Expand our butcher shop

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
"I have lived all my life in the small town of Arifwala, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of nine: six boys and three girls. I sew clothes to supplement my husband's income. Until now, my husband used to transport goods on a donkey cart, but now he wants to buy a rickshaw and requires a loan for this purpose.

I would like to borrow in a group with several other women. I want them to get loans so that they can also make their lives better. My loan group members are: Sajida B. who requires a loan for her husband’s motorcycle workshop; Rubina B. who will invest the loan in their grocery store; Musawer B. who also needs to buy a rickshaw; and Amtulaziz B. who wants to start a grocery store."

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Kirinyabigo Ii(B) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Caroline sells bread for a living. She wants to use the extra profit to pay school fees for her children and also construct a residential house.

May is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to expand her business.

Mercy sells raw foods and wants to increase her stock with the loan.

Jacinta sells charcoal and Sharifa has a bar business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Kime

texts.en:
U. Kime is a 44-year old mother of three children. At the same time she is the main bread-winner in the family.

For 5 years already Kime has been breeding cattle. Currently she is breeding 4 cows. Her son is helping her and her husband is selling the meat from the cattle in the market and this family business brings a stable income for the family. 

Kime is planning to expand her business and to purchase 2 more cows and fodder. For this she requests 1000.00 US Dollars. Kime is confident that she can pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To purcahse two cows and fodder.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
"I am Abida P. from a small city: Arifwala, Pakistan. My husband needs to buy a rickshaw for which we are requesting a loan. Currently, he rents someone’s rickshaw to drive. I have two boys: one is two years old and other four months. I plan to buy a cow with the additional profits, which we expect to get through the purchase of our own rickshaw.

My group members who are in need of loans are: Khursheed B. who wants a loan to buy a donkey cart; Shumaila B. who wants to expand their grocery store; Zareena B. who requires a loan for their lumberyard; and Majeeda B. who intends a loan to buy sheep for their livestock trading. Ume-Kalsoom B. will use the loan to buy stock for their grocery store."

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Ahammd Jan

texts.en: Ahammd Jan lives with his own family in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two sons. He was in India and when he came back last year he opened a dress shop in Kabul. His business is going well and he wants to make a good income for his family so he has requested an individual loan to import more good designs of clothes from India to attract clients and help his family.

loans.use: To import more good designs of clothes

loans.name: Hadisamoh

texts.en: Hadisamoh K. is 42 years old, and the mother of 3 children. Her eldest son helps her by assisting in their bread business. Together they begin the day from 5:00 AM to buy bread from workshops, and sell it in the food market of “Safariyion”, in Dushanbe, Tajkistan. Hadisamoh has been doing this for three years. Before, she worked at a school as a geography teacher, but changes within her living conditions forced her to abandon education and seek another means of supporting her family. She would like to request a loan in order for her to continue running her business.

loans.use: Buying bread for sale.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Rukhsana A.. I have lived all my life in Arifwala, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of two: one boy and one girl. My husband is a rickshaw driver and we need a loan to pay off the remaining installments on our rickshaw. I plan to construct an additional room in my house in future.

There are four other women for whom I also want to get loans, so that they can improve their businesses. Shamim B. requires a loan to buy a donkey cart. Azra B. wants a loan for her husband who supplies various grocery items to different shops in the city. Shabeer B. wants a loan for their sugarcane juice stall. Zakia B. will use the loan for their grocery item supplies business."

loans.use: Pay off remaining installments on our rickshaw

loans.name: Jalolov

texts.en:
Jalolov O. is 17 years old. He is not yet married.

In spite of his young years O. has already been working for three years. His mother is his teacher, partner and assistant. O. works with cattle and currently has got 1 cow and 1 sheep in his household. At the same time he is working in a wine factory. The cattle-raising brings a significant income to the family. 

Today O. requests 300.00 US Dollars over a term of 12 months. The loan will be used to purchase one more cow. This is the first loan of O., and he is confident that he will be able to pay back within the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing of 1 cow

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Mrs. Ek S. E., age 45, works selling secondhand clothes at an open-air market and typically makes on average around $3 each day of profit. Her husband works as a taxi driver, earning about $10 each day in revenue. They have 6 children, two who work as taxi drivers, two who are employed by a garment factory, and the rest of whom are at school. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a taxi for one of her children to operate his own taxi business. This will increase income for the entire family.

loans.use: To purchase a car to operate their own taxi business.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mrs. Sor S., age 63, works raising poultry and reselling them to the brokers in her area, making on average around $4 each day in revenue. (Her son is pictured in the photo as she was too shy to be photographed.) Her husband, 65, works driving a motor-taxi to transport passengers. They have two children who work growing a variety of vegetables to raise her family’s income generation. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a rice-grinding mill. This will allow her to charge neighboring farmers to husk their rice and to increase income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a rice-grinding mill to generate additional income.

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs Minh is 54. She has 2 children who are married. She is a cadre for the Phù Lưu hamlet. The main income for her family is raising cattle. Her husband is in charge of the taking care of the cattle, her son & his wife are responsible for sales. The loan condition of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) suits them just fine. They will be able to pay back the loan easily.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Minh, 54 tuổi, có 2 con đã lớn, dựng vợ gả chồng. Chị là cán bộ phụ nữ của thôn Phù Lưu. Hoạt động của gia đình cô chủ yếu là chăn nuôi gia súc, chủ yếu là bò. Chồng cô là chủ cai xây dựng, vợ chồng con trai trưởng bán hàng. Vì vậy, với hình thức trả góp hàng tuần của Chương trình tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc, gia đình cô dễ dàng trả được nợ.

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Abdulraman

texts.en: Abdulraman lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 6 children, 3 of whom are married while the others live with him. He is their only support. He has a car parts shop in one of the heavily populated places of Kabul. He has good experience in his business so he wants to expand. He wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good monthly income for his family to support them better.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Z. Shavkat is 27 years old and married.

Since he was 15 years old, Shavkat has been working in the livestock sector. Currently he has ten cows. Once every two months he sells the raised cows and buys young ones for breeding. The mother of Shavkat helps him in the business. The business generates the main income for the family. 

Today Shavkat requests a loan of 600.00 US Dollars over a term of 12 months which he will use to purchase another cow. This is the first loan of Shavkat and he is sure he shall be able to pay it back on time and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeun S. H., age 22, works as a laborer making around $2 each day. Her husband works as a broker purchasing fruits, mostly bananas, from the growers to resell for a profit. This couple can make collectively around $10 each day of income. They have one child who is too young to attend school. Mrs H. would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more fruit to meet their growing customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Mrs. Rin D., age 34, is a mother of four children. She doesn’t run any business beside staying at home cooking food and taking care of her three school-age children. Her husband works as a middleman buying bananas in a large quantity from the growers to resell for a profit, making on average around $18 each day of income. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order increase the business’s inventory of bananas and expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of bananas.

loans.name: Kirinyabigo Ii(C) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Madina is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She sells used clothes for a living. She wants to use the extra profit to pay school fees for her child.

Alice offers tailoring services and wants to use the loan to buy more sewing machines.

Madina sells new clothes and intends to increase her stock with the loan.

Betty has a retail shop business.

Hellen is a poultry farmer and wants to use the loan to purchase more chicks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Mutundwe 2B(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Cossy is 45 years old, married and has eight children. Her husband has a retail shop. Cossy and Pauline are poultry farmers. Cossy usually earns about 150,000 shillings in profits weekly. With the extra business profit, Cossy intends to start up another business.

Pauline has a piggery business and wants to use the loan to expand the business.

Leo runs a small hotel and Jana provides tailoring services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of seven bags of amaranth grain

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Lan

texts.vi:
Mrs Lan is 24. She has a young child. Her family raises poultry and sells eggs, this is their main income. On average, they make 3-5 USD a day. It's enough to make ends meet. She has never borrowed money before. When she learned of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) and its loan condition, she has applied for a loan of 150 USD to invest in her poultry business. She will use the loan to buy feed for her poultry thus raising her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lan, 24 tuổi, có một con nhỏ. Cuộc sống của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi gà, vịt và bán trứng. Thu nhập trung bình của hai vợ chồng từ 50000-70000đ/ngày. Nói chung cũng tương đối đủ sống. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nhưng được biết tới những tiện ích mà Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc đem lại, chị đã vay 2006000đ để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi, tăng gia sản xuất.

loans.use: To buy feed for poultry

loans.name: Mutundwe 2B(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Dorothy is 49 years old, married and has 12 children. Her husband has a business selling clothing. Dorothy has a retail shop. She wants to use the extra business profits to cater to her family's needs and improve their standard of living.

Eva sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

Harriet makes and sells snacks.

Teo wants to buy more sewing machines to expand her tailoring business.

Sylvia sells used clothing and wants to use the loan to increase her stock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou V. S., age 37, works as a housewife. She helps her husband, who works as a farmer growing rice, by grinding rice and raising pigs, making on average around $3 each day of income. They have eight children, four who are employed by a garment factory making around $2/day each, and four who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more pigs to expand her livestock and buy more seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and buy more seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Mrs. Kan Y., age 62, is a widow and works growing vegetables and reselling them for about $5.90 each day of income. She has three children:  one who works as a driver for a company; one who is a motor-taxi driver earning $2 each day; and one who is married and lives separately. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase cashew nuts from the growers and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts from the growers to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Mutundwe 2B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Esther is 24 years, married and has two children. Her husband owns a butcher shop. Esther provides tailoring services. She usually earns 100,000 shillings in profits each week. She wants to use the extra profit to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

Betty has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy a steamer.

Florence has a retail business and wants to increase her stock of goods.

Margret sells firewood and Betty sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Thi Hoa

texts.vi:
Mrs Hoà lives in Phú Mẫn, Chờ town. She collects and sells waste material. Usually she goes door to door to buy waste material then resells to the Recycling Company. This kind of work is hard labor, dirty and potentially dangerous to her health. But this is the main income for her family. With the loan from Binh Minh cdc (SEDA), she will buy a tricycle to transport the merchandise, this will make the work less hard.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoà ở thôn Phú Mẫn, Thị trấn Chờ, làm nghề bán đồng nát. Chị thường đi mua sắt vụn, đồ nhựa nhỏ lẻ ở các hộ gia đình rồi bán lại cho các Công ty tái chế. Công việc vất vả, bẩn thỉu và ô nhiễm nhưng đó lại là nguồn tạo thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với số tiền 2006000đ vay được theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc, chị có thể mua xích lô để chuyên chở đồ đi bán, công việc đỡ vất vả hơn.

loans.use: buys & sells waste metal

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mrs. Seak S., age 49, is a widow and a mother of six children. She is employed by a garment factory making on average $5 each day. Also, two of her children are employed by a garment factory and make collectively $150 each month; two are unemployed; and two are enrolled in school. This loan will be used to purchase a taxi for one of her unemployed children to drive in order to generate additional profit for her household. Since they all live together, this will benefit the entire family.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi to operate a business.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Mrs. Srun S. T., age, 34, works with her husband on her plot of farmland growing rice and raising pigs, making together around $10 each day of income. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farming supplies to expand her crop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farming supplies to expand her crop.

loans.name: Mutundwe 2B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Josephine and Dorothy both sell charcoal for a living. With the extra business profits, Josephine intends to pay school fees for her children. Mariam and Grace have retail businesses and want to use the loan to increase the stock in their shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeun L., age 50, works as a farmer growing rice and various kinds of vegetables, making around $4 each day from her sales. Her husband works as a taxi driver, making around $4 each day in revenue. They have 5 children who are married and live separately. She would like to request a loan of $800 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to increase the output of her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to increase the output of her farm.

loans.name: Kabawo I(A) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Leila is 36 years old, married and has five children. Her husband has a butchery business. Leila owns a public pay phone and also sells airtime cards. She wants to use the extra profits to reinvest in her current business.

Resty has a restauant business and wants to use the loan to buy a refrigerator and saucepans.

Berna sells new clothes.

Milly is a poultry farmer while Aisha sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Thi Nhung

texts.vi:
Mrs Nhung is 42 years old, she is a very social person. Beside working on her rice paddy, she also sells "bánh chưng" (traditional viet food: sticky rice cake wrapped with banana leaves). She is a widow, works hard to raise her child. At first it was very hard then things have settled. She wishes to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients for her rice cakes thus helping her raise her wage. She will be able to make the weekly payment according to th eloan term of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA).

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nhung sinh năm 1966, là một người phụ nữ rất hoạt bát. Ngoài công việc đồng án, chị còn bán bánh tẻ, bánh chưng. Chồng chị mất sớm, một mình chị tự kiếm sống để nuôi con. Ban đầu chị rất vất vả, rồi, cuộc sống 2 mẹ con đã dần ổn định. Chị mong muốn vay một món tiền để mua thêm hàng bán tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Từ việc bán hàng chị có thể hoàn trả tốt khoản món vay hàng tuần theo đúng điều khoản của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binhminh cdc.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make rice cakes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two hair-driers, six seats, and an assortment of hair chemicals, oils and braids

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Action Now: Kenya (ANK) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kabawo I(B) Group

texts.en:
