Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra.N. es la venta de comida la cual la prepara muy temprano en su casa para después proceder a su venta en el mercado. Para poder realizar este negocio, ella compra productos (ingredientes) al crédito pagándolos a la semana y cuando tiene la oportunidad, realiza su compra de contado.

La Sra. Raquel N. tiene 2 años de tener su negocio e inicio con C$2.000.00 producto del préstamo que realizó a un prestamista.

Ceprodel le brindó apoyo por medio de financiamiento por año y medio con 4 créditos otorgados siendo el impacto que han tenido estos créditos de mucha utilidad para su negocio por lo que ha habido un crecimiento en la demanda en su comida ya que ha podido suplir sus necesidades en la compra de los ingredientes de la comida y a la vez ha podido alcanzar un puesto de venta en el sector de las comiderías del mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
José Z. has worked as a mechanic for 15 years in his shop outside of the Santa Ana market in Chinandega. He's the father of 4 children and he started his business in order to support his wife and children. His plans are to increase his business and invest in tools so he can provide better service to his customers.

So, Mr. Z. began working with Ceprodel 2 years ago and has received a total of 12 loans that he has used to increase his business and to purchase tools. His most urgent need is to purchase tools as they are extremely expensive and he doesn't have enough money to purchase them.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

José Z. es un caballero que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la mecánica teniendo su taller en la afueras del mercado Santa Ana en Chinandega. Es padre de 4 hijos y su negocio lo inicia por la necesidad de mantener a su esposa y sus hijos, según cuenta, sus planes son ampliar su negocio e invertir en herramientas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Por esta razón es que el señor Z. acude a Ceprodel desde hace 2 años siendo beneficiado con un total de 12 créditos que los ha utilizado para la ampliación de su local y para la compra de las herramientas de mecánica. Su necesidad mayor radica en la compra de las herramientas ya que son sumamente costosas y él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para comprarlas.

loans.use: Invest in mechanic business.

loans.name: Martha De Jesús

texts.es:
The sale of bread is a very competitive business in the Santa Ana market in Chinandega due to the fact that there are many businesses that sell bread in the market. Martha D. understands this situation as she has sold bread for 15 years in this market with the sole intention of supporting her daughter, who is a widowed mother and who fills the role of mother and father at the same time.

Her greatest need is the purchase of bread urgently to continue her business. It's for this reason that she looks to the aid of Ceprodel who, as of today, has provided her with a total of 18 loans, exclusively for the purchase of bread which she later sells to her faithful customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de pan es un negocio muy competitivo en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega debido a que existe mucha competencia por la venta de este producto. Martha D. consiente de esta situación ha comercializado la venta de pan desde hace 15 años en este mercado con el único propósito de mantener a su pequeña hija ya que es madre viuda y hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

Su mayor necesidad es la compra del pan con urgencia para seguir con el negocio, es por este motivo que acude a CEPRODEL quien actualmente le ha brindado un total de 18 créditos utilizados exclusivamente para la compra de pan para luego venderlo a sus fieles clientes.

loans.use: Purchase bread

loans.name: Telma Alejandra

texts.es:
Telma Alejandra L. is a single woman that for four years, has been working selling food in the Santa Ana market in Chinandega. She knows how to run her business well and in spite of being single, she has been able to, with much effort, keep her home in good condition.

Since she was very young, she has been interested in preparing and selling food, entering into this market to have the responsibility of having her own business. When she started, her booth was in bad condition, without a roof or wall. But since she began receiving loans from Ceprodel, she has been able to invest money to build her business, little-by-little, and at the same time been able to supply ingredients for her food. Her greatest wish is to have more customers so that she can obtain better earnings and reinvest them in the business and in the needs of her children in her home. She has had 18 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Telma Alejandra L. es una dama soltera que desde hace 4 años se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega. Ha sabido administrar bien su negocio y a pesar de ser soltera, ha logrado con mucho esfuerzo mantener su hogar en buenas condiciones.

Desde muy pequeña se interesó por elaborar los alimentos y venderlos, incursiona en este mercado por la necesidad y responsabilidad de tener su propio negoico. Al momento de iniciar su localidad estaba en pésimas condiciones sin techo ni pared pero a partir de que comenzó a realizar créditos en Ceprodel los ha invertido para construir poco a poco su negocio y a la vez para surtir de ingredientes para la comida. Su mayor anhelo es captar mas clientes para obtener mejores ganancias y reinvertirlo en su negocio y las necesidades de sus hijos en su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 18 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Invest in food stand

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga is a courageous and hardworking woman. She works selling groceries in the Santa Ana market in Chinandega. 5 years ago she wasn't able to find work anywhere and went through a difficult economic situation. So, she decided to invest her little savings in the purchase of products to sell in a general store.

Her work day is very long and difficult because in spite of living in Chinandega, her business is very far from her home. Every morning at 6:30, she waits for a bus to take her to the market where her business is located. Her sole purpose for all of her efforts, is to support her family - as she is a wife and mother of three small children.

For 1 1/2 years she has been a faithful customer of Ceprodel. She has obtained 5 loans that she has used to stock more products and in this way, support her immediate family.

Translated from Spanish, by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Dominga es una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora. Se desempeña en la venta de abarrotes en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega. Desde hace 5 años por la difícil situación económica que atravesaba debido a que no encontraba empleo en ningún lado, decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de productos de pulpería para venderlos.

Su actividad es muy agitada ya que a pesar que vive en Chinandega, su negocio está muy alejado de su hogar por lo que desde las 6:30 de la mañana todos los días espera un bus que la transporta al mercado donde tiene su negocio. Todos estos esfuerzos los realiza con el único propósito de mantener a su familia ya que es esposa y madre de tres pequeños hijos.

Desde hace año y medio ha sido un fiel cliente de Ceprodel, realizando 5 créditos que los ha utilizado para surtir mas sus productos y de esta manera poder mantener su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Buy products for her general store

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es:
Gloria began her business with a small investment of $500 cordobas that she had saved up herself. She is a single mother of a son who is in school. 38 long years have passed since she began working in this business in the Santa Ana market in Chinandega in beautiful Nicaragua.

With much effort, sacrifice, and the goal of improving day-by-day the quality of life of her son, she has obtained 30 loans from Ceprodel over the past 5 years. These loans have contributed to the increase of her inventory and variety of seafood products, improving the conditions of her stand, and as a result, have allowed her son to attend grammar school. Gloria has the goal, with the financial help of Ceprodel, to fulfill her biggest dream - that her son will become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Gloria inicia su negocio con un pequeño capital propio de C$ 500 córdobas, producto del ahorro propio ya que es soltera y madre de un hijo en edad escolar. Ya han transcurrido 38 largos años desde que inicia esta actividad en el mercado Santa Ana de la ciudad de Chinandega de la bella Nicaragua.

Con esfuerzo, sacrificio y la meta de mejorar día a día la calidad de vida de su hijo ha obtenido créditos en CEPRODEL desde hace 5 años, durante los cuales ha administrado 30 créditos los que han contribuido en el incremento de su inventario, variedad de productos en mariscos, mejores condiciones en su local, y por ende, permite que su hijo estudie la primaria. Gloria tiene como propósito seguir con el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL para que realice su mayor sueño que es ver a su hijo ser un profesional.

loans.use: Purchase of Seafood

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina P. is a hard working woman who has sold a variety of fruits in the market of Santa Ana in Chinandega for the past 26 years. She is a very happy and humble woman. She began her business with her own savings of $500.00, which she collected over a long period of time.

Today, she is a widow and has no children and so she is looking for a way to commercialize her sales in order to be able to support herself and her humble home. Mrs. Josefina has been supported by CEPRODEL for 4 years, obtaining loans which she invested directly in her business by purchasing fruits, through which was able to make a living and pay her bills. She has currently had 24 previous loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Josefina P. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 26 años se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital propio de C$ 500 obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros propios de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es viuda y sin hijos y por tal motivo debe de buscar la manera de cómo comercializar sus frutas para así poder mantener su humilde hogar que esta compuesto solamente por ella. Desde hace cuatro años, la señora Josefina se ha apoyado de Ceprodel, obteniendo préstamos que los ha invertido directamente en su negocio para la compra de las frutas y sustento con los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente tiene un record de 24 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To purchase fruits.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Liễu, 46 years old, is among the most active members of the TYM Fund, branch number 3. She lives with her husband, a village cadre, and three children in Cao Minh, Vĩnh Phúc. Before joining the Fund, the family was in poverty with a small patch of rice paddy and nothing else. In 1997, a branch of the Fund was opened in the village and she was one of the first to join. Her first loan of 20USD was to buy few piglets and as small capital for a daily buy-sell stuff. After 10 years with the fund, she now has a nice pig farm together with a rice liquor brewery. The income is hefty. In 2007 the net profit for the year was 1200USD. She is happy and her family is extremely happy. They are thankful those loans from the Fund. This time, she is applying for a loan of 950USD to buy more piglets and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Liễu, 46 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên tích cực của Quỹ Tình thương chi nhánh 3. Chị sống cùng chồng, một cán bộ công an xã, và 3 con tại Cao Minh, Vĩnh Phúc. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ cuộc sống gia đình chị thuộc diện khó khăn, ngoài làm vài sào ruộng khoán gia đình chị cũng không có thu nhập gì thêm. Không có vốn để chăn nuôi, trồng trọt nên năng suất thường rất thấp, cuộc sống đã khó khăn lại càng khó khăn hơn. Năm 1997 Quỹ về xã, chị là một trong những thành viên tham gia đầu tiên. Với số tiền vay ban đầu là 20USD chị đã chắt chiu chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ hàng xáo. Sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ với tính cần cù, chịu khó dành dụm cộng với vốn vay chị Liễu đã đầu tư xây dựng chuồng trại quy mô tập trung chăn nuôi, nấu rượu đã cho thu nhập rất đáng kể. Năm 2007 vừa qua thu nhập của gia đình chị từ chăn nuôi lợn sau khi đã trừ chi phí (bao gồm cả các khoản trả tiền tuần) là 1200USD, ngoài ra còn các nguồn thu nhập từ nấu rượu, bán hàng ... Nhìn gương mặt tươi cười của chị cũng đủ thấy niềm phấn khởi, tự tin từ đồng vốn vay của Quỹ. Ước mong của chị và gia đình sẽ tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD mua lợn giống và thức ăn gia súc

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Elsa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Elsa de Socorra G. is the mother of 4 children and together with her husband, works very hard to give them a good education, food and all their other necessities in life. Mrs. G. has run a grocery store ever since she was young and has continued to develop it in the market of Santa Ana, in the city of Chinandega. Her business began as she was going through a rough economic patch, which she tells us was very hard to get through because she didn't know what she was going to do to be able to support her children. And so, she decided to start this business.

With the experience she has gained over time, her business has begun to strengthen and grow, and now she is able to supply her home with it's necessities. She has worked with CEPRODEL for one year and feels very satisfied with the loans she has fulfilled, which have given her more than enough capital to purchase all kinds of products for her grocery store. She has had 3 previous loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Elsa del Socorro G. es madre de 4 hijos que junto con su esposo lucha por brindarles su educación, alimentación y todas las necesidades. El negocio de la señora G. es una pulpería que desde muy joven la ha venido desarrollando en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega. El negocio lo comienza cuando atraviesan una fuerte crisis económica y nos dice que fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos por lo que decide invertir en este negocio.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha podido suplir las necesidades del hogar. Ella trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados cuando mas lo necesita para la compra de todos los productos para su pulpería. Su record es de 3 créditos con CEPRODEL.

loans.use: To purchase items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.en:
Maria Antonia P. is a 46 year old separated woman with two children. Her nineteen year old daughter works on a farm to contribute to the family income. Her son is fifteen and still attends school. Maria has worked in the dressmaking and tailoring trade since she was twenty three and has worked for various businesses. However, for the past eight years she has worked for herself and has operated a business out of her house. She currently has three machines consisting of a five thread over lock, an industrial sewing machine and an embroidery machine.

With the loan, Maria will invest the money in buying bundles of linens for her tailor shop; she will also buy pieces of clothing and cloth. All of these will contribute to greater business and more efficient work.

loans.use: To buy fabric, pieces of clothing, and tablecloths for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega, in the market of Santa Ana, Mrs. Tomasa P. is a saleswoman of plastic products such as brooms, bags, plates, cups, etc.

She has currently worked in this field of sales for 9 years and she works hard from day to day to keep her business up and running. Her sales are the sole support for her two beloved daughters because she is a single mother. Today, Mrs. Tomasa greatly needs to buy more plastic items from her suppliers and to do so she has been using loans made with CEPRODEL. She has benefited satisfactorily from the acquisition of new products and her sales have helped maintain the standard of living of her two daughters. She has had 30 loans with CEPRODEL in the past.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el mercado Santa Ana, la señora Tomasa P. se dedica a la venta de productos de plásticos como escobas, panas, bolsas, platos, vasos, etc.

Actualmente tiene 9 años de tener este negocio por lo que día a día se esfuerza por mantener siempre abierto su negocio ya que de sus ventas depende el sustento de sus dos amadas hijas por el hecho de que ella es madre soltera. La necesidad que cursa la señora Tomasa hoy en día es la urgencia de la compra de los productos de plástico a sus proveedores y para esto ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel que le han beneficiado satisfactoriamente con la adquisición de sus productos y además con el mantenimiento de sus dos amadas niñas. Su record es de 30 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Sales of plastic products

loans.name: Karla Del Socorro

texts.es:
The market of Santa Ana in Chinandega is distinguished by it's many restaurants and places to eat, where different products are offered to customers, who visit the market daily. Mrs. Karla M. has been preparing and selling food here for 38 years from her own space in the market. Ever since she began her business she has felt very satisfied, because, even though preparing food and working with fire can prove to be complicated, she is happy because it has allowed her to support her humble home and her small son, as she is a single mother.

To improve her business, Karla has been working with CEPRODEL and receiving loans that have benefited her very much, improving her profits and allowing her to purchase larger quantities of products. To date, she has had 12 previous loans.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega se caracteriza por ser un local donde existen muchas comiderías donde se ofrecen los diferentes productos a los clientes que diariamente visitan el mercado. La señora Karla M. desde hace 38 años se dedica a elaborar comida y venderla teniendo su propio tramo en este mercado de la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde que inició el negocio se siente muy satisfecha porque a pesar de lo complicado que es preparar los alimentos por el hecho que interactuar todo el tiempo con en el fuego, ella se siente contenta porque este es el sustento de su humilde hogar y de su pequeño hijo ya que es madre soltera.

Para la mejora de su negocio, Karla ha acudido a CEPRODEL para recibir créditos que le han sido de mucho beneficio porque ha obtenido mejores ingresos a raíz de la compra de mayores cantidades de productos para la elaboración de la comida. Actualmente su record es de 12 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hán, 44, is an exemplary TYM member of Cao Minh branch. Her first loan, 30 USD, was used toward a small business of  poultry & pigs raising.  All her subsequent loans were used to expand this business which also includes cows. Her husband brews rice wine and the waste (rice husk, bran), which has good nutrient value, was used to feed the animals. Her last loan was used to build a  Biogas system so nothing gets wasted and she has free gas to use. This enables her to save money which is then re-invested in her business. After a few years of hard work and saving, she has built a 2 storey house worth 15000 USD. Her family living condition has changed for the better. Mrs Hán is an excellent branch leader for the last couple of years. Her contribution is valuable, she is recognized as an exemplary entrepreneur in 2007 which she really deserves. She wishes to remain a TYM member for the years to come, using the loan to expand her business. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy breeding pigs and mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hán, 44 tuổi, là thành viên điển hình tiêu biểu của xã Cao Minh trong việc tham gia Quỹ. Vốn vay ban đầu là 30USD được chị đầu tư chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ. Qua nhiều vòng vốn vay chị đầu tư chủ yếu vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà, bò sinh sản. Chồng chị nấu rượu và tận dụng cám bã làm thức ăn gia súc nên việc chăn nuôi lợn, gà của chị rất phát triển. Vòng vốn đặc biệt vừa qua gia đình đã xây hố Biôga, vừa vệ sinh môi trường vừa tận dụng ga trong sinh hoạt. Việc này đã tiết kiệm được chi phí hàng ngày của gia đình và có điều kiện đầu tư nhiều hơn vào chăn nuôi. Qua nhiều năm dành dụm vốn gia đình chị đã xây đuợc căn nhà hai tầng khang trang trị giá 15 nghìn USD, cuộc sống gia đình chị đã thực sự thay đổi. Ngoài ra chị Hán còn là cụm trưởng giỏi nhiều năm liền của xã. Sự đóng góp công sức của chị với cụm là rất đáng kể, danh hiệu cụm trưởng giỏi tiêu biểu năm 2007 là xứng đáng với chị. Mong muốn của chị và gia đình là sẽ tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn đầu tư vào dự án phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 1200USD để mua lợn giống và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs and fmash

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
For five years, Mister Rodolfo Benitez has sold clothing in the Santa Ana market, in the beautiful town of Chinandega. Benitez has one daughter and must find a way to give her an education, food, good health and a dignified home.

He began his business, selling clothing, with a small investment of merchandise. The strong competition of his business has lead to him acquire larger quantities of clothing, which has allowed him to see a slow rise in his profits.

Benitez has plans to invest more in his business with more merchandise and then commercialize it. He has successfully paid back previous loans with CEPRODEL, and despite fierce competition, his business is thriving, which is why he would like to continue benefiting from the micro-loan system which has helped spur on his success. He has had 6 previous loans in the past year with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Desde hace cinco años el señor Rodolfo Benitez se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado Santa Ana de la bella ciudad de Chinandega. Benitez es padre de una hija que tiene la obligación de brindarle su educación, alimentación, salud y un techo digno.

Comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa con una pequeña inversión en mercadería sin embargo por la gran competencia de este negocio ha ido adquiriendo mayores cantidades de ropa lo que le ha provocado una mejora en sus ingresos pero lentamente.

Los planes del señor Benitez son invertir mas en su negocio para adquirir mercadería para comercializarla. No debemos obviar que con CEPRODEL ha realizado préstamos desde hace un año y a pesar de la fuerte competencia en su negocio ha comenzado a ver mejores resultados por lo que se ha propuesto continuar con estos créditos que le han traído mucho beneficio a su negocio. Su record es de 6 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đỗ Thị Phương, 40 years old, is one of the few members in the neighborhood who have favorable conditions running a business. Right from the day she joined TYM fund, she invested in a business selling pork, pork sausages, knuckes of ham. After a few years, her business has expanded. She now supplies to local restaurants as well as in neighboring areas. She has a lot of customers coming to her shop buying pork and take out food. Her income is quite stable. She has members from her family working for her as well as some of the women from her neighborhood. She is very busy but she always participates in her group activities. Her husband is very supportive of her. They have a 12 years old son. She wishes to remain a loyal TYM member for the years to come. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Phương, 40 tuổi, là một trong số ít thành viên trong cụm có điều kiện thuận lợi cho việc kinh doanh, buôn bán. Ngay từ khi mới tham gia Quỹ chị đã đầu tư vào việc buôn bán thịt lợn, quay giò, làm chả. Qua nhiều năm vay vốn đầu tư có hiệu quả, gia đình chị Phương đã mở rộng việc kinh doanh sản xuất nem, giò chả tiêu thụ cho khách hàng trong vùng và các vùng lân cận. Quán của chị có uy tín với mọi người nên lúc nào cũng đông khách đặt và mua hàng mang lại thu nhập rất ổn định. Do công việc nhiều nên anh chị phải thuê thêm nhân công, gồm anh em ruột thịt và một số chị em thành viên trong cụm, giúp cho chị em có việc làm và thêm thu nhập. Công việc tuy nhiều nhưng chị Phương vẫn luôn tích cực tham gia các công việc chung của cụm, chồng chị rất hiểu và tạo điều kiện cho chị. Anh chị mới có một cháu trai 12 tuổi. Chị luôn mong muốn được vay vốn lâu dài từ Quỹ, mức vay cho vòng vốn tới chị đề nghị là 1200USD.

loans.use: Buy pork, make pork sausages, ham

loans.name: Concepción

texts.en:
Concepción P., better known as "conchita" is a married woman and has three children. Together with her husband, they struggle to maintain their standard of living. For 12 years, she has sold various groceries and other products as a means to support her family. She sells her products all day long, from very early in the morning, until late at night, from her own home in the town of Chinandega.

Because of her low income, she has worked with CEPRODEL for one year and feels very satisfied because she has been able to acquire more products to sell. Through her work, she is able to help her husband support their home and family. She has successfully had 6 loans in the past.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Concepción P. conocida comúnmente como “conchita” es una dama casada y con tres hijos que junto con su esposo luchan por mantener y satisfacer todas sus necesidades. Desde hace 12 años se dedica al negocio de venta de productos varios (pulpería) vendiendo todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega.

Debido a sus bajos ingresos que le genera el negocio, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año y se siente muy satisfecha porque ha logrado adquirir sus productos para su venta y de esta manera apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento del hogar. Su record crediticio es de 6 creditos.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Since 1998, life of Mrs. Dinh Thi L. family was very difficult. The income from her and her husband were just enough to send her children to school. Her only solution at that time was to breed the animals at home. Being encouraged to join the Fund, and realized that the Fund’s working mechanism was suitable for her family, Mrs. L. joined the Fund. Taking advantage of living near a factory, and being sociable, she switched to selling vegetables and food. Her main customers are the factory workers. She has more and more customers and her income is stable now. Currently, her husband is a motorbike taxi rider, helping her repay the money weekly. Her 2 children are workers. Her family income is 320 USD/ month. She would like to be a long-term member of the Fund and borrow more money to expand her business, and increases the family income. This time she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more vegetables and food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Về nghỉ chế độ năm 1998, cuộc sống của gia đình chị Đinh Thị Lượng, 44 tuổi, khi đó cũng rất khó khăn. Lương của hai vợ chồng chị cũng chỉ đủ nuôi 2 con ăn học, chị không biết làm gì thêm ngoài việc ở nhà chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ. Đuợc chị em vận động vào Quỹ, sau khi tìm hiểu thấy cơ chế phù hợp với gia đình, chị đã mạnh dạn tham gia vay vốn. Tận dụng điều kiện thuận lợi là gần cổng nhà máy, lại thân quen nhiều chị em trước kia làm cùng nên chị đã chuyển sang buôn bán rau, thực phẩm. Đối tượng chủ yếu là các công nhân trong nhà máy, lượng khách hàng ngày đến với chị khá đông, thu nhập thường xuyên và ổn định. Hiện nay, chồng chị Lượng hàng ngày chạy xe ôm góp tiền trả tuần, hai con chị đi làm công nhân, thu nhập của cả gia đình hàng tháng đạt 320USD. Tâm sự của chị và gia đình là sẽ tham gia lâu dài với Quỹ để vay vốn lớn hơn mở rộng các mặt hàng, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 950USD để mua thêm rau quả, thực phẩm.

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
Nacatamal is Nicaragua's traditional dish. Making it requires dough, rice, potato, onion, "chiltoma" (a local pepper), meat, tomato, and spices. For 10 years, in the city of Chinandega, Maria Justina has made a living making and selling delicious nacatamales, working at home Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays to make them.

It's difficult for Maria Justina, a woman of few resources, to buy the ingredients she needs to make her nacatamales. Consequently, she's come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make them. It's important to note that she has an established record of borrowing from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El nacatamal es la comida típica de Nicaragua, este alimento se elabora a base de masa, arroz, papa, cebolla, chiltoma, carne, tomate y hierba buena. En la ciudad de Chinandega, desde hace 10 años la señora Maria Justina se dedica a la elaboración y venta de los deliciosos nacatamales el cual los elabora los días viernes, sábado y domingo en su casa de habitación.

La necesidad que atraviesa la señora Maria Justina es que por ser de bajos recursos económicos, le es difícil adquirir la materia prima para elaborar los nacatamales, es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para ser apoyada con un crédito para la compra de estos ingredientes para los nacatamales. Es importante señalar que hasta este momento ha realizado un total de 12 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Maribel Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maribel has a business selling a range of food dishes in the Santa Ana market, near her house in the beautiful city of Chinandega. Before starting the business, Maribel was a homemaker, but she was forced to invest her small savings in buying ingredients to make the meals she sells when her partner fell on hard times and she had to earn a living to support her recently-born baby boy.

For three years, Ceprodel has provided her with a financial helping hand, extending eighteen loans, granted and repaid in full, that have not only helped her improve her business but also supported her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio se de la señora Maribel B. se refiere a la venta de comidas ofreciendo diversidad de platillos en la acera de su casa que se ubica en las cercanías del mercado Santa Ana de la bella ciudad de Chinandega. Ante de dedicarse a este negocio, la señora B. se dedicaba a ser ama de casa pero por la difícil situación económica de su compañero de vida decide invertir sus pocos ahorros en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los alimentos y así poder mantener a su pequeño hijo recién nacido.

Desde hace tres años, ha sido beneficiada por Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado la mano financieramente con dieciocho créditos otorgados y pagados cumplidamente lo que le han beneficiado tanto para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio como para mantener su humilde hogar de habtacion.

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Emma Janet

texts.es:
Emma Janet is single and has a son. She lives in the Escuela Quemada neighborhood. Emma used to work as a janitor in a hotel in the capital city. However, because the wages paid were so low, she decided to continue with her business selling assorted merchandise. She has been operating this business for 17 years and with a lot of hard work she has made it prosper.

Emma sells her merchandise in an market in the city, at her house and to order. She wishes to improve her financial situation, therefore she wants to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes and silver jewelery for ladies. This will enable her to expand her business and continue to accumulate funds.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Emma Janet es soltera y tiene un niño a su cargo, habita en el barrio Escuela Quemada. Emma solía desempeñarse en Mantenimiento y Limpieza de un hotel de la Capital, pero debido a los bajos ingresos que obtenía decidió seguir con su negocio de venta de mercadería variada que con tanto esfuerzo ha ido prosperando y el cual tiene 17 años de tenerlo funcionando. Emma vende en un Mercado Capitalino, en su casa de habitación y también vende por encargo. Actualmente quiere mejorar su situación y quiere invertir comprando ropa, zapatos y prendas de plata para damas, para poder seguir expandiendose y acumulando capital.

loans.use: To Purchase Clothing, Shoes and Silver Jewelery for Ladies

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 28 years old, despite being young, is very determined to invest in making votive objects, which not many people would want to do. At first, she confronted lots of pressure from many people, even when she decided to join the Fund. However, they are now sympathetic with her. They say : “She knows what the customers like and she has a good heart for doing this business.” Her business is going very well and she has more and more customers, especially at the end of the year. Her husband currently does not have so many building projects and therefore, he stays at home to help her. When we came to visit, they gladly welcomed us and provided us details about their business. To think about it carefully, her activity is not too bad and worthy since it helps improving her family life. This time, Mrs. T. wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more bamboo and construction paper.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Là thành viên trẻ nhưng chị Nguyễn Thị T., 28 tuổi, đã mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư vào mặt hàng mà không nhiều người muốn làm, làm hàng mã. Lúc đầu có rất nhiều sức ép từ những người xung quanh, ngay cả khi chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ, nhưng dần dần mọi người đã hiểu và thông cảm. "rất tâm lý với khách hàng và có cái tâm làm phúc" là ý kiến nhận xét của mọi người khi đến với chị. Công việc của thuận lợi, khách hàng đến với ngày càng đông, nhất là những dịp cuối năm nên chị tất bật suốt ngày. Chồng chị đã vãn công việc xây dựng cuối năm và ở nhà giúp chị trong công việc. Anh chị vui vẻ và niềm nở tiếp chúng tôi và cũng không dấu diếm kể về công việc đặc biệt của mình. Thiết nghĩ: Trong thời buổi kinh tế thị trường, khi đời sống được cải thiện thì công việc của chị cũng là một nghề thu nhập chính đáng. Vòng vốn tới chị T. xin vay 950USD để mua thêm tre, giấy làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy bamboo, paper to make votive objects

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia decided seven years ago to invest her small savings, accumulated with much sacrifice, in the purchase of cheese, from which she's built her business. Though a single mother, Cecilia has managed with this small business to support her household and cover the expenses of the business. She's going through a period now, though, where she needs help buying the cheese she will resell and, consequently, she's looking to Ceprodel to help her with a timely loan.

Up to now, Cecilia's business has grown little by little and with Ceprodel's financial support, she will succeed in adding to her sales, offering a greater variety of cheeses such as "quesillos" (a local soft cheese), smoked cheese, "cuajada" (milk curd, perhaps?) and other locally-popular cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Cecilia S. desde hace 7 años decide invertir un pequeño ahorro que con mucho sacrifico logra reunir y lo utiliza para invertirlo en la compra de queso que es el negocio que actualmente posee. Siendo la Sra. S. madre soltera con este pequeño negocio ha logrado sustentar su hogar y cubrir con los gastos de su negocio. La problemática que atraviesa la señora S. es la necesidad de adquirir el queso y por tal razón busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos oportunos.

Hasta la fecha su negocio ha ido progresando poco a poco y con el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL logra aumentar sus ventas, ofreciendo mas variedades de quesos de diferentes tipos tales como quesillo, ahumado, cuajada, queso seco y queso fresco.

loans.use: Buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
For 2 years, Silvia has operated a shop selling general merchandise in the Santa Ana market in Nicaragua's "departamento" of Chinandega. She's married with two school-age children. They're the reason that she works so hard, earning money to support the household, determined that they need not depend solely on the small earnings of their father.

For the past year, Silvia has borrowed funds from Ceprodel to buy merchandise such as cooking oil, soap, detergent, snacks, bread, etc. In short, all of the products that she offers in her shop. Today, once again, she needs to invest in her business by purchasing merchandise for resale and she's applying to Ceprodel for a loan, knowing that they won't fail her. Her record is 6 loans from the lender.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 2 años atrás, la señora Silvia S. se dedica al negocio de pulpería en el mercado Santa Ana del departamento de Chinandega. Es madre casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar. Por tal motivo es que ella se esfuerza grandemente por llevar el sustento a su hogar y que sus hijos no solamente dependan de los bajos ingresos de su padre sino también de ella como madre.

Desde hace un año atrás, la señora Silvia ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel de los cuales los ha utilizado para la compra de los productos tales como aceite, jabón, detergente, galletas, pan, etc. En fin todos los productos ofrecidos en la pulpería. Hoy en día una ves mas necesita la inversión en su negocio para la adquisición de estos productos y para ello es que solicita crédito en CEPRODEL sabiendo que no le fallará. Su record es de 6 créditos con esta institución.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi C., 41 years old, is one among the most active, flexible members. Starting as a small waste collector, and knowing the market well, Mrs. C. has switched her business to becoming a plastic-recycling workshop. At first, her business confronted lots of difficulties, such as: lack of money, knowledge and experience, and especially, lack of support from the local authority and residents. However, with her patience and determination, she now is owning a plan with a mechanic system and around 10 workers. Her products are gladly welcomed and consumed. Her income is 350-420 USD/month. In 2007, she joined the Microeconomic Business Conference and went to visit other provinces. Although her family economy is improved, she never forgets that the TYM Fund is a contributor to her success. She wants to borrow more money to expand her business. This time she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more wasted plastic products. She is currently living with her husband and 2 children in Yen Lac, Vinh Phuc.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị C., 41 tuổi, là một trong số thành viên năng động, nhạy bén với thị trường. Từ việc thu mua phế liệu nhỏ lẻ, nắm bắt được thị trường và nhu cầu tiêu dùng của khách hàng, chị C. đã mạnh dạn chuyển sang việc sản xuất nhựa tái chế trong xưởng tại nhà. Ban đầu việc kinh doanh của chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn như: Thiếu vốn đầu tư, thiếu kiến thức và kinh nghiệm ... đặc biệt là chính quyền và nhân dân xung quanh không ủng hộ. Nhưng với sự kiên trì và quyết tâm, đến nay chị C. đã có được cơ ngơi sản xuất với hệ thống máy móc và gần chục công nhân. Sản phẩm của chị luôn được khách hàng tin cậy nên làm đến đâu tiêu thụ đến đó. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình đạt từ 350-420USD. Năm 2007 chị tham gia Hội doanh nghiệp nhỏ và được đi thăm quan kinh nghiệm ở các tỉnh lân cận. Mặc dù hiện giờ kinh tế đã phát triển nhưng chị C. không quên sự thành công của gia đình có phần đóng góp không nhỏ của Quỹ Tình thương. Chị luôn mong muốn vay vốn lớn hơn của Quỹ để mở rộng sản xuất. Mức vốn vay vòng tới của chị C. là 1200USD dùng vào việc thu mua phế liệu để sản xuất nhựa. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Yên Lạc, Vĩnh Phúc.

loans.use: Buy waste to recycle, manufacture plastic articles

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.en:
Solidaridad is the name of this group of sixteen dedicated women entrepreneurs. The name represents their mission, solidarity in numbers. These women are wives, mothers and businesswomen who want to expand their businesses and their earnings. They are located in the neighborhood of Marketalia and most are dedicated to the sale of goods for the home.

They meet with one another weekly and share advice, stories and loans. When applying for loans together, the women are held more accounT. to pay them back because they are depending on one another. Together they celebrate birthday parties for their children and do various activities outside of work.

loans.use: There are many activities and businesses into which the loan will be invested.  Many women have clothing stores where they provide clothing for men, women and children.  Others sell various goods in their general stores such as cleaning products for the home, clothing, prepared foods, drinks and baking goods.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi S., 54 years old, is one among the typical members of the village. When the TYM Fund became active in Tam Hong village, she is one among the earliest members. Realizing the benefits of the Fund, she encouraged other women to join. She has been investing in husking the rice, and then using the bran as pig mash. Her profit from breeding the pigs and husking rice is 1000-1200 USD/year. Besides, Mrs. S. and her children also collect chickens from other areas and sell them. Her business is going very well, and she has lots of customers. The need for money of her business is so high that she is one among the maximum borrowers of the Fund. Since her business is going well and effectively, she wants to borrow more money to improve the household income. This time she wants to borrow 1200 USD to buy more chickens.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Sợi, 54 tuổi, là một trong những thành viên tiêu biểu của cụm. Khi Quỹ Tình thương về hoạt động trên địa bàn xã Tam Hồng, chị là một trong những thành viên tham gia đầu tiên. Nhận thức được lợi ích của Quỹ chị đã vận động nhiều chị em khác cùng tham gia. Dự án được chị đầu tư là làm máy xay xát gạo, cám bã được chị tận dụng làm thức ăn nuôi lợn. Lợi nhuận hàng năm từ việc chăn nuôi lợn và làm máy xát từ 1000 đến 1200USD. Ngoài ra chị Sợi và các con còn chuyên buôn bán gà, lấy hàng từ miền ngược về tiêu thụ cho khách buôn. Nhà chị lúc nào cũng đông khách đến lấy hàng, thu nhập cũng rất tốt, nhu cầu vốn vay của cô và gia đình cao nên cô cũng là một trong số thành viên vay vốn tối đa của Quỹ. Đầu tư vào dự án rất có hiệu quả, nguyện vọng của chị Sợi là muốn vay vốn cao hơn nữa để phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn này chị Sợi xin vay 1200USD để mua gà về bán.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Alish

texts.en: Mr K. has been running his business for 7 years. He is a resident of Saatly town and has a wife and 3 children who support him in managing their family shop. In his shop, Mr K. sells fabric for dressmaking. Due to the recent changes in fashion trends he wants to buy more fabric of different colours and patterns in order to attract more customers. Therefore, Mr K. has applied to the Saatli branch of Normicro and asked for a loan of 500 USD for a period of 12 months.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase the turnover and buy more fabric of different kinds

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Dominga M. is a 58 year old woman who is married with three children. Although all of her children are grown and living outside of the house, Maria still works everyday in her convenience store to earn income for her and her husband. While her husband is working in construction, Maria is busy making Biscochuelos (honey bread), pies, Empanadas, and other snack foods.

There is great demand for her homemade foods and with this loan she will continue baking more goods for her store and her customer’s craving during the afternoon snack time in Paraguay (called Merienda). Along with buying more ingredients, she will also purchase more general grocery goods to be sold in her convenience store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her convenience store such as sugar, meta, dairy, and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en: Gunduz, despite his young age - he is just 25 years - is very active in his business, which he has been succesfully running for 4 years. He rents a small shop, where he is selling all sorts of household goods incuding some food stuffs and shoeware. His business has been developing well, but to maintain this positive developmen,t Gunduz needs a loan of 1000 USD. He applied for a loan of this size for 12 months to the Saatli branch of Normicro.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods and increase business turnover

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.en:
This committee called San Miguel is composed of 16 women and is strong and united. Together they work on improving their independent businesses in the city of San Lorenzo. Although their businesses are all different, many of them work in the area of crafting and dressmaking. Others sell fruits and vegetables as traveling saleswomen or in grocery and convenience stores.

Today they are coming together to ask for a loan to assist them in paying for their various goods. All wish to make their businesses more profitable so that they may be able to provide more for their families.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like fruits, vegetables, coal, clothing, and reels of fabric.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael G. is married to Juana Benitez and together they have a young son. His business is in the construction and sale of rustic furniture. Before going out on his own, he gained valuable experience working with another construction company.

He worked hard to save enough money to venture out into his own business and he has now has become relatively successful. Now he is working towards expanding his business, hiring apprentices, and increasing his clientele. The loan that he is asking for today will be used to improve his workshop.

loans.use: To increase the size of his shop.

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: Many generations of Natiq's relatives have been engaged in cattle breeding. Natiq grew up knowing how best to do it.  And Natiq's son, who is 12 years old (in the picture) is now getting the training on how to breed cows. Natiq is 36 years old, he is married and has 3 children - all sons. To provide for the growing family, Natiq needs to expand his business, for which he wants to buy more cows. With this purpose in mind , Natiq applied to the Saatly branch of Normicro and asked for a loan of 1000 USD for a 12 month period.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro B. is a 45 year old father with two girls. He is a Chipa vender who gets up very early in the morning to prepare and bake the Chipas so that they are fresh in the morning to sell. He spends his days traveling to try and sell his goods. While he is working as a traveling Chipa vender his wife stays at home selling fruits and ice cream in front of their house.

In order to provide for his family, Pedro is asking for a loan today to help cover the expenses of his Chipa business. With the money he will buy ingredients like eggs, cornmeal, salt, animal fat, and cheese.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients to make Chipas, a favorite national snack.  They are typically made with corn meal, cheese, animal fat, eggs, and salt.

loans.name: Besti

texts.en: Besti is a resident of Saatli town and she is 57 years old. Besti has been running this business for 6 years. She is married and has 6 children. One of her sons (in the picture) helps her with the business. She breeds cows and sells them to the local slaughter house.  Besti wants to increase  her profit buy aquiring more cows. This is why she applied to the Saatli brunch of Normicro for a loan of 500 USD for a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham is a man whose most important responsibility is taking care of his three school-age children. For them, he has worked for the last 12 years buying and selling spart parts for cars, electrical and electronic goods, hardware and plumbing supplies.

He started the business in Chinandega's Bisne market and he's still there to this day. He urgently needs to purchase hardware products and he's approached Ceprodel which, for 4 years now, has supported him with 15 loans that he has used to invest in his business. Thanks to those loans, he has managed to offer a wider range of products and better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Abraham V. es un caballero cuya responsabilidad mayor es la atención a sus tres hijos en la edad escolar. Por esta razón es que desde hace 12 años, el señor V. se dedica a la venta de repuestos y artículos de electricidad, electrónica, ferretería y fontanería.

Su negocio lo comienza en el mercado Bisne de Chinandega y hasta hoy en día se encuentra ubicado en esta localidad. Su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de los productos ferreteros y por tal motivo acude a Ceprodel quien desde hace cuatro años le ha apyado con 15 créditos que los ha utilizado para invertir directamente en su negocio. Hoy en di gracias a estos créditos ha logrado diversificar sus productos y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en: Yasemin is 36 years old , she is married (her husband is in the picture) and has 3 children. Yasemin has lived in Saatli for 15 years. She is an internally displaced person from the area disputed by Azerbaijan and Armenia. Yasemin and her husband have been engaged in sheep breeding for 15 years now. She wants to buy more sheep in order to increase her business profit. Therefore she applied to  the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of 600 USD for 12 months.

loans.use: to expand business turnover

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad López is an energetic woman with a great spirit of self-growth. She started her tortilla business in the el Bisne market of the beautiful city of Chinandega 8 years ago.

It is important to highlight that she started out with $2,000.00 Nicaraguan Córdoba, investing the capital in the business space and in the purchase of the ingredients needed to make tortillas.

Because of life’s misfortunes, Mrs. Natividad has endured difficult times during which she did not have enough money to sustain neither her humble household nor her business. For this reason, she trustingly turns to Ceprodel, which has greatly benefited her for 2 years. She has received a total of 20 loans that have been of great use to her, since they have allowed her to buy greater quantities of the ingredients necessary for making her delicious tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad López es una dama muy esforzada y con un gran espíritu de superación personal. Desde hace 8 años inició su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas en el mercado el Bisne de la bella ciudad de Chinandega.

Es necesario destacar que ella inició con un monto de C$ 2000 invertidos en la infraestructura de su local y a la vez en la adquisición de la materia prima.

Por infortunios de la vida, la señora Natividad ha pasado situaciones difíciles en las que no ha tenido dinero para mantener su humilde hogar ni su negocio. Por este motivo es que muy confiadamente se acerca a Ceprodel siendo beneficiada desde hace 2 años con un total de 20 créditos y según cuenta, le han sido de mucho beneficio por el hecho de que ha adquirido mayores cantidades de materia prima para la elaboración de las deliciosas tortillas.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients needed to make tortillas
